description: One of my favorite late night spots to get a savory or sweet treat in the city. It doesn't look like much as its set up out of a trailer but the crepes are delicious. They have savory and sweet options. I tried a bit of both. Got a strawberry and chocolate sweet crepe and a beef and cheese savory crepe. The crepe itself is made hot and fresh to order. The strawberry and chocolate goes really well with the thin and crispy crepe and tastes even better with whipped cream. The savory beef and cheese was soooo good, its like a large soft taco. Pretty much ground beef and cheese wrapped in the the prefect warm crispy crepe. FYI this place is cash only so hit up an ATM before.
author: Peter P.

description:
Same owners as Crepes oh la la on Polk street. Just as good, but this location is open until 3:30am

My fav is the nutella, banana, strawberry. The crepe is very large.. I could never eat a whole one by myself!

Each crepe is about $8-9 there.
author: Jessica S.

description:
This food truck/stand is strategically located near a number of SoMa bars and nightclubs and therefore seems to exist solely for the late-night crowd. As I like to say, places like this often taste like 5 stars if you're trashed, 4 if you're buzzed, and 3 if you're sober, but I found that the crepes here were tasty and well-portioned given the affordable prices. 

There are lots of options and combinations to choose from, and there's even a modest amount of space to stand or lounge around outside. Crepes, by definition, take a while to make, so don't expect to get your food quickly. Also, remember to bring cash.
author: Vincent L.

description: I showed up there at 3:30 and was meet with them closing up shop. I asked how come half an hour early? And was told early? Sometimes we close at 3. What that's not what yelp claims. So sorry they said with perfectly positive attitudes. Needless to say I'm still hungry. My hubby is having a less then positive reaction to my still having no food in hand. But hey the crepe guys ate so they are in a positive state of mind. And in the end isn't that what really matters?!!!
author: Deidire W.

description: Good food - hits the spot when you need a hot meal. Try the mushroom crepe. Cash only
author: Meryam B.

description:
I've been taking entirely too many jello shots at Butter for nearly a decade, so it's about time I gave thanks for the only reason my hangovers the next morning are about an 6, rather than a 10. 

So thanks, Crepes A Go Go. Thanks for being there at all hours to soak up disgusting, ill-advised jello shots (and bacon shots, if you're into that sort of thing). 

They've got everything you've ever wanted to put in a crepe, so just pick your poison. I'm a savory man myself, but recently a friend bought a sweet crepe and then passed out in the cab on the way back to our hotel, so I did the responsible thing and pried it from their drunk, cold hand...and that was pretty good too. 

In conclusion, all of these crepes are crepey, but none of them are crappy.
author: Peter D.

description: Awesome late-night drunk food. It's open when the bars close, so it gets busy around that time.  They whip up the food fast and serve it piping hot.  The crepes are satisfying and hearty, with an endless variety of filling options.  Very satisfying after a night out.  Check it out.
author: Nicholas F.

description:
We came here for some drunchies after going to dna lounge. 

This is a super popular spot for drunchies and it really sucks that they only take cash.   Everyone ends up scrambling for cash and combining the few dollar bills they might have in their wallets. 

My friend had the eggplant, zucchini, crepe without feta cheese. I had a few bites and it was delicious!! The veggies had alot of flavor and were cooked well. The crepe was also really crispy and yummy. 

I would definitely come here again regardless of if i had drank or not.
author: Tiffany Y.

description:
CASH ONLY LATE NIGHT HUNGER CURE!... it does not matter if you were partying close by or far away this is the place to grab a bite after midnight on the weekends. The crepe usually does not last long enough for me to be able to take a picture of it.... lol. 

We usually have the Nutella Strawberry crepe as it is a no brainer. But recently we tried the King Lias crepe and it was also amazing. The coconut and slight almond flavor was amazing. King Lias might have just become my favorite crepe here. 

Enjoy reasonable prices crepes, available just when you need them.
author: Nipun S.

description:
It was a September night...my friend Camilla & I were in the City for an art show. After being in the area for an hour we decided to leave. But we were hungry. So of course I had to pull out my handy Yelp app to see what spots were the best in the area. This was close enough to us & had excellent ratings. 
We arrived & we were delighted. The line wasn't long. We both ordered dessert crepes. The two employees (who I am guessing are the owners or brothers) were so nice! It was probably closer to 12am & their energy was outstanding. 
After we received our crepes, there was a huge lined that formed! By this time, we were biting into our crepes & we were surprised about how big & full they were. You definitely get more than you paid. & I have never met such nice & energetic people! Stop by for a steal of a deal.
author: Janine C.

description:
Being that I frequent either the DNA lounge or Audio nightclub, I always see Crepes A Go Go out of the corner of my eye. Although I often choose to indulge in some DNA pizza for my late night munchies, this one specific evening I decided to grab a crepe instead.

My boyfriend and I decided on a vegetarian crepe that was filled with eggplant, zucchini, red bell pepper, and feta. I know how busy this place gets, but I guess we got lucky as there was no line and our crepe came out very quickly.

Seating is limited and quite run down, but it's outdoors and SF doesn't have the best weather so to an extent I get it. What I do like is they have a small hot sauce table filled with tons of wonderful options for those who like to get saucy. 

Don't get me wrong, the crepe hit the spot. But at the same time, I don't find this place amazing. Cash only which is another major downfall in my opinion. All in all, Crepes A Go Go doesn't serve the best crepe I've ever had, but fall at my "pretty good" standard. However, I don't see myself ever coming here unless I was looking for something to eat after a night of drinking or dancing.
author: Mars S.

description: My little one brought me here last Friday after having a few drinks and it hit the spot. I had a savory crepe - sautéed peppers & onions, jack&cheddar, and seasoned chicken. They didn't skimp in the meat at all - there was at least 4-5oz in here! The owner was very kind and didn't charge my little for whipped cream on her Nutella strawberry crepe. Overall tally price for 2 crepes was $17 but they were huge and really good! The crepe is thick enough to hold all of the filling so it wasn't as messy to eat as other crepes I've had.
author: Juliane S.

description:
If you're in SoMa and just got out of Butter or another snobby-type bar, you can walk a few steps to Crepes A Go Go for a late night snack. Crepes are one of those things that aren't really that good, but during the right circumstances, they are amazing. You probably know what I am talking about. Can't go wrong, but you're not missing anything if you don't grab one from this stand.

Beware people shooting up drugs.
author: Marlon T.

description: Oh my gawd!! Luv'ed it! Got the banana, Nutella, coconut DELISH!!
author: Ivonne M.

description: Delicious late night snack. Had a lot of fun here. Highly recommend after going out on the area. It's just a truck with a small seated area
author: Shannon D.

description:
When you're in the middle of Butter, a few drinks deep, and your friend looks at you and asks "do you want to get crepes?", there's no way that you say no. Shoutout to Emi H and Taylor S for bringing me a tasting preview and to Shira W for convincing me this was a good idea. 

I've never been much of a crepes fan since I lean more towards the savory breakfast category, but Crepes A Go Go, you changed my mind real quick. Probably because they serve up some of the best savory crepes I've ever tasted. 

I'm not actually quite sure what I ordered... I think it was the spinach, feta, avocado crepe... whatever it was, was freakin' fantastic and just what I needed after a night of drinking. This food cart is perfectly placed right next to the infamous Butter and trust me if you partake in some form of drinking activity, Crepes A Go Go will be your best friend for the evening. 

They've got a small seating area close by - which is perfect for taking a 5-minute breather from the Butter activities.

Beware: this place is cash only. So, don't go spending all your cash at the bar and save some dolla dolla bills for this midnight treat.
author: Issabelle F.

description:
A great spot to grab a crepe to go. Literally! So you can eat it while you drive. And they're open (at least Fri & Sat nights) until 4am!
I usually go with turkey, cheese, caramelized onions, mushrooms and spinach. Delicious and under $9!
They also have a supply of hit sauces on hand. I like Sriracia...
author: Erin L.

description:
I've been to Crepes A Go Go a handful of times now, so I'd like to think that I've gotten a good grasp of this food truck's unspoken rules. Are you ready? Here we go.

1. Be mentally prepared for the overwhelming number of options. They serve all combinations of sweet and savory ingredients known to mankind. If the exact concoction you want isn't explicitly listed on the menu, just let them know and they'll hook you up.

2. Counting calories is strictly prohibited. Don't deprive yourself of the crepe that your heart most deeply desires. It'll be so worth it. Besides, I'm pretty sure all foods become calorie-free after midnight.

3. Your BAC level must exceed a certain threshold to enjoy the full experience. Everyone here comes to satisfy their drunchies after a night out in SoMa. Folks are socializing while waiting in line and hanging out by the couches. Remember, it's no fun being the only one on sober patrol.

4. Fear not the sketchy alleyway. The truck itself is located in the shadiest back street off of 11th. You might have considered showing up armed with an AK47, but just do some bicep curls beforehand. Bigger arms will make you look more intimidating, which should suffice.

5. It's cash only, but you probably already knew that.
author: Miko B.

description: They used to make the crepe wraps fresh, now they are ore made and the guy making them picked a booger and grabbed some cheese. Unfortunately, they've gone down the easy end.
author: Jeff D.

description:
Drove up from the Southbay to see a show down the street and stopped by to get a crepe during a long intermission.  (and an interim cocktail at Butter next door...of course)

I opted for the spinach, green onion and cheese crepe..while my friends got a cheese, avocado and mushroom and a chocolate/coconut/banana dessert crepe.

I know this is a handy drunk munchies spot but I was sober enough at the time that I can tell you that the crepes are actually really good. Crisp and a little chewy, easy to hold and eat, hearty, plenty of fresh ingredients, and the crepe batter itself is slightly sweet (just ever so slightly) so it's a really nice contrast/compliment to the savory fillings.   I was impressed.  

The only feedback that my friend had was that he wishes there was some salt and pepper in the avocado mash, but otherwise...   good stuff.

The folks that work the truck are really nice as well.  Fast and friendly.   I wish there was a similar place in the San Jose area.
author: Shanna K.

description:
Average crepes. 

The Good:
- Open late night.
- Several options for both savory and sweet crepes.
- It has a sitting area, next to the food truck, so you have a place to sit and eat with your group if you prefer that.

The Bad:
- Service can be sometimes slow and not very friendly.
- It used to be cheaper, but they have now also increased their prices.
- They keep their sauces, condiments in the most unclean way, and so it's not a pleasant experience.
- Not easy to find parking around the place.
author: Priyank D.

description:
I've been here before but like ten years ago
It was da  when I was here and it was super busy
But today7/21/17 it was dead as fuck
And I got a savory and a sweet crepe the savory one was ok but my mom can do the same thing in the kitchen with a flour tortilla and had and cheese
The sweet crepe was good but like I said my mom can this at home lol
Probably be another ten years till I'll be back
Maybe lol
author: Rocque B.

description:
Ok, so we are heading to our 'fancy' meal and I do the right thing by our Uber driver and just tell him to pull over on the side of the street he's driving on to save him the hassle of spinning the car around, just so happens, it's Karma....as we are dropped outside this little joint, I'm starving..and make a mental bookmark of it.

I skip dessert at said fancy eaterie to head back here after....these crepes are outstanding...not dry, substantial, full of flavour, and they don't skip on the fillings either.....

I was genuinely sitting on their sofa's in their yard area wishing I'd just come here and saved myself $200...I'd have had an unhappy wife....but the crepes were (almost) good enough for marital disharmony...superb.
author: John B.

description:
The last time I came here was about 5 years ago and I just moved back and went out for a typical Saturday night fun with the girls. 

We went to a bar on 16th and after hit up the crepe truck since it's off 11th for our sweet tooth craving! They have meat crepes too but I ordered the King Lias crepe which has Nutella, peanut butter, strawberries and added bananas and while cream! 

A must when you're nearby, it's decent prices and a cute little hideout.
author: Joyce D.

description:
Great late night spot! Delicioius crepes, with fresh flavors. I really enjoyed my veggie crepe. There was a bunch of hot sauces to the side and we taste tested all of them. I can't remember which one was the best... but don't go for the La Victoria... that one was weird.

Anyway, happy crepe-ing!
author: Yannie S.

description:
On this edition of WhackA$$ Wednesday, I present to you a super weird experience during late night hours (after midnight). I felt like the workers were high or something, because they couldn't seem to get anything right. 

My friend repeated his order several times and they still got it wrong. Since he's vegetarian he definitely didn't order meat in his crepe, but somehow they put ham in there. When my friend asked if they could just take out the ham so he could eat it, they took back the entire crepe and gave it to some other guy who definitely didn't order those ingredients. Wow. Eventually my friend got a crepe he could eat.

As for me, all I wanted was a ton of fruit, so I asked if they could make just a cup of blueberries, strawberries, bananas, and apples. They said they didn't have cups but could put fruit in a crepe. Okay, fine. I was told ran out of blueberries but could add kiwi. Okay, fine. I was able to get a decent amount of refreshing delicious fruit in a crepe, but was WAY overcharged. I didn't realize until much later the amount we had paid for it. $12.50?!? That doesn't even make sense for about 4 mouthfuls of fruit.

I will in no shape or form be visiting this cart after hours, but would possibly give it another try during the day.

TIP: Not recommended for late night.

DATE TIP: Go elsewhere for your evening escapades, otherwise you'll be mystified and confused, and definitely not in the mood.
author: Denise L.

description:
Crepes A Go Go or CREEPS A Go Go?

I am a regular at the amazing bar next door, Butter, before going to see drag at Oasis down the street, so I ordered a crepe beforehand. When the man behind the counter was handing me my crepe, he grabbed my hand and held on to it for far too long with a very suggestive face. The other man behind the counter said "thank you baby" and winked at me. I am disgusted and do not want to be treated that way. The shame is, the crepe was good! However, I will never return.
author: Mariah L.

description: Haven't been here in a bit. Got charged $0.75 extra for a pathetic amount of whipped cream on my banana Nutella coconut. Called out the whipped cream thing, and the clown laughed at me. Usually when I go there's 2 super nice and fun guys who make it feel like a treasure. Tonight it felt like a necessary evil. Boo.
author: Gregory D.

description: Crispy yet chewy bite that you need in a crepe! Chocolate sauce was awesome, no Hershey's syrup so that made me happy
author: Shirley M.

description: We come here all the time and love it here but since they change the guys these new guys are rude. We came at 3:30 and didn't want to serve us and were rude about it. It's not what you but how you say it and they were rude. Won't be coming back here anymore. RUDE AF!!!
author: Gisel R.

description:
I don't usually traverse the city in the evenings, but one of my best friends and I were wandering around waiting for a musical night at a nearby bar. This was one of the places along the way.

I was so jealous of my friend's crepe, which had the most delicious chicken in a crepe I've ever had. It was like a crepe...but also a burrito with chicken...but also a crepe...anyway, the point is, we agreed that it tasted like the chicken her mom makes, and her mom is an incredible cook.

I want to go back and get more crepes. I got a turkey one and while that was tasty, I still dream of the bite of the chicken one my friend got. I must have a savory and a sweet one next time, one in each hand.
author: Robbin A.

description:
- great crepes 
- good sandwiches 
- service is sometimes a bit of a miss, but this totally depends on the stuff thats working when you got there. Since there are mostly two people working one in the kitchen and one on the cash and ordering desk it can be grumpy or great :)

But that did not away anything of the taste of a real crepes!
author: Martin W.

description:
I came here with Nina Y. after having dinner at a nearby restaurant. I was craving ice cream, but most of the ice cream shops still open were too far to walk for my liking. Crêpes were a close second! It wasn't until we walked here that we discovered... it's a food truck! Located next to Butter and Booty, this is an optimal spot to be in business. Very smart.

Since we already had dinner, Nina and I shared a simple crêpe with Nutella, bananas, and strawberries. There was plenty to go around. Within the fenced area where the truck was located, there were hideous dirty couches that I wouldn't touch with a ten-foot pole. Lucky, the public benches in front of Butter were empty, so we sat there.

The quality of crêpes was not mind-blowing but definitely good. I'm glad that I know about this place now, so I can plan ahead for my future Butter and Booty adventures. I'm sure these crêpes would taste even more amazing if I was drunk. Anyways, this is a nice treat to take on the go, or to sit and eat nearby if it's a nice day and you can find somewhere to chill.
author: Stefanie C.

description: The best crepes I ever had! I had egg/cheese/mushroom. Friendly staff and fast service. I'd go there again.
author: Omar S.

description:
Is it late at night?  Are you hangry??  Did your stomach just ingest your spleen???

Great!  You're in the right place!!  These crepes are quick, delicious, and uncomplicated!  The guys who work here are super-polite, friendly, and helpful...In fact, given the drunk bros they have to deal with every night, these guys are practically saints!!!  

The food is made very quickly, and I've never had them get my order wrong!  The prices are cheap by SF standards, and this is a great alternative to the usual late night food scene that's mostly dominated by craptastic pizza, gut-busting burritos, and overpriced burgers that most resemble rawhide!!

I like a crepe high in protein, so I order the ground beef, cheddar cheese, and fried egg crepe.  It's incredibly filling!!

This food truck is in a permanent location on 11th Street next to Butter.  It is WHEELCHAIR-ACCESSIBLE, and if you can't reach the window from your chair, the employees will come out to you.  There's a seating area in the yard in front of the truck, where you can sit and enjoy your crepe.  Mangia!!
author: Amy L.

description:
This place has the best crepes in San Francisco... 

So far my favorites are Cheese, Spinach and Mushroom and for the sweet ones I haven't tried many different options but my favorite so far is chocolate and strawberry and Nutella and strawberry... 

Perfect place for late night cravings...
author: Rupa S.

description: Oh I love this crepe spot on 11th near all the nightclubs! Great for a late night snack. I came by at 10:30 before I went to club Audio to see Oliver Heldens. I had the mushroom savory crepe with cheese. Pretty cheap food. Don't expect too much, but it will fill your snack cravings.
author: Denise C.

description: So cheap, very quick, and tasty. Also friendly and helpful service. What more can you ask for?
author: William N.

description:
There are so many good things about Crepes A Go Go!

First of all, this place will definitely fill your crepe craving. These crepes are huge and just filled to the brim. There is a massive amount of options available. I got strawberry and banana with nutella, but you can make your own. The crepe itself is also cooked to perfection. This is the perfect spot for those late night dessert munchies!
author: Omar B.

description:
I always go for the Savory so I can't really speak for the sweet ones. 

The way to go is to start with a House Special as your base, (Turkey, Egg, Cheese) and then add from there whatever veggies and extras you want. 

Another favorite is Sauteed Chicken, Cheese, Sour Cream, and Jalapenos. 

Awesome stuff, especially for late night eats. 

*Ask for the crepe to be extra crispy, you won't be disappointed.
author: Dennis P.

description:
Wonderful selection of sweet or savory! I have visited this little (and random) spot that operates out of a truck. I've been coming here for many years and have not been disappointed! The guys are great, quick, & are generous with their ingredients. 

So good!
author: Nabrina M.

description:
Kinda janky but kinda cool all at the same time. 

It's this random little hole in the wall. They're a truck but not really?

Sitting area is hella random and pretty dirty. Kinda felt like a badass just ordering there. 

Didn't have much options that didn't contain fruit but ended up getting a Nutella with whipped cream. 

Downside? They pre-make their crepes and just hit it up on a pan using their bare hands  not sure if that makes me sick or have the urge to throw up.... I think both 

It was pretty good but I mean... it's Nutella and whipped cream lol. 

Didn't finish it, and still haven't gotten sick. So I guess it wasn't that bad?

Clean it up, wear some gloves, and look happier. Then you'll get more stars from me!
author: Alaia L.

description: Best crepes I've had!!!  Nothing more to say.
author: Megan M.

description: The crepes are delicious and the staff makes the ordering experience fun as they are sarcastic and fun.
author: Marcus C.

description:
An awesome late night last minute dessert crepe place! They also do savory crepes for those with a bigger appetite. The place is more food truck shaped than a building, and parking is a hassle (street park around the area) but everything else is on point! 

Love me some peanut butter and Nutella crepes!
author: Eka P.

description:
A great spot for a late night tasty quick bite.
Lately I was disappointed.
One disappointment was about the turkey they  use, it show smoked turkey but it was not. And it spoiled the taste of my favorite crepe which is eggs cheese and smoked turkey.
My other disappointment is how messy and dirty the seating are is. I understand this is more like a food truck. But you have a decent seating area so you need to fix it up. Clean it a little, fix the tent on top of it.
I will again but I  won't be order anything with Turkey probably just sweet cepes.
author: Samer E.

description:
Ended up here after going to Bergerac a few establishments down the street. I was pleasantly surprised to see its high ratings on Yelp. We ordered a Nutella and fresh strawberry crepe, and then asked to add bananas as well. Pricing was a bit higher than I would've expected, but I guess that's the price for fresh fruit!

Order took less than 10 minutes to come out. It was huge (pretty much as big as Crepevine crepes, stuffed with bunch of fruit and globs of Nutella, and was nice and hot when it came out. 

It definitely made my night, especially after a poor experience at Bergerac!
author: Erin H.

description:
While not crepes from Paris, these come pretty damn close! 

I love this joint- open late, with tasty and affordable sweet and savory crepe selections and quick food cart service! Always a treat to come and devour a strawberry and nutella crepe at midnight after a concert at DNA Lounge or Slims.

Bon Appetit!
author: Taylor O.

description:
Who doesn't love a late night crepe? Savory or sweet, Dessert or Snack? You can do it all!

It's a food truck in a little alley right next to Butter and across the street from DNA Lounge. Very convenient for those who are drunk/buzzed after a fun night.

I actually came for dessert since I had dinner nearby. I got the King Lias crepe and I added strawberries. The crepe itself is $7, reasonable, but adding strawberries was an additional $2.50. I honestly had no idea extra strawberries were so expensive or else I wouldn't have gotten it. I couldn't find a price for additional toppings on their menu. The king lias crepe was delicious with an awesome medley of flavors and textures. The only thing I didn't like is that they make their crepes on the softer side, it had no crunch to it. And the fact that my delicious crepe was $10. It was delicious but not $10's worth in my opinion. I also like to have ice cream in my crepes which they don't offer.

Cash Only.

This wouldn't be my first choice for crepes, but if I was nearby I would not mind stopping by to get a crepe.
author: Stephanie L.

description:
Seems to be run by new people, the guys who have been there the past several years are gone. 
Quality is a little off, not quite up to the standard set by the former owners. 
No longer open on monday nights for the Death Guild crowd, so stuck with that awful DNA pizza. 
Still a decent late night munchie snack, just not as good as previous.
author: Adrian M.

description: Delicious pancakes with fresh flavors. I really enjoyed it. There was a bunch of sauces and tastes, We have checked all and they all loved it too.
author: Alfred K.

description: Fantastic. Came for dessert and definitely coming back tomorrow morning for breakfast. Hard to find but worth the effort searching for it.
author: Bobby W.

description: Best crepes ever omg. I live in LA and would seriously drive all the way to Cisco for a late night snack.
author: Rafaella W.

description:
I visit Crepes A Go Go exactly once a year: When I'm in town for a work conference and then get absolutely blitzed on jello shots at the neighboring Butter. Crepes make much better drunk food than Spaghetti-Os, so I trek out to this food cart and thoroughly enjoy their offerings. 

These fine folks serve up a decent variety of savory crepes, which I believe are better at soaking up the booze. Sure, there are sweet varieties, but that's not for me. I like meat. Specifically, I like whatever has the smoked turkey and pineapple, it's legit. But then again, I've never had these sober...

They're affordable but cash only, so bring those dollars!
author: Matt E.

description: 10 minutes before midnight I was craving something sweet and thank goodness this place was only minutes away from the hotel and inexpensive. I approached the truck and the two gentlemen there were friendly and helpful. I ordered the chocolate and strawberry crepe with whip cream and my bf ordered the chicken and cheese savory crepe. Next time I'm craving a crepe I will definitely know where to find them. Next to Butter in the Mission district! Thanks guys!
author: Tere V.

description:
Where do I begin!? I was recommended this place by the night club next door. The reviews from the staff were exceptional outside of yelp. 

I had the chicken and jalapeño crepe. Wow. Im no expert butbit pleased all my sensations.

Crispy. Light. Delicious!

Lets go above and beyond: the venue is "cash only" i tried to get cash across the street and the recommended venues. They were all down. Missou "Slim" truly cared abkutbhis product and offered an advance on my eats. This is not normal!! They care aboutbthebproduct over all. It says everything about this crepe shack. 

If i had more stars itbwoukd be the rare recipient. Looking forward to next time.[you will receive a check in the mail] Merci!
author: Foodie 1.

description: Excellent service for late night yummies. Plenty of hot sauce varieties. New menu with updated prices.
author: Veronica T.

description:
Stefanie C. and I decided to come by for a quick crepe after an unsatisfying dinner. We decided to go with the nutella, strawberry and banana crepe. Definitely delicious and filled with fruit. 

I will admit, when we came here, it was a surprise it was a trailer area. There's a parklet you can sit at too next to butter. 

Protip: crepes are decent. cash only I think.
author: Nina Y.

description:
I don't have too many fond things to say about my ex from Trinidad, as most of my quality memories were eclipsed the moment I found out he was cheating on me with a woman in her mid-50's from Minnesota. (I'm just going to have to pray it was a sugamama sort of arrangement and know it has no bearing on my value in life.) 

But one thing that at least somewhat eases my consternation is the fact that he introduced me to the Crepes A Go Go truck. Disgustingly drunk, a sloppy mess, at an unholy and ghastly hour in what can only be described as a semi-somnambulant stupor, I have made my way to this truck by hook or by crook and never been disappointed. (I only wish I could say the same of our love affair.) I always went for the avocado, sun-dried tomato and Jack cheese and would practically cry tears of joy every time my order was called and I (or some other, more sober member of our party) would reach up to retrieve the lil' foiled and folded bundle of joy. That is so much better than any newborn I will ever reach for after hours of grueling and intensive labor. Plus in this situation, I get to eat--whereas in childbirth, only the babe does.

I'm sure they don't appreciate it whenever I encourage my designated driver to double park, flip on those hazards and essentially bump NWA so that I can jump out and get my order started as quickly as possible, but I think almost anyone can be bought with a hefty tip and what I hope was a really dapper wink but probably looked like a mild seizure to the person I was giving it to. No matter, at least I got what I came for. 

I prefer the savory crepes here because I'm just a savory type of gyal but the sweet crepes are divine too! I just happen to be the type of lady that stays loyal and true once she finds something she likes--unlike my ex. But thanks for the restaurant recommendation!
author: Gabrielle T.

description:
Hidden gem in the rough. They offer sweet and savory crepes.

My Verdict: Recommend.
author: Kelvin Y.

description: I've been to DNA lounge quite a few times and never know about this location. My favorite post DNA clubbing location is the pizza right there! After discovering this location today, I have to say there is definitely competition. My bf and I were craving crepes and desserts after dinner so I found this place on Yelp. My bf was hesitant to try since he thought this was the same name as a chain in Berkeley. Then he looked at the picture and realized it was a cart. We then drove here and tried it out. They have a few tables and chairs to relax and sit. We got there and the menu was easy to read- divided into sweet vs savory. On the cart there was also a quick menu of popular savory item. I wanted to try the king Lias which is the "sweetest crepe" it has banana, Nutella, almost powder, coconut, sweet cream and sauce. The total was 7.50 without tax. My bf and I did not know that this was a cash only location so we barely had 8 dollars. On top of the the doesn't like coconut either. We then decided to order just banana with Nutella and whip cream. Unlike most locations, the crepes here are pre made, and the person working there simply heats it up which still came out very tasty. Anyways we got the crepe with banana and Nutella plus some cream and it was AMAZING! I highly recommend coming here. Although I think 5.50 for a crepe with Nutella and banana is a bit pricey- given that trader joes sell 10 cent bananas. But hey he needs to pay rent and for the business
author: Amy Y.

description:
Well I got caught in a major stampede of diareenocerous in the days after eating here, whether crepes a go go was the main culprit of my gastric discomfort however, is up for debate. Regardless, I REALLY LIKE THIS PLACE!

Maybe if was hammered coming out of the bars at 3am instead of coming off a 9 hour night shift, I would give 5 out 5 stars, but sobriety gave me a rare perspective into this business which, as far as I can tell, exclusively caters to drunk people. 

I ordered a #4 special, something with ground beef, scallions, jalapenos and riccota. The scallions were fresh and firm, riccotta was good, the beef wasn't anything to write home about but with fresh jalapeno's wrapped in a hot crepe it was worth the 9 bucks. A kind of college dorm stoner mellange of middle eastern and whatever's-in-the-fridge cusine, this place is authentic and comforting. The hot sauce selection on the back shelf and worn in couches against the fence win extra points for homey irony. feels just like a frat house basement.
author: Max C.

description: Whether you're in Paris, or at a food stand in San Francisco, who doesn't like a Nutella or Grand Marnier crepe. Still, I do also love savory mushroom cheese crepes. The price is right and the location is always interesting to walk around in. Staff was friendly and quick. I'll definitely make sure to come again when I'm around the area. Yayyyyyyy! I'm definitely a fan.
author: Erica B.

description:
Their food is amazing~~~~~ 
I ordered the Chicken, beef with grilled jalapenos and onions. Melts in your mouth. Really great as a late night food. It is top quality food hands down.
author: Chul L.

description: Great for late night grinds. I had chopped beef with jalapeño...similar to Philly cheesesteak - awesome. Friend had chicken and cheese and then smoke Turkey second. Good stuff. Nice staff. Reasonably priced. Well deserved rating
author: Travis F.

description: This is the place if you have late night cravings! This place got everything you need. Their menu selection was great! From desserts to heavy meals, they got it all for you. Though the price might be a little high but it's really worth the price.A must visit place!
author: Brenda L.

description: Great late night spot! Delicioius crepes, with fresh flavors. I really enjoyed my veggie crepe. There was a bunch of hot sauces to the side and we taste tested all of them.  Love this place king lias and house special are my favorites.
author: Matilda H.

description:
Thank you Crepes a Go Go for making me fit to drive last Saturday. 

Le BF and I had one too many over at Butter. After checking out the line for Bootie and not wanting to pay $20 for cover (gettin too old and too much in a relationship for ish like that), we stumbled around the street and realized we weren't really in a state to drive yet. Crepes and their picnic tables to the rescue! 

I can never resist Nutella, so I went for the banana, nutella, and peanut butter crepe. Was seriously amazing. Crepe was light and fluffy, really set off the flavors well. For me it would be hard to mess up a peanut butter/nutella combination, but I think the texture of the crepe really added to it. 

Le BF got a savory crepe, but I was honestly too engrossed in my Nutella crepe to pay too much attention. Pretty sure he enjoyed his too. 

Was delicious and I will definitely be back! :)
author: Courtney C.

description:
Guys are very funny (at least they try to be).
Place doesn't look nice at all, but it seems reasonably clean.

My crepe was the worst ever had in my crepe-eater carrier. I was very close to trash it, but I Was too hungry. :|

No, I don't recommend this place,
unless it is 2 am and you have a monkey on your shoulder insistingly demanding for food. ...you know what I'm saying?!
author: Max F.

description:
I found love in a hopeless place. 

Rihanna- you took the words right out ma mouth. 

Steph Y- you took the crepe right out ma mouth... but it's okay. I know we said we'd share it... like fools. Like damn fools. 

I mean, I feel like we've got a pretty strong bond, but let's just both agree to never test its limits again by sharing crepes. Things could have gone badly had we not decided to brave the rain and the chance of not catching a later cab by leaving our cabstand post to walk back to the crepe-stand for a second crepe, this time with more toppings. Thank gawd. 

Anyway, it had been a long day for and my girl Steph. It started with an 8am chat about what a Bad Santa should and shouldn't do to your naked knee, followed up by several hours of hardcore (in a non-racy sense) group interaction, then some time dedicated to squishing myself into 3 very load-bearing leotards with heavy costume make-up made to look like a member of the ThunderCats posse, then a large work affair where I partook in a single beer because there wasn't room enough for two beers in my gubby with all the leotards capsizing on my organs. Then I changed into less stressful attire and we headed off to a bar where I broke my personal record for most jello shots in a given night (previously set at 1) and had an alcoholic beverage that involved Tang, before heading out to try and catch a cab in the rain, while creepy Cheetara make-up ran down my face. 

A hopeless case in a hopeless place I was. 
 
Until.... 
A Crepes A Go Go (by way of Steph Y's suggestion) saved my life.

It took all of a minute and 15 secs to get a big ole floppy crepe up in my face, and after that, we didn't even make it back to the street before the two of us had torn that ish up like mongrels and agreed that it was far more important that we go back and eat a second crepe than catch a cab back home. #WorthIt

I found love in a hopeless place. I found love and it was a crepe.
author: Candice G.

description: I came here drunk and also after having a dirty dog (that I didn't remember having). Ordered a beef and onion? based crepe, forgot the name for obvious reasons, and the monstrosity came out to close to $10. I only had $9 but the guys working there were really nice and let me have it for $9. 10/10 drunk times would definitely come back.
author: Tina T.

description: I went here with my family a couple of hours ago to drive through the city and see all the buildings. We saw this crepe truck on the street and decided to try it out. When we approached it, there was a menu board with so many options for savory and sweet crepes. The crepes were great! They have so many different options and they can customize it too! The crepes can be carried around and they are so easy to eat and not too messy. They have such a nice crisp on the actual crepes. The only reason I would not give this 5 stars is because my crepe was not the best but I tried my family's and those were great. In addition, the location was a bit sketchy and a little empty. It's not the most convenient location. But I would definitely recommend if you're walking in the city and want a sweet treat.
author: Natalia S.

description:
I go here once a month pretty intoxicated about half the time after a night of fur clubbing at Frolic! 

The crazy thing about this place: the food is as good at 3am as it is 3pm! The crepes are outstanding! My go to crape is turkey, guac, cheese. It is always a winner. But seriously they are all pretty good.

It is cash only, they are open insanely late, and there are lots of good conversations outside. The owner also has lots of fun with everyone.
author: Chris S.

description: This may be the highest rated spot we've stumbled on to yet, and it's easy to see why. The smoked salmon with spinach, avocado etc crepe is an oasis in the desert of late night munchables. Go, go soon.
author: Be F.

description: Come to this food truck, post or pre or mid - drinking to eat huge handheld crepes, swaddled like a baby, filled with cheese and smoked turkey and avocado and onions and/or chocolate and strawberries and bananas and whipped cream and all sorts of awesome, crepe-y deliciousness. What else do you need to know??
author: Jonathan Y.

description:
This place is shady as fuck, but by god it has amazing crepes. It's open pretty late so it usually brings in the drunk, bar closing crowd. The staff is funny when you get them talking, and they have some couches for your drunk self to sit and eat their glorious crepes. 

Just go here already and see what you've been missing.
author: Jessica S.

description:
Oh the life of a cat. the poor soul who finds himself outside of a nearby club, and experiencing some late night hunger. thankfully, some friends had the same idea, and led me to the perfect spot for something that would be exactly what I was looking for!

My friends took me to this little cart after a night at the nearby "STUD" Bar. I have had crepes before, many many crepes in fact from all sorts of crepe places around SF and the bay area, so I was interested to see how this place would fare among some of the others. 

I noticed a menu that had some great savory options so I decided to go for the cheese, avocado and tomato. 

the crepes here are made fast and speedy, and the service is very nice and friendly. this place definitely seems to be hot among the late night clubbers as people from Butter and DNA lounge all flooded over to the little carts hideaway. 

I really enjoyed the crepe here! the ingredients were nice and fresh, and the crepe was served just warm enough to how I like. nothing too fancy in terms of serving, just wrapped in a foil cone, but that's really all you need. 

definitely a great and inexpensive food option for the late night people of the area, and I'll definitely be making my way back here in the future! 

*chirp!*
author: Jei C.

description:
I think the cause of Crepes A Go Go's high rating is the fact that it's located down the street from a lot of bars. In other words, it's drunk food, and drunks like anything... unless they're angry drunks. Heck, a drunk guy even complimented my Ninja Turtle t-shirt. Well, now that I think about it, that drunk at least did have good taste.

I ordered the "Lias crepe," whose description alleged that it was sweetest available, consisting of banana, nutella, and almond dust. Sure, it was tasty enough, but there was nothing that really set it apart.

Summary: Hits the spot, and by that I mean the spot on the ground when you throw up due to alcohol poisoning.
author: Rene P.

description:
Amazing crepes that really hit the spot after a night out at DNA lounge! There can be some lines but they move pretty quickly. I got the cheese, smoked turkey, and egg crepe, which was seasoned really well and pretty large for $7 - I'm getting hungry just thinking about it. They have a bunch of savory crepe options and even more sweet ones, depending on what kind of mood you're in. 

Perfect place to grab a bite to eat and hang out with friends if you're not quite ready for the night to end yet :P
author: Marie H.

description:
I can't believe I've lived in San Francisco for 3 years and have not discovered this perfect joint for after-the-bar-closes hunger that is open til 4am on Fridays and Saturdays and next to DNA Lounge and Audio. It is almost hidden but there is a nice sitting area. 

The sweet crepes I've had exactly the same elsewhere, but what I really recommend is the one with the jalapenos- it's was amazing. I think it was the #4 special. Their savory crepes are really my happy place after midnight.
author: Vy T.

description:
YUM YUM made a stop here last night after a show in SF, savory and sweet crepes are both awesome! Got the strawberry/chocolate/whip, husband got the banana/Nutella... Also had one with chicken, next time I'll stick to my normal tomato/cheddar/spinach as the chicken was dry and too plentiful!

Fast, pleasant service and the best crepes in town! Overall, 5 stars! (Chicken: 2.5 stars)
author: Lisa D.

description: Perfect for the late night after party craving....quick and simple plus your options of sweet or savory. Only downside is that its outdoor-foodtruck-seating that can be freezing late nights. other than that, no complaints
author: AQ N.

description: Delicious crepes & owned/operated by super friendly family. Only downside is hours and atmosphere but the hole in the wall places always have bomb food! Favorite order: butter, sugar, strawberries, bananas and whipped cream! SO GOOD!!! (They also own Crepes Oh La La on Polk).
author: Alyssa M.

description:
Perfect late night joint...smack in the middle of all the clubs and bars. They must make a killing in profits.
Crepes -- to die for. Get the nutella crepe with extra nutella. And whipped cream, of course!
Would recommend this to anyone, drunk or sober
author: Laura S.

description: So you go to Butter, DNA Lounge, Holy Cow or Audio and in the middle of all the alcohol there is the perfect little gem that hits the spot in a whole different way. You want some avocados with sriracha or you just want to fill up on some strawberries and nutella...................bruh they got you. There options are super versatile and if you're too drunk they have picnic table seating and bless them for being open till 4AM and the best part is that my $7 goes to a perfect portion and flavors. As I write this I'm calling an Lyft to go get me some.
author: Ankita C.

description:
This place was SO satisfying after a long night of drinking next door. We walked out of the bar and I wished I could have gotten street meat (Seattle staple). Not something you find on the streets of SF, but crepes worked! You can't be picky when drunk and hungry.

I ordered the turkey, with 2 eggs, and cheese! I'm not even sure if we got the right order. The guys in the truck like to mess with all the drunks. Pretty funny, but I wasn't sober enough to be aware of that fact. Luckily I wasn't a victim. We went up to the window and asked if our number was called. They called someone's number (may have been ours?) and we just took the crepe in his hand. Oops! Tasted good nonetheless! Lesson is, send the most sober person in your group to order/get your food! However, for my experience- no regrets!
author: Eva C.

description:
Got the banana and Nutella with whipped cream. Delicious, of course. The only reason I'm giving 4 stars instead of 5 is because they only take cash, no credit or debit. 

It is open late, which is a plus!
author: Daysha S.

description:
Floppy and rubbery pre-made crepes. Asked the guy to specifically make me a fresh crepes and he said he would so I trusted him but when I got home I found out he lied to me and gave me these horrible, old, pre-made crepes. Not to mention he's stingy with the filling. I paid $20 for 2 darn opposite-of-delicious, mushy, second rate crepes!

I understand that you get slammed by the club spill offs but when I came it was NOT busy at all. I'm just pissed off by how he freakin' lied to me. 

If you want to try these crepes, make sure that you get the fresh crepes. Watch them make your crepes fresh. Waste of money.
author: Aina L.

description:
I was craving a crepe and found this place was open late. 
it was my first time here and i was shocked by the small food truck but OMG!!!! Was the reaction I had after tasting one of the crepes here. 
I got a banana, almond and nutella crepe and it was BOMB!
The service was good too. The crepes were delicious 
I would totally come here again.
author: Yasuko R.

description:
Don't let the food truck fool you. These crepes are amazing.

Perfect for the after club scene, Crepes A Go Go is a staple for either going between clubs, or when you're ready to end the night out having fun with a warm and delicious crepe.

The line tends to be a bit long, but that's due to their success amongst San Franciscans as being some of the best late night crepes you can have.
author: Dan L.

description: I should preface this with, "I wish I could give zero stars." It's unfortunate when these dumbasses don't care if they help you or not. We waited half an hour to make an order on a dead night..and they kept ignoring us. It's apparent that they're not too concerned with staying open.
author: Emmanuel S.

description: We came here thinking it would be amazing based on reviews, but boy we're we wrong. First off the place has inspection decals from 2014, but where is 2015 & 2016? They do not make crepes fresh, they are pre-made and reheated when ordered. We ordered four, one of the four was the apples and brown sugar crepe, it was literally that, chopped apples a mountain of brown sugar folded and handed over. We only realized that after eating our crepes that he never washes his hands after handling money!! He knows nothing about crepes, so I can only assume it's under new ownership because they should not be receiving good reviews. Two out of our 4 people got sick, so I say avoid this place like the plague!!
author: Patrick F.

description:
What an ideal after-hours/post drinking spot conveniently located a street from my bldg. Although, I am rarely a fan of late night eats that involve a carb overload..my friends had to eat and so they ended up trying it and I had a little and it was all pretty good for that late hour!

There will surely be a line past 1am...you can bet on that! The line takes a good 20-30 minutes because you have to think about the fresh crepes they are actually making at the window. My friends ended up getting a sweet and savory to satisfy their late night cravings. I had bites but didn't eat it myself but they seemed to like it. They got a sweet, banana-nutella crepe which was delish! The other crepe they got had meat, and cheese in it and they seemed to like both. 

They are seriously huge! They aren't so pricy either $5-6 depending on what you get. It's totally a great late night post drinks food...better than pizza!
author: Priya S.

description: Seriously the best crepes ever! They are huge, so when folded, provides layers and layers of wonderful soft, doughy deliciousness. I'd recommend the cheese, turkey and cranberry...soooo freakin good.
author: Stephanie L.

description:
This truck is (permanently?) parked in a somewhat shady part of SOMA that happens to be filled with a number of late night haunts for those who enjoy dancing and/or imbibing in liquid poetry (or firewater, depending on which place you frequent). I don't know about the rest of you, but my friends and I usually find ourselves seeking quick and convenient calorie-heavy food at some point during/after.

Enter the Crepes-a-Go-Go truck. It's open until 3AM (or at least was when I used to frequent it) and offers you a convenient handheld solution. Who needs the hassle of a fork when the world is spinning around them? Not I! 

Once you've tried and loved it, it's hard to stray from the classic Nutella-banana sweet crepe base. To mix it up a little, sometimes we add cinnamon and strawberries or coconut. Everything has turned out delicious, and while the credit may largely be due to the Nutella, Crepes-a-Go-Go makes a darn good crepe base and matches your Nutella with just the right amount of complementary toppings. They don't match up to the gourmet crepes I've tried in other cities near and far but they're certainly a great & easy choice for under $10!

We have yet to try the savory crepes at this location, but many in my company have tried it and devoured it with the passion of a starved wildebeest. Looked good to me!
author: Asha S.

description: I used to love this place but the last two times I've went it's just not the same. Not sure if it's the quality or that I wasn't drunk the last few times but I'm sad they're no longer up to par.
author: Alana H.

description: So I've been dying to try this place!! I read the read the reviews... so excited they are going to fill my crepe expectations... and today was the day I finally had the too grab one. First sign was the chocolate sauce was like 75¢ more than nutella ... then I look strawberries are 2.75 to add in your crepe some more dollar I could of had a whole carton.  but that was the least of my worries tonight. Beside it taking almost 45 minutes for my crepes With 1 person in front of me. I paid for a banana nutella crepe..wit whip. I didn't taste a banana til about 3/4 of the way and by that time there was no whip left..so there was just a overwhelming amount of nutella at the bottom. I ordered the same thing from crepe temptations on Judah at it was excellent. The whipcream was evenly distributed with banana and nutella so you don't miss Anything in a bite. This place it over hyped it has to-be the worst crepe I had. I don't even think I ever had one this bad and it's sad cause it had so many good reviews I expected more.
author: Jocelyn T.

description:
This is a great crepe place to visit for a late night snack in SoMa. The sweet crepe with butter and sugar is superb and just like crepes in France. 

I would definitely return here.
author: Ryan L.

description: Delicious, substantial crepe. The cheese, mushroom, tomato kept me dancing all night. Staff here is super friendly. Thanks for the crepe!
author: Andi M.

description:
After working an event at the nearby DNA Lounge I was feeling peckish and wanted to get something sweet before heading home. Hidden away on 11th St next to Butter was the crepe truck. $2.50 for a simple sugar and butter and crepe sure hit the spot. Since the crepes seemed to be made ahead of time (there was a visible stack of them) they only had to put together the toppings and off we go. 

Kinda like how expect European street food to be. Unfussy but good.
author: Jean K.

description: Great crepes at a reasonable price. The Nutella with fresh raspberries is the bomb -nom - nom. There's a parklet nearby and the cafe is located close it a few bars and restaurants making it ideal for a late night dessert / snack.
author: Anthony N.

description:
Perfect for those drunchie cravings late at night. Their vast selection of savory and sweet crepes made me tempted to buy multiple items but I refrained because the crepes looked filling.

The cash handler was silly and tried to trick me into believing he couldn't serve my chives and cheese order and I totally fell for it! Always gotta appreciate when people make their job a little more entertaining.

The crepes are freshly made and the shell tastes great! The chives they served in my savory crepe was either raw or close to raw so it wasn't up my alley at all. Will get something else next time and hopefully it'll be better so I can bump up my ratings from 4 to 5 stars :)
author: Karen M.

description: So good.   Every time I am in the area I go here.  Sweet or savory they have you covered.
author: Starr b.

description: all i can say is: mind blowing!!
author: Melody K.

description:
I've been drinking for a long time. During the course of my misadventures, I never knew that, perhaps, the perfect compliment to a belly full of booze was a crepe. Yes. A crepe. I have had my fair share of pizza, donuts, cookies, yogurt, ice cream, cake, cupcakes, salty, bitter tears, and coyote mornings to accompany my occupy my post-drinking hours, but I'd never opted for a savory crepe.

I was missing out.

Now, I will admit that it's entirely possible that my opinion of my chicken, tomato, garlic, pepper, onion, and cheese sensation was colored by the previous five [reading over this review, I'm pretty certain I need to check-in to a facility] hours of partying and imbibing, but I don't think so. For less than $7, I was treated to a large pocket of savory street food goodness in no time at all. I recall thinking with every bite, "Can this really be this good? I mean, this is really good. I've never eaten a crepe like a Hot Pocket before. What time is it?"

There are many (many!) bad choices one can make after hours of drinking. Listen to me kids: I've made a few (lot?) of them. This is not one of the bad choices. You will not be screamed at by Clair Huxtable for having big fun with The Wretched for eating one of these crepes. Good food. Late night. No consequences? I dig it. So will you.
author: Johnny T.

description:
It was Friday night and I was planning on staying in. I was tired and sore from the gym, but my friends decide to kidnap me and make me fat. First stop was Arang, then it was Kowloon Tong, a round of pool at Family's and then Crepes A Go Go.

I absolutely LOVE the fact that they are open until 4am since it was 3:50am when my friends and I arrived at the truck. I ordered a nutella and strawberry crepe while my friend got the king lias. The guy making our crepes asked us if we'd like any whipped cream and we both answered yes. He said it cost $2 and I replied that the menu said $.50! He said he wasn't going to charge my friend (that was a male) but he was going to charge me instead. I asked why and he said because he wants to charge the pretty girls. LOL, how do you have these jokes at 4am...

Crepe was freaking delicious and the guys running the truck were nice. I'll definitely be back.
author: Mabel Y.

description:
Well, you would think you can't go wrong with a banana-nutella crepe. 
Well, you are right. You can't really go wrong.
But Crepes A Go Go did go wrong. By giving us a pre-made crepe, versus making one upon placing the order. Ergo, the crepe tasted extremely egg-y.

I loved the one on Polk street. 

I don't know why you'd be lazy enough to serve a pre-made & reheated crepe to a customer. This location probably got away with the multiple stars because of the fact that it's located close to many bars. Therefore, folks with munchies. That would eat anything slapped on with nutella. 

Hell, I would too.
author: Ranjani S.

description:
This is by far one of the best food trucks in the city.  Fat crepes sweet or savory. I've been known to get two crepes because I can't decide. 
Hot and really good. . Fresh ingredients and nice guys at the counter. Expect a line at night during weekend. .
author: nancy w.

description: Holy cow!!! What a great place to stop by to eat and chill after hanging out in North Beach. 4 stars and not 5 because they are pretty expensive.
author: Chau M.

description: This is a probably a horrible experience it was very dirty very disgusting the food was not good wip cream was all melted I don't know about this place I don't know why everybody raves about it but I will be honest I will never return I feel like there's germs all over it
author: Hanna G.

description: They literally just served me a crêpe with only pineapples instead of what I actually ordered. Wtf dudes?!!
author: Jorge O.

description: Their crepes are so delicious! Service was fast and friendly. We got a sweet crepe and a savory one and both were delicious. Good portion size as well. Locate conveniently next to some bars
author: Rebecca T.

description:
Quality crepes! Especially when you're drunk or just leaving the bar or club late at night on a Friday or Saturday.

One person behind the counter was pretty funny cause he was trolling the customers by teasing them and not handing over their crepe lol.
author: Alex G.

description:
They have both savory and sweet crepes with a bunch of different options for fillings. You name it, they probably have a filling combo for you.

I had the Chicken with cheese, garlic, onions, and bell peppers. It didn't disappoint. It was perfect to coat my stomach before the sugary drinks next door at Butter. 

For about $5 I had a great snack that could be considered a small meal. I will return when in the area. Bring cash and a big appetite.
author: Justin C.

description:
For the price, time of day and level of happiness it provided, I will give it a 4 star! 

Delicious crepes at 2am in SoMA, what more can you ask for?! 

Of course, they have both savoury and sweet. Delicious and it took the chefs only 2 min to make them - not much of a line.
author: M. N.

description:
Heard the craze over crepes a go go many times before, but finally got to try it last Saturday.. totally lives up to the hype, it was delicious!!

BUT... I feel like they need to sell fries with their crepes! (Does anyone else feel this way?!) I even suggested it to the owner, but he laughed it off like I was just looking to fulfill my binge drinking munchies.
author: Diana K.

description: The best crepes to go in SF hands down. I could eat hear breakfast lunch and dinner it's that good. Highly recommend trying if you're a crepe lover. Sooooo goooood.
author: Brian W.

description:
After a fun All Hallows Eve - Eve (ie the Saturday night before Halloween) with great West Coast friends, as well as the PE exam in the morning for me, we needed to fuel up. When we decided to stop by here, I was expecting an actual sit down restaurant, since I have been sadly deprived of the food truck experience back home. 

Awesome is the only word to describe it. You place your order with the cashier, and get to watch masters at work preparing your goods in awesome assembly line fashion. Once your piece of heaven is ready, the manager calls out your number in a hilariously theatrical way.

One bite of a strawberry / banana / nutella cupcake and I was back to life! We need this place back home!!
author: Sergio F.

description:
$15.25 for two crepes?!? 

Geez, seemed kind of a rip off. It's the darn up charges that make it costly. I had the chocolate, banana, & strawberry crepe. I asked for fresh strawberries instead of strawberry sauce and the guy suggested nuttella too. I said sure why not. It should have been $5 but ended up being $7! Then Shirley N. orders a chicken, cheddar jack cheese, & mushrooms and that was $8.25...

I wish Genki's was open because their crepes are freakin' awesome. And super cheap. I have to admit though, these crepes are good. Crunchy on the top and soft on the bottom. They have a cart full of condiments to your crepes desire. 

Great for late night drunks to grab a bite to eat. But it is CASH ONLY!
author: Angeline H.

description:
There are moments of haunting revelation when you realize you have become your own father. I had one of those moments when Jamie W. and I went to Crepes a Go Go late last Friday night. We just came out of the Sloan show at Slim's across the street and had a severe case of the munchies at 1AM. I remembered the raves this place gets on Yelp, so...

When we came upon it, it was swarming with the youth of America, club-friendly like an Old Navy ad in Cosmo Girl magazine. There was a particularly loud group of teens with apparently ruptured eardrums since they were talking at the top of their lungs and making sure every other word was an expletive. The voice of one girl with high heels and minimal boobage had the less-than-pleasing sound of a car alarm that just wouldn't stop. Make her stop.

When we finally got up to the order window of the trailer, I requested the $5.25 Nutella with Fresh Strawberry and Jamie had the $4.50 Nutella with Banana. The all-Gallic crew of three prepared the crepes quite efficiently - folded into a quesadilla shape and filling them to the brim with the ingredients. Deliciously sweet. But at that time of night, all you hear are car alarms. Oh wait, it's her again. My ears are bleeding. Rotten kids.

FOOD - 4 stars...a fine streetside crepe in the middle of clubland
AMBIANCE - 3 stars...it's just a trailer, but they have a bench and chairs if you yell dibs
SERVICE - 4 stars...they have their routine down with none of the French attitude
TOTAL - 4 stars...a viable late-night stop...if you just passed puberty
author: Ed U.

description: In this desolate part of town, there's not much open after 11pm. So where to go? Crepes A Go Go on a mid week show it's pretty light. I can only imagine if Friday and Sat night prime time drunko time is like. Got a solid smoked turkey and cheese. Tried a friend's nutella sweet crepe too. Straight up unfussy handheld foods for your late night munching
author: Kim N.

description:
It took staring at what is currently photo #17 of #77 (the menu!) to remember which crepe I had downed like it was my job after a night of getting oh-so-elegantly wasted on shabby chic concoctions at neighboring Butter. Much more important than the name, this crepe legitimately saved my life. After a cab ride which had me uttering, "oooooooh my god, I'm going to be so sick tomorrow," I woke up with nary an ache and my roaring 20s costume complete with fishnets and false lashes fully intact. 

That is one hell of a crepe, and one hell of a night.

The magical concoction of protein (smoked turkey and egg), carbs (the namesake thin pancake) and oozing fat (oh hi, cheese) inexplicably soaked up two Jello shots, a Long Island Iced tea made with Welch's strawberry soda, a Hawaiian Punch and Malibu Rum cocktail and quite possibly, one more plastic cup of evil ready to wreak havoc on my insides. I should make mention that the hunky crepe was easy on the palate, too. 

Lesson learned? Excess + pre-slumber nutrition is a combination always worth exploring, though results like mine cannot be guaranteed unless you eat at Crepes A Go Go. Carry on, 'cause life is worth Buttering!
author: Jelena Z.

description:
Across the street from Bootie. Tasty savory and sweet crepes. What more do you need to know?

Ok, they're not mind-blowing crepes. But they're pretty good and sufficiently satisfying especially when you're not feeling the usual bar food. And I can vouch for the taste having tried them while pretty sober!
author: Amy X.

description: Yup. The best crepe place in SF. I always get the house special and it is super filling and the best crepe unless compared to other crepes a go go places... Good texture and chewiness for the crepe skin.
author: Roland L.

description:
My judgment was compromised, not by intoxication from a glass of R&C, but by the warmth of  that enchanting crêpe. I had never felt so fuzzy under the piercing spring rain.

It was a house special - a generous crêpe with ham, eggs and turkey carefully folded in melted cheddar cheese. 

I could find a million flaws in this creation if I want to. The batter could have been lighter and fluffier. The saltiness of the ham and the tartness of the cheese could have been more balanced. None of these really mattered. I relish this crêpe just as much knowing perfectly well it wasn't the most exquisite.
author: Mona W.

description:
I wouldn't call the crepes here, "crepes".  Crepes are supposed to be paper thin, but the "crepes" here are more like thin pancakes. 

Since they don't servce ice cream, I opted for a salty crepe.  Got the #2 house special which has spinach, caramelized onions, sun dried tomatoes and feta cheese.  It was so messy!  The spinach juiced everywhere and the feta cheese crumbles fell all over the place.  I think the "crepe" would have tasted a lot better with some melted cheese.  The insides also didn't have much flavor so I ended up just eating the skin. 

Also make sure you don't go right at 6.  It says they open at 6... But it just means they open up their gate at 6.  They clean up and set up and officially open more towards 630.
author: Tina L.

description: Pretty good crepes.  I like that this place is open super late in a city that tends to close rather early.   I liked that they let me go off menu on my crepe contents.
author: Michael E.

description:
jesus tits...just like any vice can be met in this town granted one has the means.  this place next to butter is proof any food item you crave, reminisce or can think up is also made available

it wont take ya back to champs elysees anytime soon as it remains gritty soma.  however it will satiate ya and is a fun snack.

one gripe is making sales tax inclusive into the set price would be nice.  always makes me wonder...whose charging, whose receiving, whose not, etc

another is the smart alec making the crepes monday evenings.  seems self entitled to tips or hustle ya on change.  here's a tip, get a higher payin job guy.  no smile, no merci, no si'l vous plait, no bon apetit, no zest for life.  just a know it all who wants extras based on those merits.  whens it stop, if i put a tip jar at my cubicle i'd be called into HR

that aside my crepe was bon, now where da underground foie gras truck at?
author: Clark G.

description: If your in the city or near the city, this is a must go to spot! They have variety of options on the menu. If you want something sweet they have an endless option. If your craving something more filling and dinner or breakfast like they have it on the menu as well. The price is decent for a bit pricey but its totally worst going. It is a food truck and outside but they do have a seating area near the truck. After the bar or late night cravings this is the spot!!
author: Keisarina H.

description: These are the best crepes in the city. They have a huuuge selection of both sweet and savory toppings. I'm a savory gal myself. Their smorgasbord of hot sauces  is the perfect accoutrement for a cheesy late night crepe. I know I'm in trouble if I end up at Audio or DNA late on a Saturday night - I know that crepes are in my near future. Resistance is futile.
author: Kelsey S.

description: Looked a little questionable but definitely had the crowd to secure is legitimacy. For now I will have to give 3 stars but it might have just been what I ordered.  I can't remember exactly what it was but it had chicken, cheese,  bell peppers, and something else in it. Sounded and smelled good at the time but just wasn't quite what I was looking for when I tasted it.  Great serving sizes tho. I would definitely try them again but maybe stick with my sweets instead of savory.
author: Tea L.

description:
We were obviously doing it wrong when Katherine L and I showed up completely sober - but which no other interesting options available to satiate our hunger at 1am in SOMA, along we came, settling in line amongst all the drunks that were slowly trickling out of the clubs along the block. 

Twenty minutes (the lines were fairly short, but the waits were pretty long around this time) and a shared strawberry nutella and cheese, mushroom, turkey crepe later, our satisfied tummies made their way back home. 

I do have to give props to the people who work here though, both for their patience and good humor in dealing with all the drunkards. And if nothing else, if you come here sober, sit down, eat your crepe, and get some kicks out of people watching.
author: Johnny W.

description:
The location to this place is very odd....very easy to miss. I drove by this place a few times before finding it. I wouldn't have found it if it wasn't for some yelpers who mentioned in their reviews that this place was next to Butter. 

Surprisingly, this place was pretty busy when I got there around 1130PM, but the service and wait was pretty fast. I can't believe such good crepe can come out of a truck like this. I ordered my usual strawberry, whip cream, and nutella while my cousin got their house special savory crepe. Mine turned out good..even though the wrap got kinda thick and sickening towards the end but I still enjoyed the crispiness at the beginning. The house special savory crepe wasn't that great. It was a bit too cheesy and we ended up throwing it all away after 3-4 bites into it. 

There was a small stands on the side of the truck where they have sirachi, hot sauce, and like other sauce where you can customize your crepe which I find pretty interesting. Maybe it was just me, but we were all pretty scared in the car around that time in SF. There were just many random people there. I don't know if I am willing to go back here or not. Overall, the crepe wasn't that bad...well the fruit one wasn't anyways. But I really do agree with others that the batter could have been better...I would like it to be lighter and fluffier =]
author: Ngoc L.

description:
Could the location for this place GET ANY BETTER? For me, and for them...I assume. 

Parked unassumingly next to Butter (please forgive me, I have sinned and went back!)...as the edges begin to blur on your life, you just check out...and pop over to this parking lot cum cafeteria. Crepes! Crepes! So many flavors and combos...who woulda thunk I could've gotten a fresh, cheesy crepe with spinach and bacon at 1am on a Thursday? 

You can even bring the crepes BACK to Butter if you want...saying perhaps you maybe ate your colleagues crepe while they were in the bathroom and you need to get them a replacement. It may or may not have happened, but either way amends were made right quick! 

It quite literally saved my buttery life. Could've been a rough morning if I hadn't had a few crepes in my life the night before. Butter, goddamnit. 

*cash only. 
*price range from $4-$9. 
*made quickly
author: Colleen C.

description:
BOMB DIGGITY Crepes in a sketchy part of town.
SHADY ASS part of town- it's expected in the Tenderloin.
I grew up in the ghetto but this place gave me some mini chills! 

We got to the crepe truck past 1 AM and goodness, who's sober? ME! And the people serving the crepes (maybe).

The guy who was taking orders and handing you your food, he was quite the jokester! When your food is ready, duder is suppose to hand it to you and you reach up and grab it from him, right? Well, that's what happened, but he would make it seem like he's handing it to you, but then retract, then repeat- 15 times! HILARIOUS! He made you work/earn your food! 

I saw it happen to the guy in front of me, I thought, ok not intentional. Maybe drunkie in front of me was so drunk that the duder wanted him to wait. NOPE! Fooled me! Shoot, same thing happened to me. Duder does it intentionally for laughs! 

Finally got a hold of my crepe- savory cheese, spinach and egg. I can't say it's the best-damn-crepe I've ever had. It was pretty darn good coming from a truck. 

I can see how this would be a great spot to stop by as a nightcap of festivities.

Gets crowded after 130 and the line moves, just beware of the volume of drunkies if you're concerned haha. I wasn't!
author: Kim O.

description: Awesome! Its a food truck and has a couple of sofas. Great creps. Got a nuetlla bluebarry
author: Mohamed N.

description: Great late night food spot. Delicious crepes and very friendly/fun owners.
author: Charmy C.

description:
Drunken good times call for good drunken food. Crepes A Go Go is genius because a) you can eat them with one hand, leaving the other free for either a drink or drunken gestures, and b) they're parked right outside of one of The Best Bars Ever, Butter. 

Crepes A Go Go is a trailer, just so you know. They've got a few plastic tables and folding chairs for patrons, but really, this is street food, people. Street food at its finest, I might add. 

Full disclosure: I'd never had a crepe. Ever. Not because I wasn't interested or I'd heard bad things - they'd just never occurred to me or been available to the point where I had to try them. Anyway, I was persuaded by a friend to go for it after a few drinks, as we were both ravenous and in need of substantial food. I left it up to him to order, and he went with jalapeno, tomato, onion, cheese and spinach. It was deeeeeeeeeee-licious, and I probably could have eaten the entire thing had I not promised to share it. 

In short, make the stop, get a crepe and be satiated. And don't forget to add the jalapeno.
author: Hilary H.

description: been going here for years... still awesome...ii bring ppl here all the time its fun to eat and plus your by some bars, so you get to watch and see some entertainment while enjoying your crepe
author: Lone E.

description: The crepes here are delicious. I haven't tried any of the dessert offerings yet, but the crepes with ham, avocado, and cheese are to die for. This place is located right across from Slim's and makes a great quick snack for either pre or post drinking.
author: Taron G.

description: Delicious Sautéed Chicken crepe filled with cheese, stewed tomato, onion, green peppers & melted cheese. A winner & the guys there are great!  (OK for kids, but in the middle of bars & clubs on 11th.  Still, you can drive up & their crepes, regular & dessert, would make a great kids meal.)
author: Joshua C.

description:
Roasted eggplant, feta cheese, bell peppers, caramelized onions, and mushrooms all partying it up inside my hot crepe, and then come my tastebuds grinding up on everyone and everyone's having a great time! Delicious!! 
 
the crepe consistency wasn't super fresh, but the sum of all its parts made for the most delightful late night snack.
As we were munching away, we hear another customer a few feet away say to her friend after biting into her crepe, "omg, this is so good, it's stupid." HAHAHAH. so true!
author: Tuwie N.

description:
Although not up to par with Parisian street food, San Francisco SOMA needed a late-night quick food. 
My favorite for this time of night is Nutella Banana. Find this place, just down the street from 1015 Folsom, before the hoards of boppers come out.
author: Kat T.

description:
SIT-REP

Any weekend night of clubbing on the 11th Street Block between Folsom and Harrison Streets in San Francisco will end nicely with a quick stop to Crepes A Go Go.

THE FARE

They have both SAVORY crepes (with cheeses, meats, and or veggies) and they have SWEET crepes (with creams, fruits, and other sweet / sugary items).

This particular night after New Wave City (@ DNA Lounge just across the street) I got one of their specials that had smoked turkey and cheese.  DELICIOUS!  My buddies Minh and Cindy grabbed some sweet crepes that they thoroughly enjoyed!

Most of these crepes are just a few dollars.  My special was about $5.  They are VERY delicious and a nice change of pace from the usual PIZZA or HOT DOG fare that we end up picking up after a night of dancing.

THE LOWDOWN

If you are looking to fill that hole in your stomach at 3am after getting out of the 11th Street strip, CREPES A GO GO will satisfy you beyond belief!
author: Michelangelo S.

description:
Great sweet and savory crepes if you're craving a late night snack. 

They have all the typical combinations you could want or you can even make up your own. Strawberries and cream was delicious and my friend got the ground beef/onion/cheese which was also really good.

It gets packed, so be prepared to wait and listen for your number or someone else will eat your crepe.

Two things to note: It's typically crowded with drunk people and it's basically just a food truck with a few plastic tables/chairs nearby.
author: Kenny J.
