description: Crepes are good but the workers and owners here are robbers.  I gave them a $20 and they didn't give me any change.  When I asked for my change, they directed me to my receipt, that said $18.06 (3 crepes and one water).  They kept the rest as tip unilaterally without asking me b/c they thought we were too inebriated to know BUT I DID KNOW those rat bastards.  Never coming here again.
author: Chris L.

description: The sweet crepes were so flavorful and delicious. I had the Ricotta and Orange Marmalade, so yummy. The crepe was good and crispy. I will be back for more.  We got other at 2am, the line was long but worth the wait!
author: Rita S.

description: I used to love these guys until they stopped taking cards. Their crepes were great, the owner's jokes were corny but you were drunk so it was ok. The best part was that I didn't have to walk across the street to get cash from the ATM at DNA pizza in order to get cash to pay for my delicious crepe. It's the 21st century let me pay however I want. If not, I'll just get a slice of cheese while I'm at DNA!
author: Antonio C.

description:
For those night owls working or partying during late hours and looking for munchies...

This is a crepes truck located inside a gated open lot. There's a neon sign atop the right wall to help u find the place at night. Located across the street from Slim's music hall.
http://static.px.yelp.com/bphoto/gtM_c8ys8zcDIzu7Sbmk5g/l

Prices are around $2.75 ~$6.50 depending on the ingredients, or add extras to make your own custom version. Despite the remote location and late hours, the food is surprisingly good. And no, I wasn't drunk when I ate here. Really satisfying. Sodas and juices are also available for about $1-$2.

- House special (2 eggs, smoked turkey and cheese) crepe - sorry, photo not as sharp. http://static.px.yelp.com/bphoto/pNV5m2HGAjALgOiiIKTYRA/l
- Chocolate & banana crepe http://static.px.yelp.com/bphoto/jVZWhvLQ-w5CZRsDCiZatQ/l

Note that there are 2 sofas under a canopy, placed against the right wall. My advise is: DON'T sit on them. Those sofas and the carpet lining the floor are stinky/smelly and I think that they have never been washed in years.

If u require a better environment, Crepes A Go Go has several regular sit down shops in SF, Berkeley, Walnut Creek and San Rafael.
CASH only.

Hours:
Sun-Wed 6pm-2am
Thu-Sat 6pm-4am
author: Luis C.

description: This place is PERFECT after a night of being drunk!  Well this would have to do since there isn't a good mexican food place in the bay.  I love crepes!  I had the nutella with bananas and it was sooo good.  Great late night snack!
author: Chrissie O.

description: Awesome little place.  Love how it is tucked away from the streets.  They have tons of different crepes both sweet and savory.  We tried the Nutella and banna with coconut, also tried the strawberry and Nutella.  Both where so very good.  As my wife and I sat and enjoyed our crepes we noticed this is a perfect place for those enjoying the surrounding bars.  Friendly service and good food.  Definitely worth the trip to try it out.
author: Snugly B.

description:
King Lias crepe = the bomb.  Both in flavor and in weight!  Crepe with nutella, bananas, coconut, almond powder and topped with whipped cream.  $6.00!   (They have savory options too.)

Seating = some tables and chairs outside under a canopy.

Service = super friendly. 

Oh, and this place is open until 3 a.m., I'm sure they get a lot of people from the clubs...;-)
author: Fannie S.

description:
Still a reliable quick late night food option - when you're downtown during the work week.

We stopped in here after an event the other mid-week night  - and there is nothing better - than strolling up to a line-less crepe - stand - and being handed a big, warm  - doughy crepe - full of fresh seasoned sauteed vegetables. 

Crepes a Go Go is a constant. You always know that it's going to be open late. You always know that the staff are going to be patient (despite dealing with a wealth of inebriated crepe stand go-ers on the regular). Their basic crepes of goodness - - such as the nutella and egg and cheese crepes - are just always so. Damn. Good. And - Crepes A Go Go is just instant gratification. Walk up. Order. Wait literally a minute or two. Devour.

Lying in my bed, - typing this review, eyes half closed, my stomach growling from lack of sugary items this weekend - all I can currently think about - is being handed a a fresh - hot crepe - full of nutella goodness. from Crepes A Go Go. 

It is literally. All. I can think about. 

Trust.
author: Jessica T.

description:
How is it that all these years of partying in SF and this is the first time we saw this place?! 

SO HAPPY to have had a little piece of our experience in Paris right here in SF!

The staff is friendly and I'm still giddy about finding this gem! A crepe (with whatever fillings you are in the mood for) is the BEST thing after a night out :)
author: Kal K.

description:
Yum! I had never been here before last night, but a friend of mine who'd recently been to Slim's told me how delicious it was. When she said it was right across the street, she really meant it which was great. 

We saw the Kottonmouth Kings last night and obviously needed a snack before heading back home. We jay-walked over and it was everything she said it would be and more. 

Our minds were working a little more slowly than maybe they should have been but alas, we made a decision, sugar and butter for both her and Boyfriend, plus a nutella and strawberry with whipped cream for me. Sooooo delightful. Compared to my favorite crepe place in Japantown, these crepes were way more crispy which surprisingly I enjoyed. Then we heard the girl call out "Cheese and green onion". Boyfriend and I looked at each other and knew what must happen. We needed to order that too. Hellllllllllllllllooooooo delicious! 

I would definitely come back if I were in the neighborhood. Cheap and good and open on the late.
author: Laila P.

description: Generous enough, but crepe is a bit thick. Tried the honey, banana and almond but unimpressed. Stick to Nutella. Location is right next door to Butter.
author: Adele T.

description: I love this place..My kids and always make a habit of stopping here for a sweet crepe to go,fast efficient service.
author: Kelli L.

description: Got one before the club, and one after the club. 5 stars for exceeding my drunchies expectations for sure.
author: Gabriella R.

description:
:) Dude This place is so easily missible. They NEED to have like a Neon Pink arrow with bulbs that points to this crepe truck. 
THEIR CREPES ARE SO RIDICULOUSLY GOOD MY GOSH.
I got the strawberry crepe with coconut and nutella. NUTELLA. anything with nutella is good, so make sure you get nutella. Even for the Savory crepes. Nutella. 
jk.. i dont think the nutella would go to well with the savory crepes..
I've yet to try any kind of savory crepes yet, but if i do, this is the place im coming to.

P.S. i was also short of 50cents, but i was dieing for my crepe. The man could see the hunger and desire in my eyes and just let me go $.50 short. Awesome man. Respect.
author: Eva Z.

description:
Who cares that 75% of an avocado's calories come from fat (mainly mono)? Avocados are HIGH in insoluble fiber (75%), so it will all come out any ways. TMI, I know...so just add avocados to your crepes and the calories will be out by the morning; NO guilt!!! Yes, I have a justification and/or excuse for everything. :X

Some of my gfs have been raving about Crepes A Go-Go for some time and I finally got to see what the hype was all about a month ago. And, I've since been here twice after stumbling out of The Cow on Friday AM.

Crepes A Go-Go is located across from Slim's and right past Paradise Lounge, MIST, and Butter and is perfect for a late night snack since it closes at 3 AM.

1st visit: Smoked Turkey w/ Provolone and Avocados - OMFG! I'm normally NOT a fan of savory crepes, but Crepes A Go Go has since converted me. Either that, or the 6+ shots of GG clouded my judgment. :X The crepe is delicately cooked producing crispy corners and a soft/fluffy center. It's generously filled with thick deli-sliced smoked turkey, cheese, and chunky slices of buttery avocado. The turkey is tender and the creamy provolone has some burnt edges which adds a great creamy, savory crunch. And, the best part is the uber-ripened avocados which is so buttery it just melts in your mouth. The crepe is a perfect balance of textures and flavors; crisp, soft, savory, salty, creamy, and buttery. 

2nd visit: Spinach w/ Provolone and Avocados: It was just ok. In attempt to make a more "healthier" choice, I just ended up a bit disappointed. The crepe was cooked perfectly; crisp, yet soft. However, I expected the spinach to be cooked. Rather, the crepe was stuffed with huge raw spinach leaves. I'm a carnivore, not a herbivore, so with each bite, I took a leaf with me which made me look as if I went grazing on the field. 

There's ketchup, siracha, and generic tabasco sauce to the left on the truck that you can pour on your crepe to your heart's desire.  

PRICE (cash only):
*Sweet Crepes (15+ varieties): Starts at $2.50 (Butter & sugar) - $6.00 (King Llas w/ nutella, banana, almond powder, coconut & whipped cream).

*Savory Crepes (15+ varieties): Starts at $3.50 (Cheese) to $6.50 (Sautéed chicken, cheese bell peppers, onions, and garlic).

Cheese Choices: Swiss, cheddar, moneterey jack, and ricotta.

Extras ($.75-$1.50): Nutella, jams, spreads, sauces, eggs, avocados, caramelized onions, mushrooms, etc.

SERVICE:
Order with the cashier and wait for your order to be called. There are only two people working, the cashier and the cook and they crank these bad-boys out like an assembly line; very fast and efficient. It normally takes no more than 5 minutes for your order. 

SEATING:
There are about 5 or so lawn chairs against the wall to the right of the truck. If you want to sit, make sure to go snag some seat(s) while your friend(s) order. Otherwise, there's ample standing room. 

CROWD: 
Drunks, drunks, and MORE drunks...esp during peak hours after 1 AM. So grab a seat, kick back and enjoy your crepe while you watch a bunch of drunken shenanigans go on. *Ahem* Drunk Asian girl w/ disheveled burgundy hair using her friends as crutches, and throwing major hissy fits b/c her friend didn't want to take a bite of her crepe. 

Ahhhh, even when the club let's out, there's never a dull moment...
author: Cherylynn N.

description: Gotta becareful here. They think you're drunk and will over charge you. They'll nickel and dime you without you knowing.  They'll even do it on the tax.  When questioned,  the owner said the tax rate is 9.75%, when in fact is 8.75%. I bet they don't even pay the tax they collect to the gov't. Shady.  Just be sure to calculate everything yourself and be very specific about what you order.
author: Hao T.

description: Hungry in the middle of the night? Go here! Sweet and savory crepes at your rescue!
author: Siranush H.

description:
Service was meh 
But this was the best crepe ever eaten, by me! 

Thick warm saucy enough
Interesting flavors combos

I ALWAYS get sweet. Been reluctant to try savory crepes but I trust this place so much I will come back to try a savory sometime !
author: Veranna N.

description:
If your looking for something sweet or savory their crepes are delish! I've come here after going to the clubs for a late night snack, to grab something for dessert, etc. Depending on my mood my go to crepes are: House special, Apple Cinnamon, or strawberry/banana/nutella (both sweet crepes are topped off with whip cream). The crepe itself is warm and crispy on the edges and not too soft/soggy.

Remember to bring cash, this place is CASH ONLY.
author: Kristina S.

description:
This place has bombbbb crepes! We came here after having dinner at Bar Agricole across the street. I ordered the strawberry banana nutella crepe with whipped cream..soooo good!!! The crepe itself is warm and crispy on the edges and not too soft/soggy like some crepes I've had. The combo of the fruits, nutella, and whipped cream in the crepe were heavenly. LOVVVEEEE. 

Btw, remember to bring cash cuz this place is CASH ONLY.
author: Cat P.

description: Good variety and the crepes are made really well and wrapped to go! Fast service but it is cash only..
author: Karla E.

description:
I don't get what's to rave about this place at all.

I came here with my bf once, and the crepe was all soggy, with way too much whip cream that was already starting to melt due to the temperature of the crepe and was looking gross. Strawberries were also pretty damn sour. So all this was just a big pile of mess. 

My best guess is that most of these yelpers must've tried this place after getting drunk from the numerous amount of bars near this area. Overall, not a good place to eat while sober. Although I have to hand it to them on landing a great location for good sales.
author: Harriet W.

description:
What happened to all the stores?! This crepe a go go is a food truck hidden in the middle of nowhere! My friends and I were able to find this after our pub crawl in our liquor stupor but it was mighty difficult. Overall, good crepe batter and very flavorful but no ham?! 

I'm a huge fan of condiments so props to having almost every condiment I can think of on the table outside!
author: Caroline T.

description:
Nothing better at midnight, seriously. You don't have to be drunk or a clubber to snag one of these bad boys at such an ungodly hour of the night. Also, one cannot go wrong with bananas, strawberries, and Nutella. The combination is divine.

The trailer: not so legit. But the crepes: OH SO LEGIT.

Can't wait 'till I'm back in SF some late night to make an excuse to drive on back here. Nomnomnom.
author: Shirley V.

description:
Oh, Crepes a go go. How much do I love thee? Let me count the mornings you've saved me from a hangover because I stumbled into your little nook and ate your crepes.... 

Wow, so many nights...this place was my standard go-to place after a night of drinking. I always knew what I was going to order and I always knew that the friendly French people working the truck would accomodate my drunk talk. 

I've developed a preference for the toothsome, crunchy texture of Genki crepes, but the house special crepe here was the gold standard for years. Juicy deli-cut turkey nestled with savory egg and melted cheese in a crepe. Top it with tapatio and you're GOOD TO GO. A must-try if you like savory crepes and are craving something more substantial than Nutella at 1am in the morning.

It's a definite freak scene here when the drunks come out. Grab a seat on the chairs & benches lining one side of the tent and watch the circus.
author: Monelle A.

description: Drunk? Hungry? In the area after drinking or dancing? Crepes a Go Go to the rescue. You get a packed crepe with a bunch of fillings (savory or sweet), and then you get to sit on a dirty bench with a plethora of hot sauce bottles while still in an alcohol-induced stupor and enjoy a filling snack.
author: Danny C.

description: GREAT late night eats after a night out. Anything you order is good (because I had a bite of all of my friends' food) but I really enjoyed my own crepe (the grilled chicken sauteed in onions, garlic, and peppers). My friend ordered a savory crepe and also a sweet crepe and was double fisting his food the whole time. He told me that I needed to order two, which I thought was excessive, but good thing I listened to him. My chicken crepe wasn't enough. I was hooked and needed more! So I got the nutella strawberry and raspberry crepe topped with whip cream. Mmm!
author: Madalena T.

description:
This place is pretty solid, and it's right next to a bunch of clubs/bars. 

Food: 4/5 stars
Ambiance: It's a food truck that doesn't move, ever.
Price: 7/person 
Service: It's a food truck.
author: Kevi L.

description:
great stop for a late night snack. their crepes are the perfect thickness, chewy and crisp, holds everything in perfectly. 

i got the banana honey and almond crepe, and tried a bit of a savory crepe.... deeeelish! the service is amazingly quick, the prices are great, and the late night crowd is highly entertaining ;)
author: Judy L.

description:
love stumbling here after the bars!

I get the house special? I think that is what it is called.
I add beef in it and it's always soooooo tasty!
author: Anne-Mary P.

description: Absolutely stunning crepes:) The best I have had so far. I would recommend the Nutella and kiwi :)
author: Ruchita J.

description:
Warning: We were drunk when we ate this place so my perception may be a tad skewed...

Located across from DNA lounge and other clubs, expect a long line outside this crepe truck at late hours.  Thankfully the line goes fast.  We got the cheese and egg crepe for $4.  WHAT A DEAL.  They wrap it in foil so you can easily eat it without creating a huge mess in your drunk state of mind.  I may have been buzzed but this was the salty goodness my body was craving at 3 am in the morning.  Maybe it's not the best crepe you'll ever eat, but it sure as hell is the best crepe you'll ever eat at 3 am.
author: Tiffany W.

description:
So delicious!!! Seriously some of the best crepes I've had in SF. Best value EVER. $2.50 for a butter and sugar crepe. THIS PLACE IS THE BOMB. I've had crepes twice already this week, and it's Monday night and I'm seriously upset they are not open today......

Good thing my bf lives a block away from this awesome place so I can get my crepe fix easily...
author: Eliza F.

description:
Bien sur, this French guy knows crêpes.  Come here for a late night snack that probably tastes even better if you drag your drunk ass out of one of the clubs nearby.

It seems like they only have 5 numbers they call, but you'd better listen up, otherwise your long awaited snack will be given to someone else!

So many choices...would love to try them all.
author: Dylan T.

description:
This place is freakin' GOOD!

I didn't like crepes until I met Crepes A Go Go. I live in the east bay and wish I lived in SF for this place.

Only downside is it's only open during dinner/late hours.
author: A K.

description: YUM!!  These crepes are so good!  I have only eaten here once, but i'll definitely be back over and over and over again once i move back to SF because this place is delicious.  There are so many different types of crepes, both savory and sweet, and the ingredients tasted very fresh.  It's open late night and is next door to butter so if you're tired of fried food pop on over for something fresh and tasty!  They are made fresh and were relatively speedy.  Yummy!
author: Allison R.

description:
Whoa, a crepe place next to clubs, open late at night, and actually has more-than-decent food?

If you happen to come here for drinks but get hungry, don't miss this "truck". The location is funky, and yes, it gets pretty cold in SF...but you can always wander into Butter or other clubs next door if you're too chilled. You gotta try some of their crepes here.

I got the nutella and banana -- the crepe skin was thin, crispy, but strong enough not to fall apart. I was surprised because the crepe came out so quickly, but the quality was there. A lot of crepe places I've been to in the bay area don't really do their crepe skin well.

The fillings were good too -- but it's hard to go wrong with nutella and banana. They do give a hearty portion. My friends who ordered the savory crepes loved them too, and it seems like the ones with the eggs are the ones to try.

Great, great late night eats place.
author: Alice C.

description:
These are true French crepes served by true French people. How could you go wrong? Their menu has dozens of crepes both sweet and savory. I tried the apple, cinnamon and nutella crepe, which was positively extravagant...A fresh, spongy crepe, the tart sweetness of the apples mixing with the rich creaminess of the nutella. It's right next to Butter and close to the DNA Lounge, so it's ideal for a pre- or post-Bootie snack. It also occurs to me that a crepe is one of the few foods that can serve as any of the three main meals and also dessert. 

The crepes are cooked out of a little truck, with a couple of crepe burners in the front of the window. Listen to the cooks chatting away in their mellifluous French as they prepare your crepe...They're probably saying, "Stupid drunk Americans". Love it!
author: Andrew K.

description: At 2am after a big night at Butter this is totally going to be your most favourite place in the world. At 9am the next morning, maybe not so much.
author: Tresna L.

description:
What's not to love about crepes? Very thin pancake with crispy edges, filled with any sweet or savory filling you desire. YUM!

Crepes A Go Go is THE place to go to for delicious crepes. They have all sorts of ingredients that you can choose from to stuff into your fluffy crepe and most importantly, they are not skimpy with the ingredients!

I came here after dinner for dessert and I almost couldn't find the place. I was looking for a truck parked on the street, not for a truck sandwiched between two large buildings, so I almost missed them. Once I finally found the shack, my taste buds were bursting with excitement as I stood in line! They had so many crepe creations to choose from, but I decided to get a Nutella crepe with strawberries and bananas. The crepe was humongous, so I shared it. The crepe was the perfect thickness and it contained a load of Nutella and fruit. I was really surprised with the quantity and quality. 

There was a small area with a couple of picnic benches for seating. They have potential to open up a little cafe of some sort, so I hope that happens so I can sit down and enjoy my crepe indoors. I also wish they had some ice cream to go with my crepe!
author: Lien T.

description:
The crepes here are good -- not standout, but good across the board.  Sometimes if they are busy (usually when the bars are closing) they can get hurried and a bit sloppy in their execution. 

Note that the hours listed on the Yelp page are inaccurate. I'm not sure whether they just pack up early some nights or whether it's a Yelp error, but they're definitely not open late on Sundays (I've been there at 9:30pm on Sundays and it's closed). If in doubt, call first.
author: David C.

description:
Stumbling from the clubs nearby.. i've gone here on a quest to find some delicious grub at 2:30am. no where else nearby can serve you this variety of sweet, savory, salty, filling, or vegie healthy crepes.

the reason why you rave about this place is because its open very late, its a crepe cart! and they have a lot of choices with really reasonable prices. they have a stand with a bunch of hot sauces, and they make your food to order. 

i've even gone here at 1am with fam just to get a midnight snack. there's a place to sit down and enjoy people watching the drunkies, or just get and go. 

THE place to eat afterhours in this area
author: Leo M.

description:
*Avocado + Tomato + Cheese Crepe: 5 stars
-DELICIOUS
-not too too much cheese
-really juicy, flavorful tomato
-well salted (not too much, not to lil)

THANK YOU FOR BEING OPEN SO LATE!
author: Neeharika B.

description:
When it's 2am and you've left the club, and you and your friends are slouched over in the back of a limo, buzzed like a mofo, someone is guaranteed to yell out: 
"I'm hungry! Let's get some fucking crepes!" 

Crepes a Go-Go is THE late-night drunken 4th meal go-to spot. It's a food truck, and they work quickly and diligently to keep the long lines moving quickly. My favorite is the banana caramel walnut crepe. I think I whispered gently to the crepe, "OMG I love you," at some point while I was devouring it. 

Now that I can't eat sweets like I used to, I am damn near shedding a tear at writing this review. I miss you so much Crepes a Go-Go. Although my clubbing days are over, I might pay you a visit at 2am in my jammies just to get another taste of that sweet, sweet lovin'...err, crepes.

Mmmm....
author: Mariela D.

description:
Thank god for Yelp!!! On 8/1/10 I was leaving a neighborhood bar when I passed by an unsuspecting taco truck stand recessed between two buildings. It didn't look like much but I was hungry so i decided to check yelp... Thank GOD I did!!!! 

Considering it got 4.5 stars I couldn't pass this up and I'm soooooo happy I didn't. I wanted something hearty rather thank sweet and the egg, turkey, cheese crepe was exactly what I needed. It was AMAZING!!!! Don't pass this place up. In fact, I would go out of my way to come here again!

You won't regret it.
author: Salvador R.

description:
5 stars for feeding me past 2am at an UNBEATABLE price and serving people with a sense of humor!!!

I'm not going to lie, the infamous bacon wrapped hotdogs of SF are just right outside the gates of this snazzy little joint, but Crepes A Go Go has more value for your dollars and offers a place for you to sit while you enjoy your food. 

I'm not sure how they manage to keep the bums off the premises, but from my experiences here, I haven't had any encounters with them. (Or was I too drunk to even notice?)

Anyway...
Tipsy and hungry, with only leftover tip money in my pocket, I'd say this is the perfect deal.
author: Frances T.

description:
Probably the best after party snack ever. . . and it was from a food truck!? Seriously? 

Came here with a couple of friends last thursday night after a bar and I think I can speak for everyone who was with me that we enjoyed every bite!

Most of us got the House Special which consisted of smoked turkey, egg, and cheese.  Mmm. I also got the butter and sugar crepe because that's what I normally get at the shop in Berkeley.  Soo good.

Fast and cheap.  Just how I like it!  Haha. 

One of the best things I ate this past weekend while I was up in the bay.
author: Criselle O.

description:
The last thing you need after a night of drinking at Butter and Bootie is a crepe... but there's a huge difference between "need" and "want." And after I walked out of DNA Lounge and saw Crepes A Go Go across the street, it didn't matter what my body needed. 

It wanted a crepe. It desired one. IT YEARNED FOR ONE. And who was I to let my body down?

"One chocolate, banana and coconut crepe, please." 

5 minutes later, that bad boy was in my hands and down my throat quicker than you can say "you can be whatever you want here tonight because this is San Fransexual!" (quote from drag queen at Bootie)

The chocolate was warm and syrupy. The bananas were sliced thin just how I like them. And they pounded that bad boy with coconut powder. The guy really, really, really wanted to put whipped cream on it, but I had to politely decline. 

The guy working inside was hilarious. After I ordered mine, a group of 3 guys walked up and he turned off the light on the sign and said "sorry, closed, just ran out of crepes." He let this go on for a good 2 minutes, convincing ALL OF US that he was serious, until he turned it back on and took their orders. 5 stars alone for humoring drunk people. 

If you're in this part of SOMA after a night of drinking and are craving a late night fix, you need to go here. No, scratch that. I *WANT* you to go here and I want you to let me know how happy you were by the time you got home.
author: Jared S.

description:
I knew it!  I should have went for a savory crepe (I was craving spinach haha) instead of ordering the "King Lias" which is the sweetest crepe on the menu!  

I did finish dinner earlier in the day eating so much garlic fries I figured I should balance it out with something sweet but wow, I did NOT think it was going to be THAT sweet.  Yes, they do live up to their name.

After a while, it was so sweet I could barely eat half of it.  Too bad they ran out of chestnut spread because I really wanted to try that in the crepe too.  Also, no ice cream?  I think it would be so much yummier with some ice cream in the sweet crepes.

Maybe next time if I ever go in that area again, I'll try the savory crepe.  Interesting enough this truck gets so much business on nights where people get out of the club because next thing you know, there was a very long line.
author: Mabel C.

description:
C lubbing/bar hopping works up an appetite, and A Go Go fills it nicely
R ecommending this for late night grub -- AND as a great spot for crepes
E ndless selection of crepes, both sweet and savory
P robably one of the better places for savory crepes in the city
E xcellent choice: Beef, Jalapenos and Cheese
S o juicy, so cheesy, so delicious

A nd then there are the sweet crepes...

G et strawberry or banana with warm nutella and whipped cream
O oooh, the way the warm crepe heats the filling is wonderful

G rab cash from the ATM before you order
O nly sit in the lounge seats if you must -- don't know what's lurking there
author: Anthony N.

description: Okay.  I'm probably going to be in the minority here by not giving this place a 5 star review.  For being open late and dealing with all the drunk folks, I will have to commend these guys.  But, I've seriously had better Crepes.  I ordered the Banana Nutella with whipped cream.  Upon taking the first bite, all I thought to myself was "This is it?!"   Don't get me wrong-- I ate the whole thing, but it still isn't something that I'd want to eat again if I had other options.   And this is one of the rare times that I didn't read a review on yelp before trying something out.
author: Lorie N.

description: This place is open lost all night long!  Hot and hearty!  Helps if you need to eat something after a night of drinking!  These crepes do not taste like the ones you get in France, but they are savory and rich!
author: Dame C.

description:
BEST.. CREPE.. EVER... EVER.

I love pineapples - so I went for the Cheese, Smoked Turkey and Pineapple. MAN, oh man.. the crepes were hot and crispy!  DELICIOUS!

Elaine S. went for the House Special and I got one for the man, so I was straight double fisting crepes when we left.  

IT WAS SOOO GOOD. There's a table of condiments - a variety of different hot sauces and they have Sriarcha!  Six Stars. ******
author: Jennie P.

description:
I need one of these downstairs.. at my work, home, friends' houses.

Plenty of sweet and savory options to satisfy any type of food craving you might have
on a random night, should you find yourself wandering off toward Butter.. but undecided
on whether you really want to go inside. 

Me *on Yelp* : Hey, there's a crepe place around here!!
Limo driver: What?
Friends: No, we're going to Butter
Me: *sad face*
Limo driver *opens the door*
Me: !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! It's the crepe place!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Friends: No, it's Butter!
Me: Well, let's get crepes!!!!!!!!
Me + Friends + Limo driver nom on crepes
[the crepe peeps are so obviously used to dealing with drunks that are just an evil sarcastic bunch, but we loved them]

Then we hopped back on the limo and left.. only realizing later that we never actually went to Butter. Woohoo! Got my crepe fix! *SUCCESS KID*
author: Jade T.

description:
Unbelievably good crepes, the best I've ever had. Service is friendly and fast, and prices are good. 

The crepes are not too sweet and they have perfect texture. The beef crepes were really something special along with the house special. They also load up their sweet crepes with a ton of fruit and Nutella. Very worth the money. 

You guys need to open a food truck or something!  I'd be eating these crepes all the time here in Long Beach if you sold them here!
author: Jonathan S.

description: One of my favorite crepe places!! Good location. Yummy savory n sweet crepes. Dudes have a good sense of humor.
author: Jennifer S.

description:
These guys deserve 5-stars just for their comedy routine.  "Number 98!  No..that's 89, I called 98! Just kidding!"  "I ordered two crepes.  Nope.  I only have you down for one.  We charged you double.  Oh. Ok.  Just kidding!"

But seriously surrounded by night clubs and bars, this little crepe stand is just what one needs at 3am in the morning.  And honestly, even if it weren't 3am, I'd check hit these guys up for their delicious crepes.

I got a banana an Nutella crepe for $4.  Even at the Asian crepe places, this crepe would have set me back at least $5.  You can even choose to add whip cream to your crepe for no extra charge!

The options on the savory crepes look delicious, so I will definitely try one of those next time.

Overall:
-Great value
-Good food
-Fun atmosphere

You've got to give 'em a try!
author: Matt S.

description:
These are some of the best crepes that you will find in the city and best of all, they're open late! This is a hotspot of activity between 1:30 and 3:00 am as people are getting out of the bars, but you don't need to be tipsy to appreciate this delicious, high quality food at affordable prices. 

I often leave the bars early just to get the house special crepe with avocado in my belly that much faster!
author: Chad T.

description: I can definitely see this as a drunk food choice. It's cheap and easy to eat. Just got the turkey and cheese...the flavor of the filling was good. I know I wasn't very exciting with my choice but I wanted to taste the crepe itself. I think its a lttle too thick for my preference and almost too eggy. I think I might like it better with some pesto or hot sauce. I am sure I will be back considering it is smack in the middle of SOMA bars and clubs.
author: Eve C.

description:
This place is great for a late night snack, but the crepes are just average and the ingredients are subpar.  Had a cheese crepe with spinach, mushrooms, and turkey, but the mushrooms were the rubbery kind from a can and the turkey was probably some deli meat from a grocery store.  I've had much better crepes elsewhere, and given the raving reviews was expecting more. 

The location is convenient for street parking but there is sparse seating and it is rather cold sitting outside.  Would probably come back only when starving late at night.
author: Victor S.

description:
This cart's operations are made for fast turnaround to serve a large, hungry post-bar/club crowd.  The shortcuts help serve more people faster, but degrade the quality.  However, at 2AM, your judgement of quality (food or otherwise) is probably low enough that anything warm will do!

Cheddar, Sun Dried Tomato, Green Onion Crêpe: The crêpe itself was pre-made and briefly reheated for the order.  This causes it not to be as crispy as a fresh crêpe.  It's folded into a triangle instead of served flat on a plate which causes some bites to be way too heavy on the dough.  The cheddar wasn't any fancy variety, just like the shredded cheese you'd get at Safeway.  The sun dried tomatoes were good.  The green onions were cut too thick for a not-so-subtle flavor in each bite.
author: Adam B.

description: Not phenomenal crepes but great late night spot when you're hungry.  They have dessert and savory crepes and a pretty extensive menu.  I think the nutella fruit crepes are the best.  Will definitely go back cause it's a chill spot.
author: Noi N.

description:
Yes, yes, yes.

If you have the will and strength to resist this at 1:45am, my hat goes off to you.

Me on the other hand well, I have no shame. Strawberries, nutella and whipped cream, or GTFO! Or maybe cheese, spinach and mushroom if I'm in the mood for something salée.

I will tell you this though, Crepes A Go Go will leave you feeling a little better than a bacon wrapped hot dog. So choose wisely!

Additionally, I appreciate that a French person actually works here.
author: Chelsea P.

description: I happen to find this spot right next to Butter and it came in handy to soak up the liquor I did drink an hour earlier. The crepe though was just ok. maybe it was what I ordered (Strawberry & chocolate crepe) , but to be honest with you half of my crepe was burnt and tasted pretty bad. I did see that they do beef and cheese style crepes but I'm not too sure what happened with my experience. It wasn't very busy at the moment I ate there but an hour later they had a line down the street! Go figure!
author: Richard G.

description:
I'm led to believe that the crepes from Crepes a Go-Go have an addictive substance in them because once you go here, you can't stop coming back.  And I'm not talking about in general--that's a given.  I'm talking about just in one night.  

Example 1: I came here with friends for a quick dinner before heading to WISH.  A couple hours of later, we made our way next door to Holy Cow, but we were the very first ones inside, so we decided to pass some time by noshing on some sweet crepes from Crepes a Go-Go.  But I guess I just didn't have enough of them, because we made one last stop at Crepes a Go-Go before calling it a night!

Example 2: After a satisfying sushi boat dinner, the SO and I came here for a post-dinner treat.  We were talking about having a dessert crepe the entire way there, but once we got here, we couldn't resist the delicious House Special.  Fast forward 4 hours later after a night at Swig, we brought our friend here and we finally had that sweet crepe we were talking about!

So, case in point: Crepes a Go-Go is addicting, delicious, and so worth going to multiple times in a night.  

Everyone who's in the know knows that the House Special (2 eggs, smoke turkey slices and cheddar cheese) is "DA BOMB" (I swear I've heard this over 10 times since I've been here).  Ask them to add hot sauce -- you can choose from Sriracha, Tapatio, and Tabasco -- and it makes the crepe even more mind-blowing.  My favorite sweet crepe is the banana, nutella and almond powder.

The guys working the crepe truck have great memories and are super efficient with taking down orders and cooking the crepes.  The crepes are pre-made which make the wait go a bit faster.  

Cheap and delicious crepes from a permanent roach coach...this is what  I call a San Francisco treat!
author: Diane L.

description:
This review is legit. 

I didn't come from dancing nor was I buzzed/drunk. These tastebuds were not under the influence. I will, however, agree that Crepes A Go Go will make a great meal after a long night of dancing and drinking. 

Randomly drove by this crepe truck at 2AM in the morning.

STOP RIGHT THERE! I told him. 

I've been here. Says my friend. Its delicious. 

So we parked and stood in line with the drunks. 

Call me crazy but I got the Nutella with Fresh Strawberries and a fried egg. It's DELICIOUS! All this for $5.75, that's cheaper than a red bull vodka!

Cash only cause cash is King.
author: Jenny K.

description: Many nights through the bars on 11th street have been topped off by this incredible stop. I usually order their special savory combination but their sweet crepes are excellent as well. The two guys working this truck are hilarious (read: trolls) and know how to create an oasis of deliciousness. It's unfortunate they only take cash, but I'm still giving them 5 stars purely based on their ability to serve quality (and reasonably-priced) crepes. They must make a killing every night.
author: Wesley L.

description:
MMMM!!!! My favorite late night snack!  It's either this or jack itb tacos ...but these crepes are a million times better!  The guys in the truck are always so nice and funny!  I only get the house special, but I'm sure everything else is just as good.  There have been times when I've missed out on opportunities to eat here and I completely regret it ...so make sure you make it to the crepes!!

The seating area in the corner is kinda sketchy to me....I don't like the couches, so I'll stand and eat.  Cheap, delish, and well worth it.  Enjoy!
author: Lyn C.

description: Stopped by here after the Giants game the other night and could not decide on chocolate and strawberries or Nutella and strawberries. I love how they informed me of the difference and that the chocolate would be a little runny. Since I was going to be driving I went with Nutella. So yummy! Great spot!
author: Paula T.

description:
Whenever I think of crepes now I am reminded of one of my favorite scenes from "Talladega Nights" where Jean Girard (Sacha Baron Cohen) confronts Ricky Bobby (Will Ferrell) and his buddies for the first time in a pool hall and pins Ricky Bobby down on a pool table threatening to break his arm unless he submits by renouncing his nationalist pride.

Jean Girard: I will let you go, Ricky, but first I want you to say,..."I love crepes." 
Cal: Don't you say it, Ricky!  These colors don't run! 
Ricky Bobby: Oh, I'm not gone say it.
(Jean Girard again threatens to break Ricky's arm) 
Jean Girard: Just say, "I love crepes." 
Cal: You know, just to put this in there, I had a whole mess a' crepes this mornin' and they're just like pancakes, maybe even better. 
Ricky Bobby: Are they the really thin pancakes? 
Jean Girard: Yes, they are.  They are the really thin pancakes, it's just the French word for them. 
Ricky Bobby: Oh, my God!  I love those! 
...
Jean Girard: What if you say, "I love really thin pancakes?"  That is a fair compromise, no? 

Hilarious scene!  I definitely don't need to be threatened with having my arm broken to say, "I love crepes."  One of the reasons is because of the great crepes at Crepes-A-Go-Go.  I have not been disappointed by any savory or sweet crepes that I have tried even when they've messed up my order.  This little creperie on wheels is also my number one spot to grab a bite to eat after a night hanging out in SOMA.
author: Erich D.

description: Funny guys with good customer service. Always enjoy my crepe no matter which one I choose.
author: Christina J.

description:
Maybe its the crepes or maybe its the fact that we always seem to end up here after hitting the clubs and bars. What ever it is, I loves me a good crepe from this stand! 

You'll find this little trailer between Howard and Harrison on 11th st, in a little enclave across from Slims. I've been to other creperies, even other Crepes A Go Go's, but nothing compares to the ones I get from the 11th st spot! They are usually open on busy nights, when there will be a lot of people out and about. This means its really hit or miss on week nights whether they will be open or not. But Thursday, Friday, and Saturday, they stay open till at least 3am, possibly later depending on the amount of people flocking to this oasis of tasty sweets and savory creations. 

I've never been here during the day, so I'm not sure what the actual business hours are.  

If you happen to find yourself stumbling here after a hard night of fist pumping, you will find a plethora or delicious crepe concoctions! I would suggest instead of staring blatantly at the wall of choices in a drunk stupor, that you go with the house special if you're hungry or the nutella and strawberries should you feel like something sweet. I personally enjoy a simple tomato, avocado and feta crepe. Point is what ever you get, you cant go wrong. Except for the apples and cheese, apparently is not all that good, or so I was told by a friend who ordered it. (WELL DUH!) 

I often make a point before going out with friends, to state I will be the designated, as long as we get crepes after the bars close. It almost completes the night, like all the chaos that went down is resolved by the time I'm pouring hot sauce on my crepe.

The staff working the hot plates are great, super nice, and quick! Your hunger will be quelled in a timely fashion!
author: Andrew D.

description:
GENUIS! 

Late night munchies, drunkchies, exhaustion from dancing/crowd moshing, partying, etc. What ever the case, late night cravings are the worst BUT these savory or sweet crepes will definitely ease your hunger and be the cherry on top of what ever crazy night you just had. 

Favorites: Chicken with Feta! The chicken with peppers, tomatoes but substitute the regular cheddar cheese with feta (that is the key). It is delicious! 

Regulars that people usually order: the beef with avocado, tomatoes, the works: it was good but tasted kinda like a burrito with a crepe body. I would go with Chicken when it comes to savory. 

What impressed me: The way they wrap it. You would imagine towards the end your hands and face would be a sticky-mess but i finished it without a drop. Score.
author: Amy L.

description:
I must say, the fact that they do not have the option of adding vanilla ice cream just ruins the whole purpose of going for a crepe. When I go out of my way to get a crepe, I want the whole big kahuna- the bananas, the nutella, and ice cream. Now, it sounds a bit plain when you just have bananas and nutella. I usually have a sweet tooth, but a crepe without ice cream to neutralize the nutella is just a plain tooth ache. I tried substituting the ice cream with whip cream. Nope, bad idea. The crepe is a bit floppy in terms of not being able stand by itself with a hard exterior. I had to hold it together like a sandwich in order to eat it. 
  
We decided to go out for crepes after a  late night dinner around 11pm on a Friday night and found this establishment that is open late. Yelp listed this location in SOMA. When we arrived at our destination which is from the Italian district to "SOMA," we were practically in MISSION BAY where all the nightlife is located within the vicinity of Folsom and Harrison Street. Definitely not what I consider SOMA. We realized that this Crepe A Go Go was a small trailer fenced in from the street populated with club-goers.  
 
Cash only!
author: Becky Q.

description:
yah, this spot brings bacK memories, especially wheN you are hungry and you have been dancing for quite a while at Remedy, that all night party at the DNA Lounge.

The place is housed in a white trailer with two outdoor couches, and people are standing around freezing and  waiting for their hot delicious crepes. After so much alcohol, its good to order like a crepe with turkey, chees and avocados. It's very tasty too! i bet my one and only friend here is salivating right noW, hahah!

Anyways, there are other locations around the city of SF. There's the one on Union St and the one on Polk St. which are just as good. But the one here on Folsom St. is the one that brings bacK the memories of those fun daYS at RemedY and the crepes across the street. :)
author: herm p.

description:
i've never been here sober, but i trust my drunk pallette more than my sober one.  I get the egg, cheese, avocado and tomato every time and never am disappointed.  Topped with Tapatio and i'm set.  

I crave this everytime i go anywhere near the city and hope eveyone else wants to be a 2am fatty with me.  It's super quick.  Everyone else there is drunk, but something amazing happens once you get through the gates-- EVERYONE turns super nice. Blissfully chowing down and talking about what they ordered.  

Some advice:  
The awesome Frenchie will fuck with you if you're obnoxiously drunk so be prepared to take it if you want your crepe quick (or at all)

You'll have plenty of time to read the menu while in line so get your shit together and have your order ready.  

If you haven't eaten in a while, order two... they're filling, but so damn good your stomach sort of turns into a bottomless pit.
author: Kimbra O.

description:
By far the best late night snack on the Planet !!!

Who doesn't want a crepe filled with just about anything that your heart desires at 2 AM ?!?

I chose a avocado, egg, and cheese - but was almost on-board with a nutella-banana treat...

Sweet Dreams!
author: Kristian P.

description: Definitely a great find! Where can you find a crepe truck that still makes delicious and still open at 2am??? Crepes A Go Go is the place! It's a cash only spot and definitely good for a quick bite around a night on the dance floor or overfilling your belly with alcohol for the night. It's absolutely a delicious crepe place in the middle of nowhere with all the capabilities of making something delicious. Decent pricing too! But definitely prepare to wait for awhile if you just left the clubs or bars, it can get pretty busy. Also keep your cool the guys that are making your crepe sometimes messes around you for fun if youre a bit wasted. Definitely something fun to watch, but not to be messed with.
author: Linh D.

description:
I mean, no...I just don't generally think of crepes as food that I want to eat at three in the morning. Pizza? Yes. Donair? Sure. Subs? Absolutely. Thin, sweet, French pancakes wrapped about savoury ingredients ranging from cheese and ham to apple and cinnamon? Well no. That's just not something I go to when I've been out on the town and am wholly focused on retroactively avoiding a hangover. But after three hours of dancing at a Bootie SF party, my thighs just didn't have it in me to be picky. If crepes are right across the street, we're eating crepes.

The line-up was long but moved really fast - almost too fast when you consider just how much reading is involved with their menu. There are two categories of crepes - Savoury and Sweet - with well over a dozen varieties each. I went with the cheddar, egg and spinach combo that was way more flavourful than I expected. Quite frankly, Ben needed some alone time with his crepe and I'm not shy to admit it. And at about less than $4 a pop, these treats have forever earned a wildcard spot in my late-night menu.
author: Ben B.

description: MMM this is a trailer in soma that has a whole tons of crepes. They're open so late! I run club nights at a venue a couple buildings away, and this is perfect for a snack at 3am.  The crepes themselves aren't heavy like some are here in SF, and i was totally sober. They are easy to eat by hand before, after or during one of the nearby clubs, and a healthier and yummier option than getting greasy pizza. Cash only, but there's an atm at the convenience store nearby. There's also a little outdoor seating, and the people who run it are friendly. I really liked the ricotta applesauce crepe.
author: Merredith L.

description:
I remember my first crepe.  I was three.  My parents had taken me to Butter for a cultural experience.  They were only 24, so they really didn't know any better.  The bouncer let me in because no toddler was actually going to order a Manhattan.  I obviously chose to nurse a Ginger Ale.  Around 1am, my mother got tired and decided we should all tramp onward back home.  That's when we passed Crepes A Go Go.  Since there was no Bernstein Bears novel to appease me, my folks decided a crepe filled with nutella and apple sauce might do the trick.  Did that ever put a smile on my face!

Ok, so all of that was a bunch of fantasy.  I did, however, recently stumble upon the magic of Crepes A Go Go.  I was taken here on my way to BART because my friend took pity on his roommate's dinner of Lean Cuisine.  I wasn't going to complain.  I chose the House Special: two eggs, lots of cheese, and turkey.  I will say this.  It was devoured in less than 15 seconds.  Or three minutes.  The details are fuzzy.  I would like to have that make believe 3 year old sweet crepe next time.
author: Jeremy G.

description:
O M G!! I LOVE THIS PLACE!!

This is the best place to grab a quick and delicious snack late at night. There's always a line, especially around the time when people get out from bars and clubs.

I love that they have sweet and savory crepes. The bf and I ordered one sweet and one savory crepe. We ordered the house special (2 eggs, 2 slices of smoked turkey and extra cheese) and a sweet crepe with strawberries, bananas and nutella. The house special just hits the spot. I love adding Siracha hot sauce to it to make it even more delicious.

The crepes are made-to-order so it might take awhile for you to get your food...but it is totally worth the wait.

Deliciousness for a cheap price of about $6 each!
author: Patricia L.

description:
Who goes to Denny's after the clubs now a days? It's all about Crepes A Go Go!! 

It's quick, cheap, neat, no utensils required and oh so yummy and pretty filling. They have great entertainment (by that I mean the other super faded lushes). Haha!  Whether you like dessert crepes, savory ones or breakfast crepes..they're all SO good. 

My fave: House Special w/ Avocado (Smoked Turkey, Jack Cheese, 2 eggs and Sriacha) Mmmmm.....
author: Resa N.

description: Our friends brought us here for a midnight snack. Didn't know what to expect since I didn't realize they were taking us to a food truck. One friend suggested the Crepes Ooh la la with cheese, beef, green onions, green olives, jalapeños, sour cream, and Italian parsley for $9. Seemed a bit steep price wise, but it was so good. I was full, but since it was so tasty, I actually ate half of the order. It was a bit spicy for my husband, but I would definitely get it again. Maybe I'll try the more affordable item next time, the cheese, beef, grilled jalapeños and onions for $7.50.
author: Kimberly L.

description:
after the club munchies!

Savory: house special FTW

Sweet: nutella & the whole shabang!

never gets old!
author: Sarah F.

description:
Not a bad place to go after a really really long date and after being schmoozed over with a really decadent dinner and a bunch of positive phrases.....but no *click*

:(

So I took my exhausted self to this place for some sweet reassurances and hopeful that the French-inspired snack would instill some courage and perhaps inspiration for the next year.  HAHA!!

Oo la la.  I love......no, wait, adore their crepes here.  Two kinds are served here, the sweet and the savory.  The savory crepes are a wonderful alternative to a Sunday brunch.....and the sweet crepes are the perfect way to snuggle into for a romantic evening or relaxing day with dear friends.

My favorite in the Sweet category, would be the Chestnut Spread & Strawberries.  Oh my.  The crepes are just slightly spongy, but there should really be no resistance nor should the crepe tear when picked up.  Think of placing your teeth through very very thick cream....that's my kind of crepe.  Now imagine the delicate sweet starchiness of the Chestnut sandwiched with fresh slices of strawberries bursting in your mouth.  My other choice would be the pineapple, strawberries, Kirol, and a little Ricotta Cheese.  Like a fruit basket cake, but in a wrap form instead.    

From the Savory side of the menu, I enjoy the tart and salty exchange of the Cheese, Smoked Turkey & Cranberry Sauce crepe.  As a French take on the so American dinner.  But this was slightly different in taste, as the cheese provided a smooth backdrop to the very smoky and tender pieces of turkey.  Add in the tart sweetness of the cranberries, and the crepe was just as rich as a croissant.....with less guilt.

Decent crepes, perfect for snacks, brunch, late evening sweet fix!
author: Miika M.

description:
I used to love you crepe truck. You were just as delicious to me sober as you were when I was drunk. Alas, ever since "Hot-French-crepe-trunk-man" left, you haven't tasted quite the same. 

It's an OG food truck, don't be the douche (sober or not) that asks if they take card. If Chairman Bao is cash only, you best believe so is the crepe truck.
author: Daneca V.

description:
The best, Jerry, the best! 
Banya would've considered these crepes a meal, and probably would've paid for them himself.
author: Em L.

description:
Regardless of that fact that you like crepes or you don't you will simply LOVE Crepes A Go Go. Ive been here many time, with my buddies, after parties on weekends to grab a bite and socialize with people there.  this truly is a hidden gem people should know about in the city. 

This Crepe stand on 11th and Mission serves the best, most delicious crepes ever. I dunno how they make it so good but i really wish i could steal that recipe! although, getting it at the stand is just so much more fun and adds to the excitement.

They serves all kinds of crepes, there's a lot to choose from. Most people like their crepes with Nutella and fruits, which is pretty good to taste. But take my advice and try  the sauteed chicken with spinach, eggs and mushroom. Best thing you will eat after those drinks. you're taste buds will tingle upon tasting their Crepes. they're usual hours of operation is very late so u always have an option to go eat some quick good food if you get hungry in the city. Make sure you carry some cash before you get there though.
author: Sandeep R.

description:
I can appreciate late night food, especially an attempt at "high quality" light night food. After a night out and the guys insistently talking about "the crepe truck", I had to go see what this was all about. Cheap, sweet or savory crepes, open late, what more could you want? 

We stood in line for about 5-10minutes and I ordered the nutella and banana, unfortunately there was far too much nutella (I know, I never even thought this would be possible in life, let alone a complaint! that's how much there was!) and the bananas were old (you know, that old banana taste, blah!). 

Bottom line, if I go back I would definitely avoid the sweet and go for the savory. A fun concept nonetheless and a great alternative to pizza or fast food late at night!
author: H T.

description:
the best crepes i go-go for and it is right around the corner from our house.
this place is nestled between all the bars and clubs, and is perfectly suited for those craving a delicious crepe before going out, after slinging a few drinks, or as we like it - just when you want a quick, easy, amazingly inexpensive and filling delectable for dinner.
the trailer/food truck has the same two brothers working away on these scrumptious delights.  they are very friendly and always have a smiling face.
this place has become a weekly ritual for us.
again, the price is amazingly great.  
my favorite is the savory with avocado, mushroom, and tomato.  it tastes better each and every time.  mmm-mmm.
author: Benjamin B.

description:
Apparently now under new management? No longer run by the french folks but rather handsome Algerian guy, a Guatemalan and a Mexican. 

The food is still amazing as always (I had a mushroom and cheese crepe, to die for) and service is awesome. They humored my drunken obnoxiousness and broken Spanish which is always appreciated. Can't wait to go back.
author: Polly F.

description:
C'mon! I can't believe I haven't raved about this place yet. It should be on my  triple T's."Tops-to-Tell" list. 

This place is evil-in a good way. 

Great for a late night snack after re-tiring from the clubs. Stop by at the truck smooshed between two clubs, where Alexandra or "Alex" for short will greet you and ask you what kinda crepe you'd like. I've been there that many times. This place is my second home, close to home. The crepes are comparable to the ones in Paris that I've had from the street food vendors. I love the batter. It's not too soft, not too crispy, but just the right amount of chewy. Simple is how I like my crepes-with nutella or butter and sugar. They have savory crepes too, like ham and cheese or with turkey. You can be creative with the ingredients. And oh so not expensive. Under $5 will get you a basic one with two ingredients like nutella and banana. Props to them for the generous portions of nutella. I can't get enough. Opens and closes at weird hours so check the website for more info.
author: Laurel P.

description:
This is my #3 for when I have the late-night, post-clubbing munchies.

#1 is the Bacon Dog Cart (http://www.yelp.com/biz/bacon-dog-cart-san-francisco) - $3 is perfect if I'm paying.

#2 is Osha Thai Noodle Cafe (http://www.yelp.com/biz/osha-thai-noodle-cafe-san-francisco-4) - perfect if I'm not because I gotta have the beef pad see ew, roasted duck curry,  volcano beef, AND seafood claypot. The alcohol has to be soaked up SOMEHOW.

Crepes A Go Go is cheap and easy like #1 but gives me as many options as #2. Turkey and cheese if I'm feeling salty. Banana and nutella if I'm feeling sweet. Vegetarian if I'm not feeling like myself. The crepe itself could benefit from being crispier outside as it is in Paris, but I love that it's doughy inside, soft, and warm--perfect on a chilly SF night.

Beware the mushrooms are straight from the can. I have no problem with canned corn and canned spam (Hawaii girl), but canned mushrooms weird me out. They're so preservative-tasting and uniformly cut.

Crepes A Go Go reminds me of why I love SF: Club close at 2am, second dinner at 2:30am, in bed by 3am, awake by 9am. Not a day wasted!
author: Liz T.

description:
AWESOME!! went here twice in one night! got the following....
nuttella + strawberry
nuttella + strawberry + banana + coconut
straight turkey (with tapatio hot sauce
chicken + egg + cheese + mushrooms

Also check out the side table with 3-4 types of sauces, great on a cold SF night!
author: Vimal P.

description:
Randomly dropped by after a night of drinking and eating with some friends.  It was getting late, but we still wanted a sweet treat to finish out the night. I used yelp to locate something around Outer Mission and it led me to Crepes a Go Go. Didn't know what to expect, but I definitely was surprised to see a little food truck as a store front.  

Ordered a crepe with strawberries and nutella and it was one of the best crepes I've ever had. The way they made the crepe have a light crispness to it and some how made some of the nutella caramelize made for an amazing taste and tactile experience! 

The crepe maker and cashier was super nice and they accommodated any special requests. Just wished they had a true store front with indoor seating.  It gets a a little too cold in SF to sit out at their picnic tables under their tents at midnight. Definitely would drop by again whenever I'm in Outer Mission.
author: Nam L.

description: AWESOME crepes! I've had three here and they've all been incredible both in flavor combination and in portion! I guess my only qualm with this place is that if you show up after 1.30AM, the prices are doubled. So if you're out for a heavy night of drunken debauchery and are craving that crepe afterwards, be sure to drunkenly stumble on over before 1:30... Mind you, there's also a sizable crowd...
author: Jon M.

description: The prices here are steep for crepes, our total came out to almost $16 dollars for two crepes! :( Their crepe is good but not the best I've ever had. My friend ordered the strawberry banana and nutella crepe while i got the chicken, jack cheese and mushroom crepe. I wouldn't go out of my way to get my crepe fix here but it will do when it's the only thing open late at night in sf!
author: Shirley N.

description: Well, this is a great late night truck that stays open until 4Am. It has been identified as one of San Francisco's landmarks. Great and quick service, staff always clean and prompt. I admire the owner for his personality and exceptional customer service, one of the characteristics of successful businessman. Keep up the good work.
author: Shadi K.

description:
Update: This place is STILL cheap, tasty & affordable. This has got to be my favorite after dancing meal place ever! 

This place is cheap, tasty and fast! Their turkey, cheese and cranberry is delicious. Each crepe in itself a full meal. They are quite large so if you are just feeling snackish and not intensely hungry, split one with a friend. If you do not, you will just feel defeated by a half eaten crepe.
author: Christina L.

description:
You got to go go.

My first visits came right after college. There was no Yelp. There was also no memory. Think it was good. But not 100% sure.

I can now say with confidence it is good. Extensive menu to choose from as well as build your own. My turkey, onions and spinach creation was ready almost as soon as I ordered. Generous on the items. Six dollar price was just about right.

A lot has changed since right after college. My ability to inhale one of their crepes in no time at all has not.

Young. Old (er). Drunk. Sober. Just go go.
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Nz0aseZfrp4
author: Jason B.

description:
Not sure this is the same location I went to after a night out in the Castro area but regardless, it's the same wonderful company that satiated my post-drinking hunger pains!  

I was in San Fran for a reunion and when we came upon this place, I will always have fond memories of crepes!  We ordered a bunch of different ones but mine was by far the best.  Cheddar, Avocado and Tomato!  Man, that is some of the best late night grubbin' EVER!  The flavors just burst.  The creaminess of the avocado and cheddar mixed with the tartness of the tomato melted together with the sweetness of the crepe was heaven in a blanket.  I went to beddie bye with a smile on my face and full belly!  

Wish we had one down here in Diego!
author: Liz K.

description: Great crepes with an amazing variety of sweet and savory! My favorite post bar food. I can't give it 5 stars because there is really no place to eat outdoors comfortably.
author: Bradley V.

description: For some reason, whenever I end up here, I'm drunk to the point where I don't remember the night. However, I do always wake up remembering that I ate the crepes, and how delicious they were. The savory crepes are the best after a night of drinking. House special with avocado FTW!
author: Kazu O.

description: I'm not even entirely sure what I ate here. Stumbling over from Butter after an indulgent night, with someone else's money in hand, I managed to pinpoint an item from an incredibly long (for those happening on it in the 2am hour) food truck menu: it had cheese, mushrooms, and spinach? It was pretty cheap, and it was ready within a few minutes. It was also devoured within a few minutes. Poor Kelly S returned to find me with what was left of her money, and what was left of a crepe. Thanks for sharing, Kelly; I fully attribute my hangover-free morning to that crepe! PS) Don't miss the toppings bar, like I did. You can jazz up your snack with hot sauce and more.
author: Christina G.

description:
This place is insanely good.  Meat in crepes?!  Are you kidding me?  Party in my mouth!!!

Disclaimer: I was a bit inebriated when I came here which probably added to the flavor, but it was still really really good nonetheless.

I had the house special which is a crepe with 2 eggs, cheese and turkey.  What a blissful moment.  I just remembering hovering over the provided sriracha on the side like an eagle and devouring this thing like my life depended on it.  The mix of the slightly salty turkey with the fluffy egg and scrumptious cheese made this the olive to my theory.  And with the sriracha hot sauce on top, it just took the cake.

Goodness bless this place for being open really, really late.
author: Dan J.

description:
Crazy for crepes!  

Crepes are such an awesome and versatile food.Just like bagels, you can have them for breakfast, lunch, dinner and even dessert!

Came here late after a night out in the city. Amazzzinggg. Had the savory egg, cheese and spinach crepe. Mmmm...warm and yummy. Hit the right spot indeed. Was pretty cheap for a couple bucks. Definitely a fine establishment for good quality and decent price without the hassel of dealing with a wait, waitors and seating. Friendly workers and cash only i think? When I'm in the mood for a crepe and am in the city, I'll definitely be googling directions to this place.
author: Remy-Anne V.

description:
Drunken munchies FTW! Don't mind the fact that I was inebriated from a long night of drinking and dancing at DNA Lounge across the street, but I remember these crepes oh so well. 

I was about to make the mistake of ordering a sweet crepe (since that's all I've ever had), but my friend, who had been here before, told me to get the house special (eggs, turkey, cheese). So glad she did!! I doused it with tabasco, and I was one happy camper.
author: Elizabeth B.

description:
When I party in the city, no matter which mood I'm in or club I go to, I make sure its within drunk walking distance from Crepes A Go Go.. 

To make things easy I go to Holy Cow, which is literally a hop, skip and a drunk roll away from Crepes A Go Go.. San Francisco's night life is great, but knowing that you have this place as the after party, makes it even better!

I normally get the house special, and honestly I forget what's in it, egg ham? Idk, all I know is that its good, real good, so good that one night I ditched my friends, snuck away from the bar just to eat one, went back to Holy Cow, partied, danced, drank, and headed straight to Crepes A Go Go as soon as 2am hit and the music stopped, for round Two! Lol

Its better than dennys, ihop, jack in the crack, or any other fast food you can think of.. I've been to other restaurants, upscale & mom n pop crepe spots to see if I could find something locally that taste just as good, I had no luck! This place is really that good..
author: Glen A.

description:
This is the spot where you should get your after-hours food.

I moved here in August 2009, and I take everyone who comes to visit me here to eat.

My little sister has eaten two crepes in one visit. My best friend from San Jose begs me to take him every time he's up here (sometimes I wonder if he's really in the city to visit me...). I've eaten here two evenings in a row, and some friends I've introduced this place to have eaten three nights in a row, with multiple visits per day. I think one night I even snorted a crepe.

House special w/ avocado. They pretty much know my face already. Affordable, and enough to satisfy your belly. For San Diego-ans, its like a burrito in a HELLA tasty wrapper.

THESE ARE THE BEST CREPES IN THE CITY.

Not open on Tuesday and Wednesday though. I think those are they days when they give thanks to the Crepe Gods.
author: Harold C.

description:
What can I say... Just sooo much goodness! 
There Crepes are cooked to perfection.. 
You must try there STRAWBERRY W/NUTELLA topped off with whip cream!!! Aaaawwww heaven!! Damn that's good...
author: Shirl C.

description:
i'm on a crepe binge right now...but not just any crepe...it has to be my butter and sugar add ricotta cheese crepe from crepes a go go!  all for the low price of $4...YUM!!!

even though it has been freezing outside lately, as soon as that yummy crepe lands in my hand...i just forget about everything around me...and munch on that crepe right in front.  

i've been having a lot of "bests" lately...but hands down, this place has the best crepes i have ever had!!!
author: Jen W.

description:
Oh how I've looked for excuses to go out and party in the city, just so I can come here after 2 am and have a nutella with strawberry crepe!  Heck, there's been a few times where I came at 8 pm, before for the late night crowd comes in.  Love the sketchy old couches that one would usually be afraid to sit in, but they are a warm welcome to my usually aching feet, to the newer teak tables that are still quite comfy.

Prices have gone up since I started coming here years ago, but oh so worth it!!!  I want to have a little crepe truck in my back yard!
author: Annalyn C.

description:
Tried out the crepe truck out on Saturday and its not a bad late night drunk snack but I do not think I would go out of my way to get one unless I was in the area or near by.  The crepe itself was a pre-made crepe from what I could see as it was warmed up and not made as you order and various veggies or sweets were added as they normally would be.   I ordered a few different ones because I could not make up my mind and chose a few of the more abundant choices.

I do not remember but it was the two below the house special and then another something "lias" sweet crepe.

If you order anything with smoked turkey this is nothing but lunch meat and nothing more. I was disappointing in that considering they add 1.25 extra to your crepe which probably just bought them 3 more packs of lunch meat.  While they were making my crepes I saw them make another one with sauteed chicken, now that is the better option as it is actually bits of chicken in the crepe.

One nice thing is even though this place is open super late the line was not that bad and we did not have to wait very long to get our crepes.  Not too bad for a late night eats.
author: Robert S.

description: Out of 5 stars I would of given this place a zero. They gave me a triple whammy. I was over charged, food poisoned, and received unfriendly service. Whatever you do... Do not order anything with mushrooms they are tainted. I'm still feeling the side effects and it's horrible.
author: Stevie G.

description:
This is still THE BEST SAVORY CREPE I'VE HAD IN SAN FRANCISCO!, and the best savory crepe i've ever had anywhere....

They are open til about 5am on the weekends, and close around 1 am during the week. They are closed on Tuesdays though. Cash only but there is an outdoor ATM next door outside of the liquor store.

my favorite crepe is the SAUTEED SPINACH, HERB FETA, SAUTEED ONIONS, SUNDRIED TOMATOES one...it's so delicious and is also great with a drizzle of hot sauce. 

be prepared to wait in line if it's between 1:30am-2:30am on a Friday or Saturday night!
author: katherine m.

description: This place is awesome. It is a great stop for a late night snack. their crepes are the perfect thickness, chewy and crisp, holds everything in perfectly.  Hours vary....
author: Jay B.

description: Ok.  The one on Polk is much better.  These guys act like they hate their jobs.  Also, located in a food truck in a dicey area.  You feel as though your'e going to get mugged...
author: Tony H.

description:
Drunk or NOT!  Savory or Sweet! 

This places rocks my world. 

I was across the street at that mash-up club...(it's early and im without caffeine,  I cant remember the name)
....felt the urge to fill my belly with something other than Stolichnaya!  I didn't even care that I was with a group of people...I straight up almost got ran over crossing the street...

The line was sooooooo longgg!!!!! But the thought of bananas and nutella melting in my mouth helped me...

After about 8  minutes of waiting...I received the ultimate crepe! Walked back over munching it...Did I care that everyone wanted a piece? Noooo.......! It was gone in about 6 minutes...Okaaayy no w I reallly want one.

The service is fast---period. Not much else to say.  You tell them what you want, you pay, they make, you eat! Wallahhh! Crepes A Go Go! I guess the name says it all...

Open til 3 am...GTFOH! (getthefuckouttahere)  

Handle it one day, take a date or a friend. I promise you wont be disappointed...

Ohhhhh yaaaaaaaa....... it was the DNA Lounge....pretty rad place...Especially on Mash-up Night!
author: Maronita I.

description:
Been out dancing/bar crawling in the SOMA and need a pick me up? Something sweet (or savory!), cheap and warm? Crepes A Go Go will satisfy all those and more! Well, maybe not much more...?
I am a sucker for nutella crepes. Mix that with fruit and leave me alone while I eat, kthxbye. 
Late night noshing at it's best!!! 
Heart! Heart! Heart!
author: joanna r.

description:
What would I do w/o this place? Best place to go HANDS DOWN for food either before or after the club. HELL I'll make two trips in a night for this joint! 

Sit on those grimey shady looking couches and chill out w/your crepe in your club attire or skanky dress. Trust me. It just makes it so much better.

Anything is good on the menu. Seriously. My favorite is the crepe w/cheese, mushroom and spinach. Try it. It's better than sex after a six month hiatus.
author: Tisha G.

description: One of the best crepes I've ever had, and I've been to Paris. Granted, it was 3am and I was a little tipsy from a nearby club, but the fact that this gem is open so late grants it every star!
author: Mark S.

description:
Came to get crepes last night after a night out dancing- this place never disappoints. Mind you, we never come to this place sober, but it's pretty cheap, fast, and tasty. 

We had the spinach, mushroom & cheese crepe (so good!) and also tried the lemon crepe (surprisingly good!)

Brownie points for one of the guys that works there- he was cracking jokes and being funny; definitely makes waiting in line a lot more tolerable :)
author: Margaret T.

description:
First time I came here, it was after a hunt for some creme brulee truck (no such luck), so we decided to get us some crepes. 
Tried the house special and the nutella with strawberries and bananas. 
House special (turkey, egg and cheese) was really good.. but it threw me off a little bit b/c the crepe was really sweet. But I splashed on a bunch of Tapatio and all was well. :)
The nutella w/ strawberries and bananas was really good too. I mean, how could you go wrong with that combo? I would have LOVED to have lychee ice cream in it (a la Genki on Clement), but they don't have that there... either way, I'm going back.. sober or drunk!
author: Gizelle P.

description:
i pay the 4.00 toll or the 5.00 toll on weekends to get these crepes!! I live in Oakland...that should tell u how wonderfully delicious the freaking crepes are...For sweet get the king Lias!! Savory get turkey,cheese, egg & spinach my fav, or the house special my lovey's favorite!! i usually go for dinner eat it alllll, get back in line for dessert hahahah hmmm i think i'm going to take a trip to crepes a go go tonight.. =) 

Happy eating!!!
author: Whitney N.

description:
I love how this food cart is located in the SOMA near a bunch of clubs/bars.  The staff here is so friendly and PATIENT - especially with all the drunk people clamoring to purchase a crepe!! 

Quality is great and portions are generous.  Come by if you are in need of a late night snack!
author: Cherlyn M.

description:
I've only been here once and, to me,what i ordered tasted exactly like a quesadilla... it was cheesy with a crispy tortilla-ish wrapping...

I probably ordered the wrong dish here, but it wasnt even that good if it WAS a quesadilla...

Im sure next time i'll order a sweet one with nutella or something... however, in the meantime, this place gets a 2 Star rating from me...
author: Mario S.

description:
My friendly neighborhood crepe truck! What? Your 'hood doesn't have one? You should work on that...

Drunk/Sober/2am/7pm if you're craving something savory I recommend the spinach, turkey and cheese... for the sweet, my stand by is the nutella and strawberries. Yum!

The characters you meet in line can certainly add charm to the experience, and they recently upgraded from nasty upholstered Good Will furniture to wooden patio Good Will chairs. Much more sanitary if you're too drunk to stand as you inhale your crepe, but less conducive to awkward drunken PDA. Win-Win!

In conclusion, I heart you Crepes A Go Go... because sometimes, you just need it.
author: Shannon B.

description:
Darn we did not beat the rush!

Arrived almost close to 2 am and the line was to the streets! Located in between two buildings and on a busy nightlife street this place must be good! The menu is real simple. Nothing out of the ordinary. Dessert crepes with strawberries, honey, cream, ricotta, sugar, chocolate etc. The savory crepes menu is small and plain. Eggs, turkey (slices) cheese, avocados, spinach.. WHERES THE MEAT!

1-star off the fact that the person cooking the crepe let his friends cut the massive line to take a 10 crepe order! We aren't that dumb people!

1-star off the community condiments section. Its dirty.. real dirty! 

Overall the crepes are good. What sets this place out from other crepe places is that they crisp up the crepes until its crunchy. At first I thought the crepes were burnt but no.
