The added texture makes the crepe good. They let the crepes sit on the stove until all the fillings melt and combine with each other. 

Come check this place out. Try to come before 1:30 am to beat everyone to the punch :)
author: Geneve V.

description:
Best late night option that doesn't leave you feeling disgusting the next morning.

The crepes are crispy and meant to be eaten handheld.  I usually get the one with spinach/mushroom since that's my favorite veggie combo.  For something meaty, the cheese/beef/jalapenos is awesome and tastes like a gigantic Jack in the Box taco.

The workers are good sports and put up with all the antics of their late night customers too.
author: S L.

description:
I had to try this place out based on how amazing everyone said it was on Yelp... and people, it's true! You like sweet stuff? They got it. You like your crepes savory? They got it. You're flat broke and have like $3 to your name? They can feed you. Oh and when is this place NOT open? I showed up after work at around 2:55am and they were STILL open. Heaven. The crepes are totally customizable so you have a world of endless possibilities. Also i noticed one of the reviewers stating that the mushrooms came out of a can, but yesterday they were fresh mushrooms that tasted very much like hen in the woods mushrooms. Rather classy for a friggin' truck on the street!

So yeah, go here... and if i'm there, please buy me a crepe ;)
author: Bc L.

description:
Savory crepes are DELICIOUS!.. by far the best place for Crepes!

And they are open late night!?  Yay!

If you are trying to grab a quick bite after the bar.. make sure you go leave the bar/club 10-15 minutes early to order.. because it does get busy with buzzed and hungry crepe-eaters!  

They also have a table of hot sauces!.. Sooo many hot sauces.. Sweet Chili sauce too!! my fave.. but not on my crepe. =]
author: Elaine H.

description:
It's 2am in San Francisco - you're sick of the crappy pizza around, you don't want to be robbed by going to Won Mee because it's too expensive for the mediocre Korean food, so where do you go?! CREPES A GO GO. 

They bang out your crepes quick, the crepe is crispy, the filling is generous and you'll have satisfied your munchies ASAP. We came out to this truck Saturday night after trolling around Union Square and this place was busy - good busy. You can't go wrong with the House Special (egg, cheese, turkey, and spinach I think?) - but add 2 more toppings and you're at $8.00+ for a crepe. 

On most nights, I'd probably pick this over pizza as a late nite snack.
author: Jessica C.

description:
If you haven't been here before, you're really missing out.  This is the spot to be before and after a night in the clubs.  It's a ritual spot to go to after the club, heck it wouldn't hurt to go before as well. The two gentlemen working inside this mini-crepe truck are known by the club patrons because they're always there and of course, they make the crepes sooo darn good

The food itself is made to order and is just wonderful!  The house special is a must for the first timers but if you're more on the sweet side of the crepe world, try it with nutella and a fruit of your choice that they have, usually it's strawberries and/or bananas served with a good puff of whipped cream.  I'm always stuck on the house special or the ham/spinach/feta cheese crepe which hits the spot all the damn time.  

Located by the near the old Loft 11 (now Mist) and a door down from Butter, hit up 11th Street and look for a line of people or sniff your way to the crepe goodness coming out of the truck.
author: Max-Adam A.

description:
Pretty solid. 

Despite the crepe shell itself being pre- made, it was crispy and satisfying. This place is all about the fillings. Definitely get cheese on your savory crepe, nutella on your sweet one. Be careful of the savory juices squirting out- you should probably use utensils and/or a bunch of napkins. 

I'd come back for the savory stuff, but the lack of ice cream makes a sweet crepe disappointing. Nutella makes anything good, but it can't beat nutella and ice cream together.
author: anirina e.

description: You have to get the sauteed chicken crepe with cheese....just to die for! I'll gladly drive into the city just got one of their crepes any day!
author: Katharine C.

description: This spot is the best!!! My boyfriend and I just drive up to the city from San Jose for just crepes LOL
author: Mariesther V.

description:
Now called Crepes Ooh La La.

We stopped in for "dessert" after eating lunch. Had the banana almond honey crepe and it was great. Very neat little place and may stop in again if we are in the neighborhood before leaving town.

Very reasonable price and amount of banana in our crepe.
author: Chris C.

description: I only tend to roll by here well past midnight but the crepes are fabulous after a night of drinks. They have an assortment of savory and sweet crepes that are freshly made and really hit the spot. The ingredients are surprisingly quite gourmet and the combinations are endless. If you are out in this part of SOMA, you should definitely joint  the drunk zombies and grab a crepe.
author: Ed L.

description: They are conveniently located amongst several bars in SOMA. I had the banana and nutella crepe and it was amazing. They have such a long list of crepes, I am looking forward to going back and trying more.
author: Andrew M.

description:
This is my go to late night grub spot! There is never a night when I am not in the mood for a House Special with Siracha from the Crepe truck!

It is amazing how as soon as I cross the bridge for a night of drinking and dancing that my mouth starts watering thinking about 2am when I get to eat crepes!

Make sure to bring cash and a coat, but the food is so worth it!
author: Maya-Luisa G.

description: no not good compared to crepes in Japantown in my opinion.  but that can be because I am an Asian lol.  the crepe part is too thick.  content is too plain.
author: Shuting Z.

description:
Quite Yummy.

Who can argue w/a Crepe w/Nutella in it?? Seriously.

Just wish they were open during the day so I could go for a quick cheep lunch.
Oh well. A girl can dream can't she?
author: Stella D.

description: Oh honey boo boo child, this place is finger lickin', tomatoes falling on my shoes, Tabasco added for a kick, cheesy, delicious in a hand held pocket $5 of goodness gooooooooddd!
author: Shira O.

description:
Get a crepe after Holy Cow; your drunk friends will thank you after you discover your crepe has mysteriously disappeared because you let your drunk friend hold it while you drive them to Nations...

Three words. One conjunction. Banana and Nutella Crepe. Not too soggy, not too crispy, just right and just sweet.

We arrived shortly after 1:30AM and I, almost, cried. Why? Because after my friend ordered a crepe, they turned off the "OPEN" sign, right before I walked up to the window. Thankfully they were just kidding. But I think they saw that little sparkle in my eye and realized that, maybe, they really did hurt my feelings. So, they were really nice for hooking me up with whipped cream and a bottle of water. Whoo hoo! Love you, Crepes A Go Go!
author: Maggie H.

description:
These crepes are wonderful - savory and sweet, equally wonderful. Sure, I've never had them while I was of sober mind and body but still... still wonderful. 

Standing in that drunken line is pretty hilarious too. You get all that entertainment for the price of a crepe! Great deal, no?
author: Alli J.

description: Their crepes are amazing.  It is a cool little truck that sells amazing food. A fun experience and great food ( strawberry one my favorite)
author: Shante S.

description: Savory, or sweet. Either way is a great treat!!!
author: Anthony N.

description:
So my friends and I were standing in line waiting to get into Mist when I suddenly got REALLY hungry. As I thought about the potential alcohol consumption that was about to go down, I started worrying about how my stomach might react, you know, being empty and all. Fortunately, I smelled a hint of something sugary and buttery in the air. I looked down the street and to my delight, saw a crepe truck! (What a genius idea!)

One of the friends I was with had been to Crepes A Go Go before and recommended their savory crepes. So I hurry over and order a cheese and egg crepe, hoping that service is quick so I can make it back before the line hits the door. The chef has a pile of pre-made crepes ready to be filled with fresh ingredients. I was very excited to see him put a ton of cheese and crack an egg directly onto the egg--I knew it would be delicious. And it was! So delicious, in fact, that we went back after we got out of the club and ordered sweet (chocolate and strawberry) and savory (smoked turkey, cheese, egg) crepes. I love how efficient they are and how fresh and clean everything is--definitely a treat whether you're intoxicated or not.
author: Jennifer C.

description: I'm going to say it.. this is the best crepe truck in the world. Ever. Look at the reviews. millions of San Franciscans don't lie. Cheap crepes. After a night of drinking at Butter, you know where you want to go.. next door to this fucking place. That's right. Fuck yea. And if you don't like it because of some stick up your ass for being a crepe connoisseur or some other bullshit, that's fine. You're obviously too pretentious to matter to anyone. Fuck you. These crepes are bomb at 2AM.
author: Eddie P.

description: Absolute best way to end a drunken night of fun. I am so grateful my friend introduced me to this delicious spot. I had the turkey cheese and apple crepe. OMFG. So glad I went savory instead of sweet. Definitely recommend you stumble on over after getting your drink on.
author: Lauren N.

description: This little crepe stand serves some serious bomb diggity delicious crepe! I've tried the dessert and the savory crepes and omgggggg it was sooooo goood... It's better to eat it when it's fresh. I've tried other crepe places in the city and this one by far my favorite one!
author: Cam H.

description:
I'm sorry, but if I wasn't completely !@#$ faced, I would never come here. As far as drunk food is concerned, it's very hard to go wrong with meat, melted cheese, and a pancake. Actually, if there is melted cheese it's pretty much going to be awesome. But let's be real, the crepes here aren't really even that great! They only have turkey! What no ham?! How can you have a creperie without any ham? And yes, I know that's because of religious reasons, but still...no ham and cheese crepe? That's rough.

I also lived in Paris, so I'm kind of a snob about crepes. 

The great part about this place is that it's open until like 4 or 5 am, far later than any other drunk eateries. Chances are if you're hitting this place up around that time, you're going to love it. The bad news is that it's way over in no-mans-land SOMA and you probably had to drive to get there. Meaning you are driving totally wasted, or you have a really nice DD.

Honestly, it can't hold a candle to being drunk and getting Taqueria Cancun. Thank god I live in the Mission.
author: Kelsey E.

description: Its not the best looking place but I love everything else about it! Conveniently located across the street from DNA/ Bootie LA and opened late, sells both savory and sweet crepes so you can come here either for a snack or a meal. I ordered a chicken, bell peppers and cheese savory crepe and it was delicious! Especially when topped with hot sauce, which they had several varieties to choose from. It was a good size and had a good amount of meat. It cost about $7 and was worth it. I wish they had a location in SoCal!
author: Vee N.

description: The absolute best place to go to for a late night crepe. There is another late night crepe cart on Howard and 2nd, which I tried only out of extreme hunger and proximity, but it was much more expensive and not as tasty. King Lias for a sweet crepe and House Special for a savory. I usually get both :)
author: Danielle S.

description:
House special doused with Tapitio.  
I wouldn't steer you wrong. 

GREAT. nay.  AMAZING at any time and in any state (whether inebriated or sober bunny).    Do it to it.
author: Deanna A.

description:
No visit to SF is complete without visiting my dearest Crepes A Go Go. Please come to San Diego so I can enjoy your delicious crepes more often. 
Not only are all the crepes delicious, but they are relatively cheap. I love how they are open so late to accommodate my crepe craving at the most ungodly hour. The fact that the guy serving had a french accent also made it feel more authentic. 
Most of their customers are also very eccentric... or should I just say drunk? We once came here at 1 am and watched a drunk guy order a breakfast burrito.
author: Renee E.

description:
AWESOME and TASTY late night bites for those going home from the bars.

This truck reminds me of the kebab and crepe trucks in Paris that serve all sorts of good stuff at the late night hours, when people are waiting for the metro to open in the 5:30 am in the morning and still want to hang out and chat, flirt, etc.

Try the special, or anything with eggs in it.  If you're in doubt, just pick something.  I'm sure it will be good.

The crepes are also just as good when it's busy as when it's not-so-busy.  Consistent quality makes me happy.

Just ask Florent to work his magic and you'll be satisfied with a tasty treat.

Make sure you tip these hard-working cooks generously.  There is a tip jar.  I'm sure they accept $20s and $100-bills  if you're feeling really generous.

This place should stay open forever.  I love crepes, especially good ones like the crepes at Crepes A Go Go :)

"Merci beaucoup et bon week-end!!"
author: Justin C.

description:
It's 3 in the morning, and I just came back from the crepe truck after a night of moderated drinking.

The owner was extremely personable and gregarious.  He was friendly to all of his customers (gave me a 25c discount because I didn't have change), and put in some extra effort to entertain the females (especially the attractive ones).

I ordered a house special, which consists of smoked turkey, egg and cheese, and it was exactly what you would expect it to be.  It was excellent for what it was, but I didn't sense anything special.  It's a decent spot for a 2 AM snack, but I would probably not take a cab down from Nob Hill just to get a crepe during the day.
author: Bill T.

description:
So yea.. EVERYBODY loves this place for late night after bar/club munchies...

But I will admit... I came here:

1.) Sober

2.) After work in the Fidi (6pm) - I even called ahead to make sure they were open, cus I thought they were only open during late night hours

3.) And I still ate like 1 1/2 (me n the bf shared the 3rd crepe)

Even with the option to going to other crepe restaurants..that like offer seating, and a table.. I still chose Crepes A GoGo.  Its that good.

What me n the bf ALWAYS get:

Me - Cheese, mushroom, tomato - ADD green onions
BF - House Special ADD mushrooms
To Share: House Special ADD pineapples

I don't know if its cus the crepe is freshly made, and not sogging feeling/tasting, or maybe its wonderful people making it... but its daymn addicting! 

Who needs a smacy restaurant, when you can get some bomb crepes, and eat in the comforts in your car?! 

*NOTE: dont try to eat a huge crepe from here while trying to drive =X
author: Deanna T.

description:
Went there again last night..

Got me the "King Lias" and Chicken savory crepes..

damn I love this spot!!!!
author: Roger A.

description:
So, after a fun filled night of chowing down, being frightened, and exposed to some of SF finest, we decided we needed something sweet to make the night complete.  We tried to go to Hot Cookie in the Castro but must have just missed them as it was now after 1am.  So my friend tells me about a place down by the clubs where you can get all sorts of crepes!  Are you kidding?  I was just thinking about crepes earlier.  

So we drive up and I was amazed by a crepe taco truck surrounded by tons of club goers!  SCORE!  The single mom is a partyin' tonight!

We get in the very Seinfeld Soup Kitchen line, place our orders and fall the fuck back to a covered patio with Cmas lights as it is raining some cats and dawgs--WOOF WOOF WOOF!  Waiting with us was some hoogies, dorks, gays,  and much more.  How  freaking AWESOME is this!

Okay, I dont get out much.  Sue me! :)

Finally, we get our crepes.  Mine: Nutella and Strawberry.  Hers: Cheese, Spinach and Tomato.  Mine was delish but hers was OMG great.  Remember, Im a lame with new places under pressure so I just went for what I knew!

I had a great time!  Friday the 13th, carried into Valentines with one of my dearest friends in the world.  Who could ask for more!
author: Virgo M.

description: What's better than huddling around a beat up rickety trailer contraption of sorts with a bunch of drunk friends in the wee hours of the night waiting for such a magnificent and succelent treat that is, a crepe... You tell me, but whether it's ending the night on a good note or an intermission between inebriation, I always feel like this is a must stop during my visit to the City. Whether I remember how delicious this place is or not, just go there and order and you can thank me later. Nutella, bananas and strawberries... yeah buddy.
author: Aaron M.

description:
Another night of drunkenness, this time at Slide, which means another night of heavenly savory crepes at Crepes A Go Go for my usual favorite, House Special with Turkey and Avocado and Cheese.

You can imagine the smile on my face when my ordered got called out.  The rain didn't stop me, the traffic didn't stop me, the drunk driving didn't stop me (that's bad, btw), but gotta get my crepes at 2:30 am!
author: Vincent K.

description:
My experience was laid out and described to me before arrival.  

Crepes?  Never had one (I'm pretty basic, especially when it comes to breakfast).  
Do they have sides? No.  Whaaa???  Only crepes? Whoa, weird.
Oh, and the food comes out of a truck.   HUH??  
Is there seating?  They have seats outside of the truck where you can sit.

Insert one of favorite phrases here:  This outta be good.

Umm, I will say, I was not lead astray. Crepes a Go Go was just as described. Only difference was, I was actually a satisfied customer!  

At about $9 a pop, I was very intrigued by this crepe that was 1. not eaten on a plate w/ a knife and fork and 2. able to be eaten as advertised "on the go" and 3. steamy and delicious!  

Nothing beats those first couple bites w/ the near-burned cheese.

To top it alll off, I ate here stone sober.  :-)
author: Abby T.

description:
I'm not cuckoo for crepes like some people I know and will never go out of my way to get one but the other night after Butter, I had a bunch of out of towners that were in dire need of snacks.  Luckily, this truck was right outside.

I thought they were going to get one.  They got 3, a banana nutella, turkey, egg and cheese and an egg and cheese.  I had bites of each as they were passed all around.  Pretty tasty and cheap for a late snack.  

One of the visitors came down with strep throat the following week and those  damn crepes haunted me for days until I confirmed I didn't catch it.
author: Seong P.

description:
How can you not give 5 stars to these guys for putting up with all the drunks that congregate here after all the clubs shut down along 11th & Folsom? They know how to keep their cool.

Example:
Hot mess: "Hey! This isn't what I ordered! I didn't ask for pineapples!!"
Crepe guy: "What did you order?"
Hot mess: "I dunno... What did I order?!"

Imagine having to deal with a bunch of wasted people with the worst case of the munchies in the wee hours of the night. And you're the only one who's sober. Now that's commendable. 

Oh, and 5 stars for the tastiest $5 nutella, banana, caramel and whipped cream crepe I've ever eaten at 2am! The savory or sweet combos are endless, and perfect for those late night cravings.

Tip: To avoid the mad rush, get here at 1:45am. If you're a guy, make sure your valuables don't fall out of your pockets if you plan on sitting on the make out couch. You don't want to put your hands between those nasty cushions.
author: Connie C.

description:
THE. BEST.

The best crepe recipe - fluffy and delish!
The best customer service - funny, fast, and friendly!
The best fourth meal option - 100x healthier than pepperoni pizza or bacon wrapped hot dogs at 2AM.

It may seem too good to be true, but it's not. It's all true and too good! Aren't we lucky?
author: Jaclyn T.

description:
I really can't accurately rate this place I think until I come here sober.

But for a place to hit up after a night out...I love this place.  I always go for the turkey + chicken + avocado savory, followed by a strawberry + nutella sweet.  I always feel good about this decision.

That's all I can really write about, because I never remember anything else.
author: Robert S.

description:
Doooooooood. 

this place is awesome! late night crepes, delish, hot, crunchy on the outside, the soft gooey yummy cheesy insides (or sweets if you so choose!) 

perfect for soaking up all that vodka, beer, tequila, whatever you imbibed in in the duration of your evening.  

Yes, it looks dirty, it feels dirty, it's in a seedy kinda gross part of town, in this tiny lookin' rat lot, but once you have that delicious hot crepe in hand...you totally just don't give a damn.

This trashy trailer definitely delivers the goods!
author: Lulu C.

description:
Butter kind of kicked my ass.

Not in a Royce Gracy Brazilian Jujitsu choke out kinda way, but in a 26 chimps on Red Bull laced with PCP kinda way.

As much as i truly appreciate being hand fed golden nuggets of deep fried potatoey goodness by beautiful Russian coders, i was aching for some drunken eats, and the White Castle burger ship set sail a long fuck time ago.

It was Yelp's own Queen Amidala Jessica T that suggested we hit up this joint in an effort to soak up (count them) the FIVE forties and three Jello shots in my system. 

In my drunken slur, complete with the stagger, i ordered a crepe in what sounded like Huttian, the native language of Jabba the Hutt.

"Tonga me no crepe go bakka turkey gonda makka cheese gonn paattuu.......*hiccup*...."

"Ok, one smoked turkey, extra cheese."

"Bonka ko neega sho Jedi mattu kon waggi?"

"Yes, yes....$4.50 please."

"......... ho ho hoooooooo..."

"Thank you Sir."

Aside from the C3P0 protocol droid they had translating for me, the service was faster than a carbonite freezing.
author: Mick F.

description: A turkey cheddar crepe that is conveniently packed for late night drunken travel on San Francisco streets? BOMB!  That is all
author: Edith G.

description:
This place is great late-night. I like these crepes because they aren't as greasy as squat and gobble, crepevine, etc. I generally order the avocado, tomato, and cheddar cheese crepe (and i add mushrooms and sriracha hot sauce) it is amazing when you've had a couple drinks! I wished they used quality, organic ingredients...then I would give them 5 stars. But, for what it is, it's great :)

I'll be coming back for more...
author: Lina M.

description:
I'm totally spoiled by working next to this place. No matter the chef, I've always gotten awesome crepes. Perfectly cooked, customized any which way, and just tasty tasty tasty. (I try not to think of the cholesterol in them.) Makes a great snack or a light meal.

Times visited: 10+
author: Amy L.

description:
Crepes a Go Go came to my office today to make crepes during a meeting...they brought everything:  the round hot thingies that you make the crepe on, the long stick thing to flip the crepes and enough Nutella to make Kristina R. shed tears of joy.  

Sidebar:  Kristina, I just had a great idea...instead of shotgunning double fudge Yoo Hoo how about we get some Costco size jars of Nutella and melt it down into a tasty beverage for you?  Just a thought.

Back to our regularly scheduled review.

The crepes were huge and easily could have fed three people.  That didn't stop me from polishing off a strawberry/lemon/sugar crepe an hour after lunch.  I'll definitely drop by next time I'm drunk and hungry in SOMA.
Oh la la!
author: phil h.

description:
late night grubbin especially after getting outta clubs!
house special with avocados and tomatoes is the shit!
author: Candy C.

description: Hot damn, I think I've fallen in love....with a crepe? Anything's possible. There's much to choose from whether you have a sweet tooth or want something hearty. Feel free to add any extra ingredients if you like for  just a few cents more per item. I kept it simple with a Nutella, banana and strawberry crepe. From first bite to last, the whole thing was crispy. NOM-worthy ecstasy in my hand, I tell you. The long conversation my group and I had while overhearing drunk people sing karaoke at one of the nearby bars brought an interesting end to the evening. And to think, it took someone not from the Bay Area to bring me here. A million thanks for the rec!
author: Rhia R.

description:
There are three things you can do when you're hungry at the DNA Lounge on a Saturday night. You can go to the pizza place next door, you can get a deep fried Twinkie at Butter, or you can go to Crepes A Go Go parked in a little lot across the street, where you will be called "ma cher" by the guy in the booth as he asks where you've been all his life, while the other guy (who I think never talks?) makes you the most delicious type of food that you probably shouldn't be having at 1AM.

I always get the lemon butter sugar crepe. Their crepes are thin and served in a cone, which is how I like it. I've also had a ham and cheese one, and a nutella crepe, and I think something with pesto, but I keep craving the lemon butter sugar. My friend Em and I were jayrunning across 11th street, butter sugar running down our chins. She said, "Woah... ooooh.... mmm!" I said "Yuh huh!" I wanted to run back immediately and get another one, but resisted the temptation. Then I drunk dialed P.B. Cat because I was so happy.
author: Tanya F.

description:
Why no jambon monsieur?  Turkey, zut alors.

There's nothing better than a hot crispy crepe from a Frenchman at 2 in the morning.  I was sad there was no ham.  Fong berated the Frenchman for not having gruyere.  So embarrassing.  Gruyere is SWISS.  Comté, Fongy!  Then he facetiously told us he didn't have nutella!  Gaaah.  Anyway, I got turkey, jack and eggs, such an American crepe but I made lewd noises while eating it so it was obviously made by a Frenchman.

Oooooh la la!

Also, enjoy the covered outdoor seating that looks like a dead couch collection!
author: Elena S.

description:
oh man..... the crepe complet.... perhaps the greatest accomplishment in all of french cuisine.  The ingredients are simple:  ham, eggs, cheese, and crepe (water, eggs, flour, etc).  This place makes the closest thing I've had in SF to the perfection that is a crepe complet.

When I watched the masters on the streets of paris, they would do this:  throw a crepe on their little circular griddle, and then pour a large amount of shredded gruyere (yes, elena... SWISS... xo), on half of it.  THe griddle would be appropriately oversized so they could spill some of that cheese over the edge of the crepe and it would get browned ang caramelized (read:  CRISPY and aromatic).  Then they would throw ham and eggs on it , fold it in half, flip it a few times, and then fold it in thirds and serve it in one of those flat paper cone thingies.

These guys, made it almost as good--even browning the cheese at the edge slightly (though not enough).

but, my dear algerian owner friend... HOW CAN YOU NOT HAVE SWISS?!?!?   And where's the ham!??!  JAMBON et Fromage et Oeuf, my friend.... JAMBON.....  not turkey....  so for that, minus one star.

But damn, this is the best place to get a crepe in the city.
allons zi!
author: Fong L.

description:
YummmmO!!! Who doesn't like crepes with bananas, strawberries, whipped cream and of course NUTELLA!!!!! I'm such a sucker for nutella! The price wasn't too bad either. 

thanks to cousin for taking me here! :)
author: stacylee a.

description:
You mean, instead of greasy slices of pizza in the wee hours of the morning...I get to choose from a selection of crepes?!? SNAP.

We were searching for a place to grab a quick bite before heading to WISH, so Diane P. whips out the crackberry and voila! Yelp approved? Crepes A Go Go was a Go...har har;)

Though my crepe w/ red peppers, eggplant, onions, and feta cheese wasn't too bad...the raging carnivore within me was more satisfied with the house special of eggs, turkey, and cheese and the crepe w/ chicken, bell peppers, and cheese. YUM. They even have like 10 different hot sauces to choose from too! Ahhh...Seriously.. hits. the. spot. and this was even BEFORE our night began. Wow. We came back AFTER our night was over to try the sweet crepes and Mr. Crepemaker recognized us and laughed. It's ok Mr. Crepemaker, I wasn't offended b/c you were cute and fed me :)
author: Irene B.

description: I'm not big on crepes, but OMG so good! Came here across the street from Slim's and got the nutella and banana crepe, super sugary and rich, but ughhh so dericious! A little pricey, but the crepes are HUGE! Mine was so rich and large that I only ate about half of it.
author: Jaclyn C.

description:
Best place to get crepes. First time i heard of this place from my buddy alex i said to him you have to be kidding. But o boy he wasnt playing around. Right after the clubs in the city we came straight here and the line was super long but we were super drunk and super hungry. I waited for about 45mins to get my crepe and it was well worth it. The asian dude and the european cats making it was doing their best trying to get as many crepes out as possible without making a bad crepe. And they did it. Mines came out super good, i had the house special and that came with a egg in it and damn that was tasty. 

This place is a money maker, with that little kart between the clubs. Who ever thought about this place gets two thumbs up from me.

Food: Excellent
Service: Excellent
Parking: None

5 Stars for the best Crepe spot in frisco.
author: Lux K.

description:
It was good

Satiated my chocolate craving

Thank you crepe truck
author: Bobby B.

description: Maybe it was the drinks talking, but one thing I did remember about my night of clubbing was how friggin' good these crepes were. There wasn't too big a line, and the service was fast and friendly. The favorite was bananas and nutella with whip *delicious*, but another good choice was one with Jalapenos, cheese, and ground beef. Delicious. If you're around the area, definitely worth a drop in. And if it's after the clubs get out, its a great place for people watching.
author: Vittorio L.

description:
After hours on this side of town, the crepe man is the safest one you'll meet.   No smooth talking--just a nod to your request for extra cheese. In fact, he barely makes eye contact with you (cuz he's busy making your crepe with perfection!), and he's definitely not out to get your number (just the $4 for a crepe). He won't molest or harass you. He just wants to feed you. How sweet is that?

The house special (egg, turkey, cheese) is always reliable. Always. For a sweeter option, try the nutella & honey crepe. I like to add lots of fruit to mine. 

A huge step up from your usual late-night grub, this is where the after-party happens. No guest lists necessary. Come before 2AM to avoid the crowds.
author: Rona J.

description:
This place is simply awesome. The guy working there says they stay open until 4 or 5am sometimes to support the hungry club and bar people coming from Slim's, Butter and elsewhere.

I had the "House Special" which consisted of a double dose of turkey, cheese and egg. I added avocado and hot sauce and it was heavenly. I liked it so much that I went back later to get a dessert crepe with Nutella, strawberries and bananas. It rocked. There just aren't enough places like this in the world.
author: Aaron V.

description:
The biggest problem I have here is choosing savory or sweet?  Well, why not get both?  

These are how crepes should be made: thin, crispy and hot with something tasty like nutella and cream or cheese and avocado within stumbling distance of the DNA lounge!

It took me a while to discover this treasure here, but now that I have, I dream about it!!!

Can't beat the filling choices, prices and just pure entertainment from the workers to the drunk people waiting for their hot nom noms!
author: Q T.

description:
First visit:  Ham & fried egg crepe ~ midnight ~ lovely.  Crepe guy was strong silent type.

Second visit:  Nutella and sliced banana crepe ~ 9pm ~  lovelier ~ Crepe guy remembered us...called us gentlemen, and proceeded to give us a tour of his establishment, complete with a breakdown of the previous night's events: Some 7 foot crack addict punched a hole into his bathroom door.  All because strong, but not-not-so silent-anymore type says: "bathrooms for customers only."  Props to you for sticking to your guns!  Had it been my joint - I'd have been like "My crepery is your crepery, here's the keys...just lock up when you're done!"  Thanks for the tour.

3rd visit:  Nutella and fresh strawberries and Ricotta cheese with fresh strawberries. ~ 10 pm ~ divine.  Crepe guy called us "heroes" cuz we bad-mouthed some crepery we had been to on Haight last weekend.

No, crepe man: you're my hero.  Rock on!
author: Mc Matty b.

description:
Crepes a go-go on 11th & Folsom is the perfect place to get a late night snack while dancing the night away at Remedy!!!!!!!! I sure miss my tasty crepes a go-go! My friend Herm and I even made the Crepes a go-go on Union Street a ritual every Sunday morning :-)

You've gotta try the Spinach, Mushroom, Avocado, and Cheese! It's also great with an Orangina :P~

update: I just wanted to let everyone kno that the SF crepes a go go are probably by far the best with food, service, etc. We recently ventured to their Monterrey location and was completely disappointed with the gentleman working there. My S/O and I both ordered the same crepe (our usual), but he only charged us for one and then did not even make our 2nd when we asked him about it!!!!!!!!! He moved on to the next party...how deaf or stupid can he be??? my S/o was SO PIST.....he walked out without his crepe and refused to have me reorder him one!

not only that but...apparently some lady ran off without paying for her crepe and this guy charged this poor, innocent elderly woman DOUBLE the price and even admitted to it!!! He tried to give her a DOLLAR back but she refused, I think she was more pist than anything!! OMG!!! What A HORIBLE experience, I still have nightmares about it til this day!! So I'd much rather have my crepe in SF...its quite a drive but it may just be worth it.............as long as that one guy from monterrey isn't working :)...I may have to bump this place down two stars just because of that one experience, sorry guys~!

I must also mention that the owner is very nice always would speak to me in french (before they got REALLY busy)!! And that is why I love my 11th st.  crepes a gogo!
author: Cheryl S.

description:
I can't stand working so close to this place. We are still open when most of the other clubs are closed. A lot of the drunks need to soak up that alcohol so after they buy that wrapped up in foil crepe they like to stand at the bus stop near my work and eat/inhale it up.

We all know crepes are french, aren't they? It's cool because the french dudes making these crepes will be listening to french hip hop.
I have this picture somewhere of a dog standing up against the trailer in line. I will post it when I find it.
The house special is my favorite, minus the eggs. add avocado.
author: Andrew Z.

description: Love the place or van! GREAT!T if not the BEST crepes I have had. When, I was drinking or should I say over intoxicated on alcohol at 2a.m. being drunk and eating at this place is heaven
author: Grant S.

description:
I've been a huge fan of Crepes a go go without even knowing they were called that until this weekend, which is when I also realized thanks to my friend that I haven't reviewed it.  What is wrong with me?

I FUCKING LOVE THIS PLACE.

I love the guys who work there.
I love the crepes they make.
I love the fact that they only open late night when you're drunk and salivating for something yummy.
I love that it's a trailer.
I love that they have couches, as a dirty as they are, right next to 'em to lounge in and to devour that savory goodness.
I love that everyone there is drunk too so it makes for some fun and serendipitous encounters.
And last but not least I love the fact they changed their menu recently and added the SAUTEED CHICKEN W/RED PEPPERS, GARLIC, AND CHEESE crepe to their menu and that it is the fucking best crepe ever in the whole damn world.
author: Diana C.

description:
I want to give this place between 3 and 5 stars, but right now I'm puking my guts out and they're the only possible culprit.  This happened the last time I ate here too.

Perhaps I've simply reached the limit for eat-while-standing-with-drunk-assholes-after-hour-crepes.  Prior to these two delightful episodes I've eaten here like a hundred times going back to 2001ish with no problems.

Time for a new crepe wagon.
author: Ryan P.

description:
I wonder if everyone else has the same reaction that I did the first time they stumble down 11th Street past what can only be described as a hole in the middle of the block with a trailer parked in it. 

I also wonder whether I'm alone in appreciating the sly humor of operating a crepe stand  -- in a trailer -- immediately adjacent to Butter, San Francisco's homage to shabby chic.

What I know everyone is turned on to is how good a crepe is when you're starving and drunk. 'nuf said.
author: Karsten P.

description:
Whomever came up with the idea to put a crêpe truck here deserves some sort of humanitarian award. Centrally located between SoMa hotspots like Butter, DNA Lounge, Slims and Fat City, Crêpes-a-go-go caters mainly to the post-club drunken masses. The menu is intimidatingly large, the ingredients are very fresh, the staff are friendly, and the grease quotient is perfect (afterall, if you wanna avoid that menacing hangover the next morning, some grease is essential). 

Since Crêpes-a-go-go is literally down the street from where I live, my roommate & I have been seen stumbling down to the truck late at night amidst a stoned stupor on a shameless munchies conquest. We leave satisfied everytime.

Not to mention, there's a really hot boy who works the late shift some nights. He can spread his nutella on w-h-a-t-e-v-e-r he wants, hunny.

Okkkkaaaay!
author: Matthew H.

description: My favorite place for a sweet crepe in the bay area.  I don't know how many times I have skipped dessert at a restaurant and swung by this place to finish a meal. They're open late so it's also the perfect place to hit after clubbing. Everyone I took here loved it. Anything with nutella is great but you should also give a shot to the one with butter and sugar, a classic that really emphasizes the batter which I think is particularly good here.
author: Laurent P.

description:
As an out-of-towner, I decided to look on this fine site for advice on where to find some crepes.  I was very unlucky in my attempt today to get my crepe fix, as I walked towards a trailer on wheels that was closed. It being Monday morning, I wrongly assumed that it would be open.  Nope, cerrado.  The chain link fence surrounding the crepe trailer was closed.

I guess next time I'll make sure to read the business hours.  My tip to those who are not  familiar with the location, find out when the crepe trailer is open.

I'd rate the crepes, but I never ate any.
author: Vanessa E.

description:
At 2am when you are the sober driver, you deserve a treat, and this is it. Or if you are the drunk one, you want a treat.

A freakin' hot mess of warm crepe, stuffed with nutella, whip cream, and strawberries.

YUMMMY.  Worth the calories.  And apparently, if you smile cutely you can skip the line.
author: Denise B.

description:
After Lone Star's beer bust, my friends and I were leaving the crappy pizza place on 11th and I immediately made a bee line for this place as soon as someone pointed out that it was open. We were basically the first ones there so I got my food super fast, although sitting and watching subsequent customers' orders leads me to believe that they're just super fast generally. They didn't have strawberries, so I had a kiwi crepe. Actually, they told me to choose more stuff to put in it because I guess the kiwi slices were small or something. So it ended up being a kiwi, pineapple and coconut crepe with whipped creme for the same price. I just wish they had ice cream, it would have been perfect.

I originally gave them 4 stars, but I added one just because last night a man dressed like Flava Flav (clock and all) purchased an egg salad sandwich and then did an egg salad victory dance upon receiving said sandwich.
author: Micaela G.

description:
Oh. My. God. 

This place is a-maz-ing! And who'd ever think that some little cart in a parking lot could be this good? If it was closer or more convenient, I'd come here all the time, not just after a night of... um... libations. 

Even when I haven't been indulging in cocktails, the crepes are always great. They're that perfect combination of crispy and soft and always stuffed with tasty yummyness. 

And the prices? Are you kidding me? If you make it over here, at these prices, get one sweet and one savory and pat your happy belly when you're done! Hell, order a couple and take them home for the next day!
author: Jeff Z.

description:
This place is awesome.
I drool every time I think about sinking my teeth into one of their tasty creations.
Chris ALWAYS gets savory confused with sweet. The word savory is just too misleading for him so I end up sharing my dessert. That's what love is about - not smacking him for making me sacrifice but putting my stomach aside and suffering for his "mis-mastery" of the English language.
author: JaM W.

description:
This place has the absolute best crepes i have ever had in my life. 

Not only are they prepared by, quite possibly one of the most attractive men i have ever seen in my life, but he also speaks french and makes the crepes in front of you. 

all the ingredients are fresh and delicious too. 

i will admit, i had my doubts when my friend James took me to this place. coming from Philadelphia, any experience with the roadside foodstands, and even some of the restaurants will have you re-enacting tubgirl later that night. not this place. DO NOT BE FOOLED BY THE APPEARANCE. it is a trailer in a lot, but it is wonderful. absolutely, 100% wonderful. 

i have no idea what their hours were, all i know is that it was around midnight and there was a pretty good sized crowd clustered around it. the wait wasn't long at all, there were 4 orders in front of us, and we ended up only waiting about 10 mins for him to make and wrap our crepes. 

this place seriously is wonderful. there are a lot of crepe places in the bay area, some of which i will review when i remember their names, but none of them get a 5 star rating like this place. my god.

it is a good thing i don't live near SOMA or i would be like jabba the hutt in mere weeks because i would buy crepes and pretend they are for my friends, but i know i would go home and stuff them in my face like a hamster. it is so cheap too, about half the price of what the other places i have eaten crepes at are charging. 

again, this place rules, i don't think any interview could really do this place justice!
author: scott r.

description:
Can I start by saying, "What a perfect way to end a night of partying." My girlfriends and I stopped by after a night out at Vessel. She had mentioned to me that there was an awesome crepe place that we needed to try. I am a crepe fanatic and was skeptical because nothing has come close to the ones made in Paris for my taste buds especially coming out of a truck. : ) We arrived a little after 2am and the line was long. However, we did not wait too long it went by so fast and the food came out almost instantly. 

My girlfriend and I shared a nutella and strawberry (with whipped cream) and shaved almonds which was totally yummy and the spinach,cheese, egg and ham that was amazing!!! 

I am not from San Francisco and what a treat to have something like this after hours other than pizza or Mexican food. I'm from San Diego and we do not have anything like this. I was bummed to find out that it was only open in the evenings. I was hoping to purchase a few orders to go before I hopped on the plane back to San Diego... Overall it was a wonderful experience!!!
author: Kay C.

description:
Instead of having cake at our wedding, someone suggested we have crepes instead.  What a fabulous idea!  these guys came in and made dessert crepes for us by the pool at the Phoenix, and they were a huge hit.

You know when people get out of the naked pool to eat that you have a success.
author: Steve S.

description:
Crepes a Go Go is my all time favorite place for crepes.  Specifically Nutella and banana.  They have a pretty good selection, considering it's a kitchen in a small trailer.  It's cheaper than most places.  And oozing with Nutella that it spills on your fingers.  The other place I've had good crepes was in Paris, but for double the price.

This is perfect snack after you come out drunk out of the clubs and bars down the street.  Service is fast and friendly.  It's nice if you can grab a seat on their couch.  You can watch them cook it right in front of you.
author: James D.

description: I've heard about this place for a long time and now I know why!  SOOOOOO good.  YUM.  I had the cheese, tomato, and avocado. Delish.
author: Aaron W.

description:
HOUSE SPECIAL. so good!

The guys is cool. He's got jokes and good crepes. 

Do not sit on the couches.
author: Betty A.

description:
Cash only; pick some up so you don't have to waste dollars on ATM fees at the crummy liquor stores next door.

After a night of driving around and picking up free stuff from Craigslist, we craved something quick, cheap, and delicious.  A nice, well-lit, clean truck in the middle of a bunch of bars is the kind of weird juxtaposition I like.  The guy (didn't catch his name) is super friendly and actually speaks French, which I think is always a good sign for a crepes place.  I got the cheese, avocado, tomato savory crepe (with hot sauce, of course) and my boyfriend got strawberries, honey, and kiwi.  Ingredients tasted fresh, crepes were huge, and company pretty nice (yes, there are undoubtedly loud drunk people, but it's kind of part of the charm).

SO GOOD.  I'm not from San Francisco and managed to find this on Yelp when I was driving through the Sunset.  Yay Yelp.
author: Irene C.

description:
Amazing Crepes!  Perfect stop if you're doing Butter, Slim's, DNA and any of the other clubs & bars in the area.
Tasty, Fast, Late Night Food & Friendly "Creper" (probably wrong word choice), what else can you ask for?
I had their turkey, cheese and egg - it was great!  It reminded me of my favorite Taco Truck, but a compete different taste!
author: Yamil A.

description:
House special, eggs, ham cheese, mmmmm!

Cold weather, outside seating no mmmm!
author: Aaron I.

description:
The epitome of after-club, drunk people food.  

Feed the homeless, Feed the drunk all at the same location.

This was a must visit spot in SF, especially for us LA peeps who are more accustomed to Taco Trucks then a Crepe Truck.  I have to admit, this joint goes down better in the morning than shady carne asada tacos....

This spot was the jumpoff to our SF Labor Day Food Fest Weekend.  Definitely set the tone for our food experience.

I got the cheese, spinach and mushroom crepe the 1st night then switched it up on the next night we came here with nutella, strawberries and bananas....

***beware of annoying drunk people in line with you**
consisting of the following:
-loud ass voices shouting at their friends (calm down!)
-drunk people ordering turkey, tomato and banana crepes??WTF?
-drunk girl showing off her bra
-foreign languages being slurred by intoxicated immigrants
-ghetto pimps luring women into their pimp-mobile
-flava flav look alikes
-Guido's with vertical-lined button up shirts hitting on "the hot mess" mentioned above

but all makes for a experience you'll never forget and want to repeat every saturday night!
author: Lucky J.

description:
Nothing more embarrassing than my drunken attempt to hit on the french guy making my crepe.  

Crepe guy: "So you've studied abroad for quite some time"
Me: "oui"
Crepe guy: [speaking Francais to me]
Me: (fuck) "oui, oui"

+4.5 because the King Lias Crepe was amazing (coconut, whipped creme, nutella, banana).  Yes, I am a training diabetic.     Mhmm and the french guy can make me crepes any day of the week.
author: Jacquelynne S.

description: Great place to have a late night bite. I was surprised to see this place is actually a truck; however, the crepe was hot and crispy. Had mushroom and spinach, no cheese. It was fresh and yummy!
author: Maranda S.

description:
Want em Savory or Sweet this place is respek.

How do you make a $4 crepe an $8 dollar crepe?  Let me tell you...you tell the guy in the stand to put everything into a crepe.  When the crispy goodness is placed into your hands you have a crepe as big as your head.  Filled with Turkey, Chicken, Eggs, Cheese and a bunch of stuff I can't remember at this point.  I can tell you this...the entire time I was eating this thing i didn't talk to my friend and I had to use both hands.

If it's a sweet crepe you want it doesn't get better than this place.  The simple sugar & butter crepe is great but if you are a first timer ask for the nutella, strawberry and banana crepe.  You'll love it more than the potential hook up you could have had that night.
author: Mateen A.

description:
My b/f and I might be some of the brave few who have actually eaten at this Crepes A Go Go while sober.

We decided to eat here before we hit the bars, since we love crepes...and neither of us can handle alcohol on an empty stomach.  

We almost missed the place, because we were looking for an actual restaurant!  But we finally realized that it was the sketchy looking little trailer thing with a window to order your food and old random couches outside the trailer to sit on.  Despite the annoying drunk people around us and the confusion about the trailer (How can this place have a real address?), we decided to try the crepes.

And they were great!

I had a crepe with turkey, cheese, avocado, and egg, and it was perfect.  My b/f had a spinach and mushroom crepe and it was good too, but not as good as mine.

The guy who runs this crepe stand is very nice and enjoys joking around with drunk people.  I would come here again drunk or sober.
author: Melanie A.

description: Manhattan has the hot dog stand or the slice of pizza.  L.A. has the taco stand.  Seattle has a good cup o' joe.  And San Francisco has the Crepes a Go Go truck.  This little jewel on wheels is open after hours when you need a little something in the tank.  I've been going here for years, and I think it just dawned on me that there's nothing really like it as a late night treat.  It's right across the street from Slim's.  Lots of excellent tasting choices (both sweet and savory).  I can't get past the Nutella and Banana or the turkey, egg, and cheese.  WOW!  SOOO GOOOOD!  This could be SF's best kept secret.  It's that good.
author: Dan B.

description:
Are you down with D.I.T.C? Digging In Them Crepes LOL

The Life Saver of 11th St.

I do not know how many times friends and I have left surrounding clubs completely drunk off of our asses and have sat on the curb eating these tasty crepes. You are pretty much in heaven between the tasty crepes and the shady couches they have posted out there.

I love this joint. Nothing beats them crepes. It is a must have after your long night. It's almost like pulling in that hot girl from the club, but better, cause at 3am she will never  smell or taste like the "house special" ! lol

So, if you see me on the curb, the shady couches; or just standing up eating the tasty turkey, cheese, egg, and avocado. Be sure you stop by  and say hi!
author: Jay D.

description:
There's nothing like practicing your french on a guy who's pretending to not understand English to make you work even harder for your crepe.  My francais wasn't working so well tonight (granted, it was late)  but I still got my banana/nutella/ whipped cream crepe.  And there was absolutely no tastiness lost in translation.

Love the location so close to Slim's, Butter and several other music venues/bars.  Prices are reasonable, service is fast and slightly flirty, outdoor seating ambiance is 'interesting' to say the least...
author: Becca V.

description: Awesome crepe joint. I went there not sure what to expect, but it was a legit set up. Loved it. Definitely going back
author: Neil G.

description:
Awesome food here. I tried the turkey cranberry crepe. There's various styles here including vegetarian and desert type crepes.

Primarily there're 3 great things about this place.

1. Food quality
2. Operation hours (i was here at 2:30 am hungry after ruby skye)
3. Outside seating - you can stand outside and socialize with your buddies.

Overall I give this place two thumbs up!
author: Jafar Amir Hanovic Ismailov M.

description:
There's nowhere else in the city better than this place after getting intoxicated/wasted/plastered/inebriated/three sheets in the wind/drunk.  I'm not saying this will cure whatever adjective you fit best with the previous statement, but it's so damn tasty after a long night out.  So who knows, this place may taste better due to the circumstances of being out drinking and that it's past 2am, but I can't tell a difference.

The place is one of the more ghetto places around that I didn't realize this place even had a name besides "the crepe place on folsom and 11th" until I reminded myself one time that I should be more observant the next time I went so I can give it a proper Yelp review instead of writing "Tis ish goood."  This restaurant, if you will, is basically a meals on wheels parked in this tiny vacant lot that looks like the entrance to a junkyard.  On the right hand side is a makeshift canopy and an old, dirty ass couch, which I've seen people sit on.  And above that is a small neon sign that says "Crepes A Go Go".

The French guy there isn't the nicest or the most courteous of people, but then again look at his customers, so I don't completely blame him.  Just one time I went, he barked at me saying that he called out my order 10 times, but I didn't want to talk back because I was salivating for 15 minutes.  The thing is he kept calling out an order that was similar to mine, but he kept saying one ingredient that I didn't have in mine and I only heard him call it out 5 times, not 10.

But after all that, I love what they make here.  I've always gotten the salty crepes and it's cooked to perfection.  There's enough variety here that you can come back plenty of times before trying everything.  I think it's customizable too, but I'd rather not deal with the confusion that it is there every night on weekends.  The hot crispiness of the crepe in combination with whatever topping you get with it is superb.  This is one reason why I like going to SOMA for going out just because of this place.  If you ever find yourself in SF late at night, then you owe yourself a favor to try this out.  Just watch out for the drunkards there.
author: David Y.

description: After a late night of drinking and dancing, it's a great place get a fix of sugar or spice. I've been happy with the chocolate and coconut crepe. Prices are irresistible for what you get. These guys are pretty fast and also friendly. Lots of drunks bit nothing worrisome to worry about. There's a couple of teak wooden chairs and a table under canvas to keep you dry. It's a great place to people watch or strike conversations late night. It's a regular dtop for me when I'm coming from around the district. It's asphalt here and they've laid down carpeting but it's still funny to watch the girls walk around in stilletos an stumble a little bit.
author: Minh N.

description:
Alright so Irene S. gave away the ingredients to my special crepe creation so I guess I have to review.  I've been avoiding it since IF I reviewed I would have to admit that I stole this combo (turkey, egg, tomato, 1/2 jack, 1/2 cheddar) from someone else.  OK I'm not brilliant, as so many of my friends have drunkenly told me.  I know, I know...I'm a fake.  So sue me.

They now have a covered area with a couch and more chairs for those wet nights!  And I also have to say that these guys are so incredibly patient with us drunken fools.  You're awesome.  Thank you.
author: Carol C.

description:
Service: 5/5
Food: 4/5
Wait: 4/5
Price: $
Portions: 4/5
Presentation of food: 5/5
Presentation of restaurant: 4/5
Overall: 4/5

i had their Nutella & Fresh Strawberries, it was crackin. but its a messy one, so be sure to ask for a to-go box! & be sure NOT TO EAT IN THE CAR. cuz it gets messy! lol. its good! they're open usually til 3ish AM on weekends! cuz of all the clubs around.
author: Eva H.

description:
I am sad when I go to Slim's & the trailer o' crepes isn't open. 
Does it creep me out? A little bit, yet I was eating from crepe trucks in Japan with no concerns. 
Is it the best crepe I've had? Nope. 
Even so, I LIKE IT!
author: Melisser E.

description: Oh how delicious their crepes be. I usually get the chicken and cheese, but the dessert crepes are just as good.  It's THE late night after-club food to get; sometimes I go out to the club just so I can come here afterwards.  I'd go as far as saying I'll get food here over taking a girl home.  Yes, it's that good.
author: Daniel L.

description: Went to slims across the street for a Dom Kennedy concert. I was standing in line hungry and saw this place and decided to give it a try. By far the best crepes I have ever experienced and they have a large menu for sweet or salty. Delicious!! I have been craving to go back here ever since. Definetly one of the many gems in sf.
author: Nick V.

description:
zOMG, this is the best thing in the worldddddddd, granted I had a few drinks, but it was delicious and a must have!  I don't remember what I had, but there was cheese and chicken and I almost bit my finger.  

Damn I wish I had one now... come to the south bay!
author: David C.

description: good food, cheap, and close to the hang out bars I see friends once in a great while.
author: Joe V.

description:
Crepes a go go! So many nights here after clubbing! I used to go clubbing from San Jose just so I could get a crepe from here afterward. The mushroom crepe is awesome. Flavorful and juicy!

One night we were at Slide and decided to drive across town to get  a crepe. I was so excited. I wait in line with Linda and the crepe guy yells, "Only 8 more crepes left!"

8 more crepes?! I start to freak out. I drove all the way across town for this! I counted off all the people and Linda and I made it in the 8. Whew! 

While patiently waiting this drunk girl cuts in line and starts to place her order. My left hand instantly curled up in a fist like Bruce Lee when he's about to give an ass kicking. I looked to the left and saw the rest of her friends. They were rolling 5 deep and they were some big, ghetto looking people. Me being 5'2" I decided to calm down and forget about it. Not worth losing teeth over a crepe.

Linda and I get up to the front and the guy tells us there is only one crepe left. I let Linda pick the crepe that she wants. At least we will get one crepe. Then another guy in the back of the truck says that they also happen to have a house special crepe. 

"I'LL TAKE IT!!!" 

The house special has 2 eggs, 2 pieces of turkey, and 2 pieces of cheese. Well worth the drive! I happily ate my crepe while all the drunk people complained about the shortage.
author: kimy l.

description: I'm terrible at Crepe places, after drinks and a concert, I go for my usual nutella banana crepe.  Was a bit slow in making my crepe but pretty good for a place that's a hole in the wall and plenty of clubbers walking by :).
author: Omar L.

description:
2am and I got...

Wonderful CREPES, Wonderfully funny dudes, got to practice my french... 

....mmmm nutella and banana!!!  I'm willing to argue that this is better than some of the crepes I got in Paris!
author: Chon Q.

description:
i tried this place for the first time this evening before i went to happy hour--around 6:15 p.m.  first off, they had no chicken available for their savory crepes.  i let that slide since this is A--basically a food truck, B--it was their first day open after the weekend, and C--i was there in the opening hour.

i decide to order the tomato, mushroom  and cheese crepe, and add smoked turkey.  my order was completed within a few minutes.  (though there were no other customers)  i walked away while happily taking bites of crispy crepe with melted cheese inside.

however, once i got into the main part of the crepe, i detected a foul taste--MOLD!  i tried to soldier through, thinking it was just a bad bit that snuck in somehow, but i kept running into the same mold taste.  UGH.  i am still not sure if it was the tomatoes, the cheese, or the mushrooms.  after a few bites of mold, it made the whole crepe unpalatable.
author: c. j.

description:
One of my favorite places to eat after 2 AM. 
Can't get enough of the house special with avocado.
author: John K.

description: No where on the planet will you enjoy the duality of a polite & noble Frenchman serving crepes to the inebriated masses of 11th st than Crepes A Go Go.  I would have my wedding reception here if it fit more people....They've got that fake fuzzy golf grass and a couch that even the homeless would cringe upon.  The crepes are amazing and the people watching is classic...A true SF gem
author: Darren B.

description:
This review is based off of what I remember when I was drunk. This place is great for a drunken late night snack. They offer savory and dessert crepes. It amazes me how this place functions with screaming drunk people, confused order and pick up lines, and a mumble and jumble of people just standing around. The guys who work here seem to keep the place together, somehow. They know exactly who ordered what and make sure you get your order and not somebody else's. 

The one thing that bugged me is that there isn't really much of a seating area. Granted this is just a little food cart in the middle of two buildings, but it'd be nice if there were some benches or something.

What I vaguely remember of the food is that it was delicious. We ordered one original nutella and one savory with cheese, mushrooms, spinach, and tomatoes. Both were really good, and definitely satisfied my drunken munchies. I'll have to come back here when I'm sober and I actually recall the whole experience.
author: Sarah T.

description: SOOO freakin delicious!!!!! The bf and I are obsessed with this spot! We tend to always come here after going out in the city. Being the fatties that we are, we actually plan on coming here on the way home before we've even gone out! The people are friendly, the price is right, the service is quick, and again the crepes are sooo freakin delicious!! :-)
author: Kristen K.

description:
Come here to eat crepe after a night of getting drunk. Not worth the trip if you're not already in the area, because parking will suck at the time. Didn't really have a great experience the first time I went there because there are always hella people there and it takes forever to get your crepe. Apparently people that ordered way after I did was getting theirs first. So what I had to do was take someone else's who ordered the same thing (but with mushrooms also) and ran with it. That means they forgot my order. Not very helpful. 

They do take hella long though, but if you're drunk, you're not going to notice too much. I probably wouldn't eat here if I wasn't drunk though. Crepes are good though but then again I was drunk. Everything's better when drunk.
author: Calvin L.

description:
One of my vivid memories of this place is how the "Speciale Maison" crackled in its wrapper as it was handed to me; the steam from its hot contents wafted into the early morning air. It was cold and we had come over here from a club nearby (EndUp? DNA?). The warm crepe goodness surrounded by a slightly crispy exterior hit the spot. I usually get mine with Feta.

This place is always worth the stop if you are in the area and happen to have the munchies.
author: Aaron N.

description:
I don't think i've ever been her sober.  This is the best place to fill your stomach after a long night of drinking.  Centrally located in the middle of the block full of clubs, this trailer offers the excellent crepes both savory and sweet.

You can't go wrong with the House Special.
author: Brandon L.

description:
oh, so good! I would get a crepe from here everyday if I could, but too bad it's a tad out of the way. We came here on a cold Friday night and had a good time eating our crepes in their funky "outdoor" seating area. It's great because this is our city and I'm thinking to myself that i don't do this as often as I should. Okay back to the crepes:

I ordered the chicken crepe; J ordered the house special crepe and for dessert we shared a chocolate strawberry crepe with whipped cream. 

Everything was fantastic: 

fresh. 

hot. 

delicious.
author: Vitamin C.

description:
I tried a crepe sober this weekend!  I can confirm they are still tasty. Highly recommend the spinach, onion, feta and sun dried tomato. Yum.

One disappointment--they charged more than the menu listed.  Not cool--and I refuse to haggle with someone who can spit in my food.

Yeah, 90% or more of your patrons are drunk.  But don't overcharge them.
author: Scott H.

description:
i can easily say that the late-night munchies played a huge part in how delicious this crepe was...

its quick, delicious, spicy, and oily. we got the beef jalapeno cheese.

jalapenos are perfectly spicy.
meat is oily and delicious
cheese is stringy and plentiful.

AND on the side, they have all the sauces you can use to make your crepe personal. 

hand-held crepes. best. idea. ever.
author: Christine N.

description:
Talk about being at the right place at the right time. Delicious crepes just when you need them. Be sure to precede your crepe with a shot of Fernet to ensure that you properly digest it. My favorite crepe:
Egg, avocado, mushroom, feta.
author: Tal K.

description:
Went here with a few friends before we checked out a band at the DNA. I had the egg and jack cheese. The crepes were very good, hot and delicous. Perfect food on the go. My friends and I kept asking for ham. They don't have ham:-( 
Friendly service. The wait was not so bad. I would definately go back to try the dessert crepes. They looked marvelous.
author: Jennifer S.

description: Whenever I'm up in SF for a late night event, I try to make a point of stopping by for a crepe on the way home. They are always fantastic and overflowing with fillings. I love how late they stay open too; I've been there at 2 AM too many times to count. It's almost literally in a hole in the wall, but if you like crepes, it's the place to go (go).
author: Regina P.

description:
BEST EVER. 
Great place to hit up after the bars whether drunk or sober (beware, the employees might try and mess with you a little...be a good sport).  I am from Seattle and I miss this place so much.  Why doesn't Seattle have a crepe cart open till godawful hours of the morning!?  Don't be fooled by thinking they serve just nutella and banana or strawberries and whip cream on crepes here....you can get turkey, pineapple, odd cheeses....all sorts of stuff on your crepe.  There are couches to sit on (avoid them if you're a neat freak...they don't look like they're cleaned regularly.  Or at all) and tarps/tents to sit under so you don't get wet.  

I can't wait to get down to SF so I can go there again.  Yummmmm.
author: Heather W.

description:
I couldn't believe it when I found this place..  a CREPE TRUCK?! And they only opens from 7pm to 2am or 4am (on Fri & Sat).  They have the best crepes you can find.. really!  

The dessert crepe with nutella and strawberry was crisp and fully stuffed that made it a rather huge portion.  

The savoy crepe with chicken, bell pepper and cheese was REALLY huge and yummy.  I was already full after eating 1/4 through.  But I want to keep eating because it's so good.. so I took a deep breath and munch my down down more.. OM NOM NOM NOM... but no i AM full.  I wanted it save it for later but didnt' think it'll be good anymore when it's not fresh.  So I have to throw it away, with a bit of tear in my eyes..  I hate myself when I waste good food like that.
author: Carina N.

description:
I mean really what else can I say about this place that hasn't  already been covered.  It's a totally rad little truck that crepe magic happens in.  It's perfect for a late night post bar snack.  They have savory and sweet both delicious, they are cheap and we all know you just dropped some coin getting wasted so that is good.  The couches they have for sitting on are totally gnarly but it's SOMA everything's kinda gnarly......

Yum!! Love the crepe truck!!
author: travis f.

description:
Oh. yeah.  

Stopped by this spot with a friend who had to review it for TODO.  Wasn't aware at the time that I'd decide to write a yelp review - but memories of the deliciousness are still very much with me.  

I'm sure we are like the only people of all time to hit this joint 100% sober, and it was amazing - I only hope I can get drunk and come back - I know then it will really rock me.   It's a nighttime thing - I think it opens at 7pm - and they've got a funny setup of dirty mismatched couches under a makeshift tent for you to sit your drunk self on whilst munching your crepe full of goodness.  

Onto the goodness.  The key here, I learned, is to mix the sweet and savory.  Sure, you can get a crepe with scrambled eggs and cheese, which I'm sure is delicious.  You can even get a crepe with roasted red peppers, eggplant, onions, and feta cheese.  Or you can go dessert style and get a bananas and honey crepe, a ricotta and jam crepe, etc.  But where you really strike gold is the salty + the sugary.  I'm talking apples and cheddar cheese, or turkey and cranberry sauce - seriously people, these are the best things ever.  I know you're doubting the turkey and cranberry - don't doubt.  eat it.
author: Natalie S.

description:
Hello little gift from the French god up above! 

Picture this: it's 12:30am, you've been partying/dancing your @$$ off. 

What better way to refuel, than with a french quesadilla!? 

Savory or sweet? They've got 'em both. The stranger nearby recommended the slow cooked chicken in the back, and even offered me the first bite. I went with a cheese/mushroom/spinach crepe and was pleased. Another girl had a nutella/banana and wouldn't take a breath between bites. 

This french "roach coach" has got it going on!
author: Misha F.

description: Omnomnomnomnom. I saw a couple of people ahead of me in the line get both a savoury and sweet crepe at the same time. Inexperienced as I was, I judged them. Now I know better... food orgasm
author: Darren O.

description:
The best for a late-night (after bar) crepe fix!
I LOVE the "crepe cart"!! The french guys who make 'em are always entertaining (to say the least), the food is fast, yummy, hot and always made to order!

They're open late on Friday nights and there is always a (semi-drunk to falling over drunk) crowd in front of the little winnebago parked right next to Butter & across the street from DNA Lounge.

Oh! The food is super cheap too! Get the strawberry & Nutella crepe! It's better than sex for those going home alone ;) 

Pros: Quick, hot & cheap. Open late.
Cons: Only open on Friday nights!
author: Jaimee C.

description:
I'm nostalgic. I can't help it. I have a lot of great memories, and the slightest thing can trigger a flashback to a joyous moment of my life. So when my friends and I ditched Club Mist early and saw the humble crepe stand, my mind teleported me back to hot, summer Paris nights when my girls and I would grab a crepe before running back to the convent just in time for curfew. 

I'd heard of Crepes A Go Go before when I worked at TODO, but I had never been until a couple of weeks ago. If it's a sweet crepe you're craving but don't want to feel like a slob during the late-night, I recommend the apple and cinnamon combo. Am I a fan? Oh yeah.
author: Iris V.

description:
I waited in what seemed like a long line at 3 in the morning... the line moved fast because the people inside the little car were working their asses off. They were cranking out the best crepes SO fast. After a night of drinking, the cheese, turkey and cranberry crepe not only tasted great, but also helped me not be as hung over the next day.

The people working their were funny and thoughtful. They made a mistake with my friends order, and gave then bottles of water to make up for it. GREAT find!
author: Bethany C.

description:
Is there anything better than 5 stars? This place would get it from me. I went here on a cold, rainy Saturday night  at 10 pm. I was craving chocolate and this was the only place I could think of that had it.  We both got the nutella/banana crepe. 
I felt like I had died and gone to chocolate heaven, I heard angels singing and the sun was shining... you get the picture ;)
Its open late too.... have friends who have been here at 3 am.
author: Pooja S.

description: Amazing Crepes. I REALLY love this place. I wasnt a crepe fan before coming here and now i dream of them. The staff is nice and the crepes are ALWAYS good! I live in Oakland but I drive to the city quite regularly just for this crepe!
author: Hilary B.

description: Literally a hole in the wall that offers the best crepe that I've ever tasted so far!
author: Adi K.

description:
Every city has it's afterhour delights - New York has slices on nearly every corner, Chicago has dogs, San Diego has California Burrito's from any number of 'ertos establishments, Boston... I really didn't discover what Boston does besides Dunkin' Donuts (sorry, I'm a Dunkie Junkie), but San Francisco has Crepes A Go Go ...

Everytime I go out now, I wish there were a crepe around the corner to fulfill my savory and/or sweet needs. It didn't matter what you did throughout the evening, the fact is you're now standing on 11th Street looking up your best friends asking for an assortment of wonderful toppings be thrown atop of a thinly spread pancake, wrapped up and gently handed to you as you make the most delighted sounds and wonder why you hadn't gotten there sooner...

Not only are the crepes D-Lish when you're drunk, they're just as great when you're sober. I've nearly tried them all, but I've chosen to with turkey, avo, cheese and tomato as my regular option - never ever ever have I had a bad one ...

If it's your first time to Crepes A Go Go the location may throw you off a bit if not make you turn around and walk away, but believe me, it doesn't get much friendlier anywhere else in the city at 2am ... The guys who operate the joint are always uber-friendly, even after catering to the drunkest dumbass of the lot, and it always surprised me when they'd remember me and mention that I hadn't been around in a while, as well as remind me who I showed up with last time ... They're excellent fellas, and if the crepes alone weren't enough to come back for, these guys sure make it even better ...
author: Ryan V.

description:
2:30am--the late night munchies hit. 

Classic legit crepes in a trailer. No wonder the line was super long so late at night, but service is super friendly & efficient to all the rowdy drunk folks from the nearby clubs. 

I left FULL and very satisfied
author: Alexa M.

description: Ah Crepe A Go Go, how I love thee.  It's 2 am, we've just stumbled out of the DNA and are starving.  You are waiting with scrumptious fresh crepes to help sober us up! My favorite is the spinach, mushroom and cheese - which is chock full of freshly prepared ingredients. I also love the nutella and strawberry, which features tons of fresh berries. For about the price of a burrito, their crepes are a much more elegant edible. Generally the orders come out fairly quickly.  Although one night, we snuck over mid-event around midnight and ended up waiting over twenty minutes.  However, I'm willing to chalk that experience up to a fluke since I've never waited that long before.  There's very limited seating, but generally friendly people in line to gab with.
author: Valerie S.

description:
Mmm  crepes.... aarrrrggghhhh  :: drool::  

That's the scene pretty much everytime I'm in the area after a night of heavy drinking.  And when it comes to late night drunken snack foods, nothing beats a crepe from crepes a go go.  Whether you go sweet or savory, the crepe shell is always perfectly crispy on the outside and just chewy enough on the inside.  You can't really go wrong with any of the choices but I'm a fan of the spinach, cheese and turkey and the strawberry and nutella.  Soooo good.  It makes me want one right now.
author: Gary L.

description:
being able to get a CHEAP hot, cheesy and steamy...or sweet, chocolatey and fruity crepe instantly from a random truck hidden in an indent between a few bars is just awesomeeee.

order any of them...sweet or savory...and it will probably hit the spot (especially for the drunktards).

their generosity with the cheese is excellent

the only thing missing - is ice cream to go with it.
author: Jessica C.

description:
crepes a go go makes me go a ga ga!
i'm sure they've never heard that one before. 

anyway. i HEART crepes, and minus the location and lack of parking, crepes a go go is definitely one place you want to hit up if you too HEART crepes.

it was a couple of months ago so i can't remember exactly what we ordered, but i know i had the king lear? lere? leer? and it was super sweet. but ravishingly good.

the crepe chef and cashier are both extremely nice, and if i remember correctly have really hot accents!
author: Christina L.

description:
Normally ok, and a decent option for 2AM drunkenness, but the spinach, feta, and mushroom crepe just didn't do anything for me last night. I think I like their more simple, sweet crepes that i have had there in the past. But maybe I am just grumpy because I had to walk all of the way over there at midnight from the Mission after having crepes for dinner. 

There are other food options in the Castro/Hayes Valley/Mission/SOMA area, but people gots to have their crepes, even outside in the cold, sitting under a tarp on some carseats pulled out of old vans.
author: Lauren H.

description:
I was in yet another finicky mood when we hobbled out of Slims and made our way to Butter. I needed to eat but couldn't settle for Spaghettios or anything...
