I wasn't sure WHAT I wanted until I heard my brain yell, "CREPES!" So I found myself standing at the little truck, wondering what in the world I would be hungry for. 
Then, it came to me, as if I was fulfilling some sort of destiny (or following a cue-card). "Umm.. I think I'll have turkey, and cheese, and pineapple... oh and spinach too." 
Ahhh.... sweet and savory satisfaction.
author: Loli L.

description: This place has been around forever and they are consistently good. In my younger days, I use to eat here every weekend after hitting the clubs. House special all the way!
author: James W.

description: I could eat this everyday. Really. The fact that I danced my bootie off at an after hours spot listing to Franky Boissy spin some amazing house may have worked up my biased appetite. Nonetheless, the guys were friendly, the crepes were savory, and the prices were a favorite. Such a great little yummy spot tucked away.  And this charm is why I love this city.
author: Jennifer B.

description:
First of all, that photo of Crepes A Go Go is obviously wrong. It ain't a store, it's a trailer! A happy one! Lol, get it, happy trails. JK. It's a magical trailer that will transport you from a world of "I think I'm gonna puke from that *insert overpriced, horribly mixed drink from club*," to "Mmmmmm crepes...I love you, crepes."
Needless to say, these guys are geniuses. I have tried the nutella/banana combo and it is perfect. I love how they make them in a wrapper so you can just pack your face while walking to your car. I am curious about trying the savory ones, i.e. the House Special. I've no doubt it is as orgasmic. The guys are quick to serve, the menu has a good variety and the price is awesome. I wish they were open 24/7 or had more locations around the City. A+
author: Michelle G.

description:
Living in the Mission this is one place you must visit.  Great mid-morning place to take a bite in!!!

Not my favorite ALL TIME place but a good place to visit mostly if you never have had crepes.
author: Bruce_ B.

description:
I only come here at 2am after a good night of dancing and bar hopping...but nothing beats a crepe from Crepes A Go Go as a late night meal!

My roommates and I crave for this stuff...  definitely hits the spot and sends me home satisfied...and helps the hangover too!
author: Jennie L.

description:
Since when is a crepe truck part of a bachelorette party itinerary??!!  It is now!
We went to Crepes a Go Go one night at about 2 am after hitting up the bars and clubs in the area.  Perfect for filling up our grumbling tummies, soaking up all that alcohol and for taking some time to sober up!  Who knew that something so yummy could come out of a truck at 2 am??!!
And the fun didn't end there.  We met some random people while we all waited for our orders and even took pictures with lots of them.  Funny what crepes (and alcohol) could do to a person...
author: Joanne S.

description:
A sheep walks into a bar. The bartender says, "We don't serve your kind in here." The sheep says, "Well shit on you then. I'm going to Crepes A Go Go. They have the best crepes in the world, so save it!"

Try the House Special.

Kudos to everyone that works there for having to put up with the drunken denizen of 11th St. You guys, along with the Tamale Lady, are the Patron Saints of Alcoholics in San Francisco.
author: Big W.

description:
That photo is a crapshoot -- this Crepes A Go Go is a TRAILER!

And inside said metal bullet, is the pinnacle of all drunk food. It's fittingly right next to Butter, and it's amazing anytime. 

You can build your own or buy a delectable little creation, but me? I keep it simple. Nutella crepe, baby... fastest way to prevent a hangover.

So stay away from the icky hot dog vendors on Folsom, and swing by here instead. I have no idea when they close because honestly, I've never seen it closed after dark. Besides, they have couches. And Oriental carpets. Like a damp, squishy home!

Oh, but be warned: don't hover too long, because Holy Cow is close by and members of the striped shirt brigade make their way over on occasion. Creepers.
author: Megan B.

description:
my very well-travelled friend have given me the chance to experience a whole different late night grub besides the diners around sf. let me tell ya, SHIZZZZZZZZbombs! :D :D :D

people that thrive on late nights MUST MUST come to this cart of greatness.....first, a sexy mcdreamy french guy makes your crepe. 2nd, cheap and reasonable selections between sweet and savory crepes. 3rd, did i say sexy mcdreamy AND mcsteamy french guy? :D lol
author: Marc K.

description: What better way to "hit that spot" upon leaving Slim's? A nutella and banana crepe!
author: Maximillian M.

description: I truly believe that every downtown has a hidden gem of a restaurant or eatery. This is one of those places. I was introduced to this place by my buddy Harold on Saturday night and I was not let down. Apparently they are open until about 4 in the morning. Great place for the drunkies to congregate after a long night out. We ordered the "the house special" w/ avocado. It was amazing. I cannot wait to go back to this spot. Thanks Harold!
author: Valerie G.

description: I loved their nutella and banana crepe.  Simply delicious and sweet.
author: Navdeep B.

description:
These people are doing the clubbing community an incredible service. I love them. Last night after a little too much Whiskey at the DNA I stood in line with an amazing multi-cultural crowd, waiting eagerly for one of the City's best crepes.
Do they taste so good because there's nothing quite so wonderful as hot melted cheese at 3AM? Or are their crepes really that good? I think it's that they really are exceptional...and it doesn't hurt that the crepe makers have not only French accents, but a smile in their voice as well.
author: Autumn A.

description: For a late night bite after being out of the bars, this place was perfect. I had the meat and cheese crepe and my friend had the avacado, cheese and tomato one.  They're reasonably priced, workers are friendly and the food truck is easy to find.
author: Bill L.

description: Who doesn't love a good crepe? They were out of mushrooms that evening, so we had the spinach, feta and onion crepe. and a banana/nutella. Delish. This location gets five stars because the people who work there are awesome. I left my messenger bag in the shop and didn't realize that I left without it until I got back to BART. I called the number on the receipt and they let me know they had it. You rock crepes a gogo!
author: C D.

description: I understand that when 3 a.m rolls around, McDonalds would taste pretty damn good.  BUT!!! let me tell you about this place.  SOMA's best kept secret.  When you tell your friends that there is a truck in SOMA that sells crepes and is open until 4 a.m they will laugh.  One of them would say "I bet you it dosen't exist and if it exists it would probably taste terrible."  That is when you take that bet because when they come here, they will leave saying... BEST CREPES EVER!!! and here is the money I owe you.  =)
author: Peter W.

description:
just went there yesterday after all the hype from yelp reviewers.  I got there around 11pm and there were few people waiting in line already. I ordered the house special and a choco w/ banana and coconut.  My bf had the house special and i got the other one....It was nice and warm and I loved it...however towards the end it was only the choco, so a little bit sweet.  I also tried the house special and it was pretty good.  So overall crepes a go go does live up to its hype!!!!!  

price: $10 for two

Hours open:  tues, fri and sat nites.......

i will go back once in awhile to try other flavors.......
author: C L.

description:
It's cheap, it's easy, it's ghetto-fabulous.  These are not gourmet crepes, in fact the place looks a little deteriorating on the inside.

HOWEVER, I hold this place near and dear to my heart.  I absolutely love the nutella-strawberry crepe or the nutella-banana crepe.  It's too bad they're not open more often and it's not closer to my apartment.
author: Kyle T.

description:
A great place to get a tasty, late night snack. An even better place to people watch and observe all the drunks in the area. This place is a crack up. From the beat-up couches under the tarped tents to the white trailer that pumps out yummy crepes and high-energy beats from its speakers up on the awning. This spot is happening. And a great alternative to other late night snacks in the area like pizza or fast food.

As I stood near the tarped tents, eating my crepe oozing with strawberries and whipped cream, I watched a drunk girl stumble up to the trailer and ask the crepe guy if she could use his restroom. Um sorry folks, this Crepes A Go Go has no restroom.

Then there was the old skool school bus that dumped about 20 drunks off and into Butter, a nearby bar. Some of them stumbling upon the trailer and baulking at the price of $4.00 for a crepe. Welcome to the city folks. It's about the same price as what you would pay for a slice across the street. But I would take a crepe from the little, white trailer any day.
author: Kathleen N.

description:
My girlfriend and I have become obsessed.  We're not big on the bar scene, but we live in the neighborhood, and have already stopped by twice in the last two weeks when the craving hit.  On our first visit I tried one of the vegetarian options (I can't remember exactly what was in it, but it had artichoke hearts), and the second time I had the nutella and banana.  Both were fantastic -- my visit count would already be up to three, but a few nights ago we were too early and had to settle for indian food instead (what tough lives we live!)

Sure, it's out of a shady-looking truck, and I'd never sit on those couches sober, but the food's great.
author: Jason M.

description:
This place is a great late night joint after a night out SF...

There are sweet and salty crepes which will ease anyone's appetitie early in the morning..

I had the banana, almond and honey crepe which was great while the House Special is also quite good..Definitelhy recommend to someone looking for a whole in the wall late at night in SF...
author: Bobby H.

description: Mmmm went here again, but this time opted for a vegetarian crepe.  Got the Roasted eggplant with feta cheese, basil, and sundried tomatoes...OMG SOOOO GOOOD!!!! my new favorite :)
author: Karen P.

description: Went there one night with some friends who were raving about it. I wasn't even hungry until I watched a few creeps being made. I had the cheese / turkey / Canberra crepe followed by the lemon crepe. Both were cooked perfectly and delicious. The employees were friendly and I believe the take out container was compostable. I'm sold. It's (almost) a good thing I don't live closer.
author: Danie D.

description: Its good. Pay attention because they call your number. Savory over sweet!
author: Dominic A.

description: I always come here for bite to eat after a night of clubbing and drinking. Yes these crepes are delicious sober or drunk and they're opened late at night.
author: Luna C.

description:
Got the late night munchies?  Looking for a new addiction?  This is the place for you!

I can complain about the long lines, and the drunken masses that always congregate here...  but these crepes are too damn good!

Why, oh why can't you guys be open 24/7???
author: Donald F.

description: Just for kicks, we tried their banana and Nutella crepe. It definitely hit the spot, especially since I only went here on a whim. Its strategically placed, so after the bar crawl, or between venues you got somewhere to hang out with outdoor seating and an awning.
author: Dennis S.

description:
Great Crepes that are inexpensive and filling.  They have both Savory and Sweet and we go there about once a week.   Popular with the bar crowd....
House special with Jack and avocado....the best!
author: Bill H.

description:
perfect food at the perfect time ~ I don't remember much about my night out except the cheesy salty yumminess ~ 

If you are lookin for drunk eats after a night out in the DNA lounge - it's just around the corner, I vaguely remember there being some outdoor couches but it's all so hazy (smile)
author: Shipra K.

description:
I love this place or should I say truck. Yes there's always so many people but it's well worth the wait.  After all, what do you expect, it's right next to a bunch of nightclubs and bars. Anyway, my favorite is the spinach, mushroom and cheese crepe although I do like the house special as well.  They have such a variety I just don't know what to order.  My goal is try a new one every time I go.

Just as most people have said, the crepes are definitely cheap.  They're pretty thick too.  MMmmMMmm... I want one right now! 

I've never been to the actual restaurant. I wonder if the prices are still the same?
author: Cherilyn A.

description:
oh crepes a go go... how i do love our late night rendezvous after drunken evenings at slim's or paradise lounge. the last time we met, i had stumbled over from the 4th of july leisure party with some friends to sober up before driving home. we ordered delicious sweet and savory crepes with billowing, seductive aromas that could be smelled a block away. and you teased us all by giving us a hard time getting a hold of our coveted crepes--so silly you are!

okay, i can't keep this silly banter up any further. what i can do is vouch for the deliciousness of these crepes after a nice night out. the crepes might be pre-made but the mix of fillings are so good. my favorites are the turkey/cheese/spinach/sun-dried tomatoes... forgot what the name was but it's excellent!
author: Andrey C.

description: A friend and I stumbled upon this cart on the way from a party to a bar. She was hungry so we got a crepe with turkey, egg and cheese. It was sooo good. I don't know what makes it so good - maybe some sort of extra/special spice in the meat? - but those three simple ingredients should not be underestimated. Unfortunately closed on Sundays, but the perfect late night/drunk food.
author: Lilian W.

description: I was at a convention all weekend in the Cow Palace and they have terrible food there and I have yet to find yummy late night food near there. We get out of the convention late every night and I thought my sug might like something quick on the way back to the hotel. I came across this place online and I am glad I did. We even swung by on our way out of town. This morning I was greeted with the request to go back again, preferably soon.
author: Cy W.

description:
Just thinking about this place gets me hungry! I've lost track of how many late nights have ended here. The crepes are amazing and very filling. I usually either get the nutella/banana/strawberry crepe if I'm craving sweet and muchroom/spinach/cheese if I'm in the mood for something savory. I've tried a bunch of the savory ones and haven't found one I didn't like.

The location isn't one of my favorite areas , but the crepes definitely make it worth it.
author: A S.

description:
I go to San Francisco about every three months or so and I will drop by Crepes A Go Go whenever I get done with a night outing at a bar or a club.

I'm not much a person to overeat, but I can't help myself whenever I go to this place. I always order a house special (Turkey, Eggs, Cheese) and I usually end up ordering another dessert crepe or an additional house special. The crepes just melt in your mouth and the taste is uncontested. The guys who serve you have a thick french accent and are extremely friendly.

I find this place to be a hot spot for many people who frequent the Bay Area. They serve their food from a little trailer with windows and there's a covered area with a few chairs and tables in case it rains or whatnot. This is the one place I have recommended to every single person who goes to the Bay Area and so far there has been a 100% satisfaction ratio. I can pretty much guarantee that you'll love this place. 

Everyone should experience the wonderful food this place serves. Whether you're sober or piss drunk, their crepes will definitely hit the spot.
author: Prince B.

description: We just discovered this tiney place buried away on 11th St. after leaving DNA across the street on Sunday night.  The turkey/mushroom/avocado crepes we had were so darn delightful, and I couldn't stop shaking my head in disbelief that they were only 6 bucks.  However, we tried to go back after the gym on Tuesday afternoon, though, contrary to the hours listed on their site, they were closed.  Determined, we hauled ass to their other location on Polk St., only to find that one closed as well.  I guess it is just a late night place, oh what, oh what a shame!
author: Nick S.

description:
Unbelievably fantabulous! The nuetella, bananas and strawberries crepe is beyond a little piece of heaven. After you get your groove on at the club or have the late-night munchies (from whatever it is you indulge in) then you need to go here. 

If you just ignore the people hanging out around the area, its a perfect location. Go there. You won't be disappointed. Each crepe is orgasmic.
author: Angela S.

description: I never knew this place existed and now I wonder if I had been blind for so long. Anyway, it is a cart right next to Butter and is run by nice frenchies!  They have two menus, savory and sweet and you get your crepe right there made-to-order. I had a tomato, cheese and mushroom crepe and at first he said they were out of mushrooms and i was like "uh uh" and then he said he was joking! Anyway, it took about 5 minutes to make it and the crepe was so delicious. It was the perfect level of chewiness, crunchiness and the flavor was slightly sweet but not overpowering. I wanna go back and try their sweet crepes which smelled delicious!
author: Natalie S.

description: Hands down the best crepe Ive ever had.  In the midst of a late night munchy craving, I decided to go off the reviews and see what this place was all about.  Having been to several crepe specialty style restaurants all over LA and OC, this place takes the trophy.  Ordered the King Lias and it was extraordinary.
author: Brandon T.

description: Holy motherf***ing God do these people know how to generate business... It's located between Slim's and the DNA Lounge (two of my three favorite venues in SF), and as far as I can see it's open 24 hours. This means that when all us gawth / punk kids stumble out of our respective shows, exhausted, hungry, and dehydrated, the first thing we lay eyes on is a brightly lit crepe truck. Even if their food wasn't good (which it IS), this place is a godsend. I've yet to try a crepe here that I didn't like, although to be honest the butter and sugar one was my favorite. Maybe that's just because I really need sugar and fat after a concert...
author: Kathleen P.

description: The title of Nicest Dude in the World officially goes to the owner of this establishment.  He's a veritable hero, feeding the drunks of 11th and Folsom, but on top of that, he gave my gal friend her crepe for free last night since she didn't have any cash on her.  She orders a crepe, asks if they take credit cards, and he says, "No, but don't worry about it.  Just pay me back next time."  He then surrendered a cheesy spinach crepe to her, and I knocked her out and stole it.  It was delicious.
author: Lauren S.

description:
When I'm happily tipsy, the 5 1/2" heels are killing the feet, my carefully applied make-up is ruined and the girls are just glad they manage to ward off the sleazeballs in the club (who haven't checked the mirror to see how repulsive-looking they are in the last 10 years of their lives), the idea of freshly made crepes would certainly be something that I would entertain.  

And I've also since found out that the sense of judgment and objectivity required foir yelping is inversely proportional to the level of alcohol in one's system.

Which makes me wonder if this is why the place averages 4.5 stars over 109 reviews.  

I cannot honestly say if the crepes would taste as good when it's 11AM, I'm completely sober, and Crepes A Go Go is competing against ten alternative brunch ideas.  

Nonetheless, for the reasons that they are (1) always available when I most need them, (2) cheap, (3) wonderfully tasty, I would give my clouded judgment the benefit of the doubt and conclude on a 5 star for these guys.  

In addition, the fact that we buy those things straight out of a trailer is a nice change from the pretentious and uppity club atmosphere that I and posse subject ourselves to in the last few hours prior to our visit to Crepes A Go Go. 

And oh... I shall not forget to mention the entertainment value of watching drunk people trying to (a) practice their French while ordering the crepes, or (b) talking to strangers who are also waiting in line about the most random subjects , or (c) both.
author: Ange L.

description:
it's late, you've had a lot to drink, and the last thing you want is to wander into yet another denny's or sit in a drive-thru for jack-in-the-box or carls jr.  the solution?  this place - hands down.  after a night downtown, i ended up joining the line outdoors, standing shoulder to shoulder with my drunken brethren, our goal one in the same - to satisfy our taste buds with the deliciousness being doled out from the truck ahead of us.  with our beer goggles on and our stomachs grumbling, that truck was camelot.  it was the emerald city. 

i'm a sucker for anything w/cheese.  melted cheese, with spinach and turkey in a warm crepe?  i'm gone.  nutella and banana?  heaven.  there's something that happens when you eat something amazing - you know what i'm talking about.  it starts as a tingling excitement and escalates into something near orgasmic.  after the final bite, i was spent and ready to call it a night.  i bid my fellow crepe lovers adieu (a couple of them, sexy brasileros) and wondered why it had taken me so long to try this place out.

do yourself a favor and stop by crepes a go go the next time you're searching for something to eat.  trust me, i know what i'm talking about.

tip: get there early to avoid a large crowd.
author: Patrick A.

description: These are the best crepes I've ever had!!! My faves are the avacado, cheese & tomatoe crepe and the nutella crepe
author: C. W.

description: I must hand it to food that comes on wheels - I wasn't expecting much from the cheese crepe I got, but damn that was good!  If you're not into spicy food, you might want to ask them if they put anything in there, but there was definitely some heat going on.  I'm rather cheap which is why I didn't go for the ones with more fillings, but I was very happy with mine.  Yeah, sure, I was plastered, but something tells me this would be pretty good even while sober.
author: Sus... B.

description:
i've been coming here since '02 and they are hands down the best crepes in the city. the batter is perfectly salted and they add just the right amount of cheese. last week, i almost got a $240 parking ticket while waiting for a heavenly avocado, tomato and mushroom crepe.  

the crepes here are so crispy... that my friend cut his lip taking a bite of one. no joke. not only was the poor guy's lip bleeding, but he'll forever be known as "delicate flower."
author: Vivian A.

description: Amazing crepes at a reasonable price...definitely recommend it! And also a great place to grab a late dinner.
author: Sandeep A.

description: Yum! This truck serves very tasty crepes. My friend got me an egg, turkey, cheese crepe. That crepe was bomb! I craved it two days later and went back to get another plus a nutella and strawberry crepe, equally as good. I plan on heading back.
author: Cindy V.

description: all these time coming to holy cow on thrusday night i never knew there was a crepe place right next door... i was like what?! plus it open late too... went over here one friday night with jolean and selena... wow there was a lot of people just for a crepe... but its pretty amazing and damn good, excellent when your drunk :P
author: JessePanda C.

description: There is nothing quite like a nutella and banana crepe at 1am in the morning, or for that matter any sort of crepe - sweet, savory - I don't discriminate. One of my favorite combinations is the basic - onions, cheese, maybe some mushrooms. Being next to Butter should be a case study in location, location, location!
author: Nish N.

description:
I'm not sure this place ever closes, the service is fast, and prices top out around $7.

Everyone who works here is French, and they know what they're doing. The crepe is exactly the right thickness, and they've got about every filling you could dream of. They'll make things that aren't on the menu if you know what you want: One of my party ended up with a fried egg & bacon crepe.
author: Joe B.

description: Prepare for a long wait.  This is the spot where everyone makes their way after a good night of drinking.  Some go to afterparties, some go to Denny's, and apparently a TON of people go to the Crepes A Go Go truck.  Maybe going after 2am was probably not the best idea since that is when the post-club peak is, but the crepe was pretty good.
author: Bert N.

description: We went here a little after 2am and the line wasn't long and the food came fast :) We are visiting friends in the area and I'm glad they didn't let me down with this place. The owner jokes around with the ladies but it's all in good fun ;) I had the nutella and strawberry (with whipped cream) which was *amazing* and my friends got the house special which they described as "awesome" (I tried it and it was good) and the spinach, avocado, tomato and cheese which is also good :)
author: Jessica S.

description:
it's actually a truck!  don't walk by looking for an actual restaurant because you won't find it here.

this place is actually a little truck making delish crepes!  the best thing is, they are made fresh and handed right to you.  no time for the crepe to get soggy - it's crispy and warm!!! mmm!

get the strawberry, banana, and nutella crepe with whipped cream - i promise it will not disappoint!
author: Kimberly F.

description: It was midnite after hitting up the bacon dog cart so I vowed to try the crepes at this place. We shared the turkey and pineapple crepe. The crepes were crispy on the ends and really fresh. The turkey were a tad too salty but it was tasty with the pineapple. Overall a great crepe at midnite! :)
author: Yan M.

description: I'd eat a crepe any day after a night of partying over Denny's, bacon hot dogs, Lucky Chances...the list goes on!  I've tried both Savory and Sweet and you just can't go wrong with anything you order from here.  The owner of this business is a genius and needs to open up more crepe trailers. yuuuuum-o!  hands down delish
author: Mary-Anne C.

description: House Special with Tomatoes & Avocado.   Best Crepes i've had ever in my life.
author: Jessica P.

description: I always crave a good crepe, but to be honest with you its hard to find a place that delivers better then this place bc no one can ever really satisfy my craving. CREPES A GO GO always does. They are the bomb. Best late night snack, or early morning snack. NEVER CAN GO WRONG.
author: Haley R.

description: Best crepes I've had out here, aside from homemade, of course. It's a bit of a dodgy location, though.
author: Hasan D.

description: One night after NOT getting into crowded ass Levende, we ended up at Holy Cow instead... We typically end Thursday nights with a Bacon-wrapped hotdog but instead we turned the corner and found this little crepe trailer!!! Wow, I never thought of having a "healthier" option for a drunken night's snack... NOT BAD AT ALL! I ordered the Turkey Crepe and Beverly ordered something with egg and cheese... We were both delighted at our orders and felt less guilty about eating at 2:30 in the morning =)
author: Chrysantha C.

description: i give it 5 stars for service and tastefullness if thats a word. Nutelle and banana is my favorite for the sweets.  The chicken for savory.  I only tried those two but i'm pretty sure they'll are good.  Kinda hidden and in an odd place but i loved it.  I will for sure visit again for my next trip to san fran.
author: Nikki T.

description: love this place! looking for late nite crepes? this is the place to be. or if you happen to be partying of drinking in the city stop by here after. they are open late. they have fruity/desert crepes and food crepes.
author: Victoria A.

description: This place rocks! As you stagger out of the bars and clubs around 11th Street, the crepe truck is like a beacon that calls to your growling stomach. Of course, after a bender your standards may have lowered a little, but I found on a recent visit when I was perfectly sober that indeed the crepes ARE really that good. Try a crepe with chicken -- the meat is tender and delicious and they pile it on. Five stars for serving something so tasty out of a food truck.
author: Joel A.

description: Oh this place rocks.  The crepe hits the spot after hours of dancing in DNA lounge.  These guys are so charming, or I'm just tipsy and hungry.  Miss this place already.
author: Vivian H.

description: This place is BOMB!  Esp. after a nite of heavy drinkin wit the fellas...Ferd, Chris, & Mike D hipped me 2 this joint...MAN!  Can I say delish?  No doubt...I had the eggs, mushroom & cheese crepe & it was about 3am-ish & it hit the spot...The lil couch & chairs 2 the side 2 lounge & eat UR crepe was a plus...I will def B back...No doubt...
author: Diem L.

description: Awesone place for a late night snack! Very good desert crepes!
author: A K.

description: Would it be a total fat girl move to make a trip here in the middle of the day when my calorie-intake-inhibitions are NOT lowered by drinking???  I've been fantasizing about that ever since I had a strawberry banana nutella crepe last week.
author: Tokki M.

description:
best crepes....best hours.....love the savory crepes especially the turkey avocado spinach and cheese one...I wish L.A. had a late night crepe truck available for those late night cravings.  

*don't forget to save room for the nutella crepe....YUMMY!!!
author: Aidyl P.

description:
it was about three years ago when i stumbled out of a bar on or near 11th and folsom and found myself at crepes a go go. i couldn't tell you exactly where i came from, because well, i was hammered. :D i had what are called the "drunken munchies" and needed yummy eats fast! i gazed upon the menu and decided upon the house special. WOWIE WOWIE i was blown away!! it was like heaven in my mouth!

since then, i have gone to crepes a go go more times than i could even count. my little sister had heard me talk of these crepes so many times that i even had to bring her one night to get one! keep in mind that my sister was 15 at the time and is clearly too young to enjoy the bars, followed by "drunken munchies"!

so for about $6, you can enjoy the most tasty late night delight! i've dabbled in the sweet ones; but i always come back to the house special with avocado! then i sit my happy ass on one of the couches under the canopy and enjoy my de-lish purchase!

to that i say to all of you.... a toot a l'heure!
author: Kristin Y.

description:
Oh em gee!  Soooooo good.  I get the chicken with a fried egg, cheese and mushrooms!  I'm usually mc hammered when I eat it, but one time I tried it sober and it was still good, so that must mean its really is good!!

Thank  you Blackapino for taking me here!
author: K T.

description: freshly made crepes in the early morning hours is hard to go wrong.  nutella strawberry.  little salt in the batter.  not gourmet by any means, but nonetheless satisfying.
author: Rob C.

description:
You late night freaks! This is great to satisfy your cravings. It's cheap and kinda fast and healthier than pizza.
Heck what else do you want out of a chip wagon?
(No Marg, they don't serve chips)
author: Faisal M.

description: Damn, these crepes are great.  I crave the chicken with cheese.  I'll stop by for one even if I'm not partying in the area.... they're great when sober too.  Best savory crepe in the city.  Blows Fritz and Crepevine out of the water (but for sweet crepes, genki on clement is the best).  I was bummed that they didn't have any chicken early in the evening last week, but they serve out of a food truck, so I'll give em some slack.
author: Joe S.

description: This is THE BEST PLACE to go after drinking at the local bars. Order the special, followed by the butter and sugar crepe. By God, if this doesn't prevent a hangover, nothing will. Get there early after you hit the bars & clubs though- the line gets long, BUT the service is pretty fast. They are always consistently GOOD, never had a bad experience there. A MUST STOP when in that area.
author: Xavier L.

description: this place is STUPID GOOD!  i was looking for a late night eatery and i am glad i found this one.  tried the house special, was terrific except they had no ketchup(had egg in it).  then tried the nuttela and strawberry one, OMFG!  the best crepe i ever had period!  i will be going back often to get the nutella and strawberry one often.  the best!
author: Stephen H.

description: Before Green Day's secret show on Thursday night, we stop by for a quick bite. This is our first time here even though I always remember the long line I see after the show venues let out. They have a long (and vegetarian-friendly) dinner menu.  I tried their Egg, Cheese and Spinach crepe which was to die for! But apparently, the Supreme Chicken (*think* that's the name) crepe is better than mine and is "out of this world good! (from Pat who doesn't even like crepes)". We completely forgot to stop by for a dessert crepe after the show! Next time.
author: Tiffany L.

description:
Best tasting crepes for when you're inebriated! But only average when you're sober.

However, the drinking is not so good for my wallet. I think I tipped them 4 bucks for a 6 dollar crepe.

Nevertheless, the lady that works there is super nice and accommodating.

Too bad they don't open until 7 PM. Sometimes I crave their crepes around dinner time!
author: Jon H.

description: Yummy crepes! Last time I went there I ordered one with nutella, bananas and whipped cream and it was HUGE! I'm thinking about going back there tonight. *drool*
author: Isabel G.

description: last time there, I opted for the egg, cheese, and spinach, and I think it's safe to say, i think i've found "the one"! *le sigh*
author: Caddy M.

description: I'm on a crepe review writing rampage right now... Everyone who goes here is usually drunk or high. What a business!  The patience these young men have serving the absolute maniacs on 11th st late night should garner them some kind of tolerance prize.  I've seen them yelling at people telling them never to come back and then see the person lingering around hoping to get back into the good graces of the crepemeisters. Shame on you troublemakers! Respect the crepe benefactors bringing you delicious gourmet treats for a reasonable fee at such a late hour.  They are crepe giving saints of the night.
author: Phil M.

description:
update - went to the 24hour (ish) stand in SOMA after a night out.  in case you need to wash down deep fried Butter goodness with nutella ... this is your place.  mmmm hell yes.  what was i supposed to do - choose *between* tater tots and crepes? oh hell no. 

oh. my. god.  my work got them to come in and cater one of our staff meetings.  it was awesome to be able to order whatever the hell we wanted and not worry about the price :-D.  but with food this good, i wouldn't even worry about the price anyway i guess.

i'm a sweet crepe kind of person ... so i got a nutella crepe (b/c i can't really imagine a crepe without it ...) with strawberries and bananas.  ahhhh.  my friend got strawberries and bananas with carmel sauce - delish, too.  

i'm SO craving one right now ... and drooling.
author: Alexis W.

description: This place is a gold mine. What a brilliant idea to have a portable crepe bus next to bars and Slims. A huge selection of sweet and savory. Can't go wrong with a nutella and banana crepe after a night of drinking.
author: Alyssa C.

description:
it's friday!! although you had planned to have a night in to yourself and wake up early saturday morning for yoga class, your get talked into going out for happy hour right after work. what could it hurt....you figure you'll have one drink, then call it a night. 3 bars, 2 martinis and 3 beers later, somehow it got to be 10:00....and your wasted!!  doh. in your drunken stooper, you realize all you had for dinner was a handful of pretzels and a couple of olives. and now you are being led to some random club on 11th and folsolm with all your drunken co-workers.  what to do?

Crepes A Go-Go once again saves the day!  these guys work magic in that little truck. and they even have couches and a nice little tent to hide in while scarfing down your savory crepe to soak up all that alcohol (my personal favorite has cheese, tomato and avocado). and if that wasn't enough, go back at 2 am for a nutella desert crepe! because now you are in it for the long run, my friend. i heard there's an after hours party that goes till sunrise :)
author: Isabel C.

description: Crepe truck!  YES!  I've been to several crepe places, and this has to be one of the best ones out there.  If you're hungry for something salty, order the House Special.  And if you've got a sweet tooth, my favorite it the nutella and bananas.  And it's a great place to go after the clubs because alcohol definitely makes everything taste better.
author: Jin B.

description: This place makes the best crepes. The best thing is that they are open super late so when you're feeling for something yummy at 12 at night head here!
author: Tina M.

description: This is your best bet for good grub before or after a show at Slims or DNA Lounge. The location is great, the folks are nice, and the crepes are filling without being loaded with grease. Really nice complement to all the drinks you'll be imbibing at the show.
author: Greg K.

description: Awesome.  Not a huge fan of savory crepes, but these are the best I've ever had.  And out of a dumpy truck in SOMA?  Go figure.  The staff is super nice too, even at 4AM.  Highly recommended.
author: Naeem I.

description: I am always half-faded when I ended up here late at night, so my taste bud might be a little off.   If I remember clearly, the crepes here taste much better than other Crepes A Go Go chains or anywhere made by the real French!   I really think Mexican men can cook, not only that they took over all the fast food chains, work the wok at many Asian restaurants, now, they make the best crepes!  I am talking about real crepes here, not wraps!  Seriously, watch out top chefs!  My favorite is Nutella spread with sliced strawberries.
author: patty l.

description:
I've been going here for years and I love it! I usually go there to sober up from a night of clubbing but I finally went without an ounce of alcohol in me and it was still yummy! 

I took off a star for the lack of clean seating and their limited business hours. But they're a hole in the wall and cater to the late night crowd so I can't hold it against them too much. This place is great!
author: G C.

description: Everytime I come to this place I have good memories. I even went to a Crepe a Go Go the other day on Polk Street and it wasn't the same. There is something about being wasted after going to Holy Cow, Butter, or Wish or Loft 11 (or whatever it's called now) and hitting up some crepes. The fact that it's open late is awesome. I love that the owner has a sense of humor also. I always order the House Special because I am a man and I like meat and cheese. I know a lot of people who love the butter, and nutella and whipped cream. I even saw one person order a crepe with just BUtter and Sugar. It's too bad I'm a bit older now but when I was in my mid 20's I always tried to find some excuse to come over here to grub.
author: Nir B.

description: Nothing makes better post clubbing snack than Crepes A Go Go.  I always get nuttella banana strawberry crepe...I always order 3 because you never know when you'll see a cute girl you'd wanna share a crepe with :)
author: The Beef T.

description: The first time i tried crepes was at this cute little meals (crepes) on wheels! I'm glad i went here for my first time because it was so amazing. It was like fireworks in my mouth! I'm actually craving one of their savory crepes now *drooling* and it's a great spot for a late night treat, or if your super hungry after a night of dancing. YUM YUM YUM
author: Suzan L.

description: I honestly don't think this little stand next to Butter opens before 11 p.m. and I don't think I've ever been sober and bought a crepe here. At least not that I remember... Drunk or stoned, the best crepe you'll ever have. I swear to the turkey, cheese and pineapple until the day I die.
author: Michael E.

description: Nothing prevents a hangover the next day like crepe at 2am. These are incredible - drunk or sober. I go the one on 11th after the bars or the one on Kearny for lunch. My fav is the spinach, cheese and egg although....all this talk about the nutella and banana has me thinking I need to try that! YUM!
author: Stephanie I.

description: A late night gem that I don't think of often enough.  Next time I have the munchies at 2 after the bars close, I'm going back there regardless of where I am.   If you're tired of burritoes and diner food as your late night snack, this is definitely the place for you.
author: Rudro S.

description:
This party bus I was on stops at Loft 11 and I already know I'm going to hate it.  So after about 5 minutes inside, I've managed to push, squeeze, and elbow my way about half way deep into the club.  Where I then witness  a group of underage or just turned 18 sheltered suburban kids dancing completely off beat on top of tables and chairs poorly trying to be sexy.  Followed immediately by 2 puking incidents about 10 feet from one another.  I then push, squeeze, and elbow my way back to the door and decide to spend the next 2 hours til the bus comes back elsewhere.  But this isn't about Loft 11... 

The husband and I walked down the street a bit and there it was.  Our saving grace... crepes!  I had almost forgotten it was there.  In my drunken state, it was exactly what I needed.  Yummy crepes in the middle of the night served out of a lil dingy kitchen on wheels. Sweet or savory they have what you need.  There's a covered seating area where discarded couches find that prolonged use and love they so desperately seek.  As I was munching on my crepe, chillin on a comfy couch, we start talking to a couple friendly guys dressed in the preppiest clubbing gear I've seen in a long time.  But nice guys... especially nice since they shared a blunt with us.  My hour and a half spent on those used couches, munching on yummy crepes, meeting cool new people by far beat out anything I woulda experienced had I stayed in Loft 11.  My only gripe is I wish they had a couple space heaters in their couch tent.
author: Jasmine D.

description: Went here two weekends with a buddy of mine after having waaaay to many shots of Vodka and Cognac. Being that it was 2:30 in the morning, the idea of having chesse and dough sitting in my stomach was not appealing. However, once my buddy let me get a whiff of his Turkey and Cranberry sauce crepe with cheese...there was no denying it. It surpassed my expectations of your usual after hours, too much to drink, smoke go to spot. Being that it's in the area of a number of places I frequent when I've had too much to drink, I will definitely be making more trips to this holy grail of late night satisfaction.
author: Kamau W.

description: I had the turkey cranberry crepe - weird, I know, but it's one of those things I crave, so I had to have it. About an hour later, I had the runs and was in and out of the bathroom at Bloodhound (sorry for those of you who were there that night).  My friend had the house special, and he was fine. But I am still in pain. Boo.
author: Shekhar K.

description: These guys are geniuses!  Putting a place that takes to close to nothing to run and keep up right in the heart of the city's night life to cater to the 2am "Dude! Look! Crepes!" drunken crowd from the surrounding clubs is a boon to all.  You would think that the crepes would be substandard given the crown they are catering to but no!  It's even good for us who are sober!
author: Swarup B.

description: Their crepes are disappointing in their excess and execution, yet its a halfway decent option when you're in this part of town late night. You can't really expect too much from a crepe TRUCK, especially when they're already made. It's a good option in that you have plenty of types of fillings to stuff your face with and those comfy, disheveled couches to sit and digest. Disappointing in that their mediocre level, already prepared crepes come overloaded with a sickening amount of bottom-drawer cheese that'll definitely test your intestinal fortitude. The nutella crepe is good for what it is and probably the best thing on the sprawling menu. Was cool to hear some Senegalese and French hip hop blaring from the speakers while lounging about.
author: Chris C.

description:
i can't believe i never wrote a review for this place... it's been a *long* time since I've been here, being that i am old and boring and rarely drive out to the city to go clubbing anymore, but when i did promotions and DNA was one of our regular stops, this was always a favorite...

i have yet to find other crepes places that rival the sheer yum factor and cheap eats that this little roach-coach like trailer produces... and i've tried, believe me i've tried.. many a times when out in the city i've toyed with the idea of just stopping in for the crepes, but parking can be such a pain, i've never actually done it...
author: tina p.

description: Simply put, best drunk food I've ever had.  I had a big, greasy, meaty crepe with sour cream and all sorts of stuff gooped on top, while my girlfriend had a Nutella, banana and strawberry crepe.  Both were phenomenal.  I don't remember much, but i remember saying with a full mouth and sour cream/tomato juices on my shirt that they were the best crepes I've ever had.  Then again, after Holy Cow, the greasy dirty dogs on the corner are pretty damn good too..
author: Dima K.

description:
best lunch on union street.
crepe's are great in general, this one is close to where i live. addictec to crepes :-)
author: Scott K.

description:
crepe truck! crepe truck!  crepe truck time!

an excerpt from Sat. night:

"i want to eat!  let's goooooo!! i hate this place!  i want food!"
"calm down, we're going... the boys are trying to scam on some girls..."
"CREEEPPESSSS!!  me hungry!"
"god, shut her up... "
"special crepe, NOW!"

morale of the story:  feed me when i'm hungry, damn it!  the best place for late night, portable drunk food?  the crepe truck.
author: becky f.

description: Love this place!! Like everyone else said, it is a great place to eat after a night of partying or if you're in the city at night. They have savory crepes and sweet crepes. I either get the spinach, egg, and cheese crepe with tabasco, or the nutella, banana, and whipped cream. The crepes are crispy and it just hits the spot no matter what. It's a trailer in between buildings (right near Butter) with old couches set up under plastic covering. Just find parking around the area, and remember to save about $5 - $6 cash so you have money for it after your night out.
author: Carmen L.

description: I think this is the one I went to when I was in town performing for Rally The Troops 5.  I frickin' LOVE this place.  I can't believe how very flavorful and yummy this was.  I had the sugar and butter crepe and the spinach/feta/olive crepe.  HOLY COW!!!  It was open late for those of us late night folks and it was fast.  The staff is nice and friendly and full of character.
author: Sahara D.

description: Crepes done well.  Particularly the Strawberry Nuetella.  Give it a try and you'll likely be back!
author: Stephen H.

description: SO GOOD!!!! i love the french man that works there too. be careful or you will pass it right by. and try the honey and almond powder crepe, surprisingly delicious.
author: Lisa M.

description: Crepes from the masters of crepe making.  I'm sure they're banking from not having to manage a store.  I seriously don't know the hours of this place.  I remember trying to grab crepes after watching the New Years firsworks at the ferry building, but to my dismay, they were closed.  The crepes though, are wonderful!  First one I ever had here was the spinich & cheese.  Gawd it was soo filling and tasty!  Maybe standing on the sidewalk in pajamas in the middle of the night surrounded by intoxicated crepe lovers helps to intensify the flavors of the crepe!  or...maybe the crepes are just plain ol' tasty!  Whatever the case is, you must at least try the crepes here once.  Only thing I don't think they have is Ice cream for the crepes...someone correct me if I'm wrong! =)
author: LittleBird 8.

description: On a late night hype in the city? hungry? This place is the bomb! Dude makes your crepe rite in front of you, hella bomb crepes. I usually get a savory one and then a sweet one for dessert.
author: Samir M.

description: Serously......I couldn't believe that I can get a crepe at 2 am but it's possible!!!  This is a really good crepe truck and the line after the clubs truly shows it. I highly advise going here to get good eats while your trying to sober up =)
author: Elaine D.

description: I love this little trailer...whenever my husband and I are in the city till the early hours of the morning we stop here before we head home. The crepes are the best both savory and sweet! The guys working are always good for a laugh. If you really want to have some fun ask them to screw with your drunk friends, they don't miss a beat or blink an eye. Or if one of those drunk friends breaks a strap on her heels they will use whatever tools they have to fix it! Unfortunately, unless it is a weekend or happening week night they are not always open and I think you might get Hep C from the couches out front.
author: Shannon L.

description: mm mm!  I love this place!  It might look  a little odd considering they make them out of a trailer, but endure because these crepes are divine...  Great late night food when your drunk, lonely and need something to eat and comfort you all at the same time!
author: Cassie L.

description: Just what the doctor ordered.  In pinballing between the Lonestar and the Eagle on a weekend evening, nothing beats a savory crepe from Crepes a Go-Go (aka the crepe trailer).  When I was first meeting a friend here I passed by it twice not even thinking where I was being directed to was a trailer on the open lot next to Butter.  They typically open around 8p and I haven't tried to come on a weekday, but they are worth a try if you are bar hopping in the neighborhood and get the hungries.
author: Don O.

description: Un-fucking believable, I've got to be the luckiest girl on earth, living two blocks from a late-night crepe truck, and it only took me six months to figure out it was there, thanks to my lovely bartender at the Public, Chris, who used to manage Studio Z. and thus knows the crepe boys by name.  Spinach, mushrooms and cheese, extra tabasco...I don't know who these guys are but they do it right.
author: Arielle G.

description: The best nutella and banana crepe I've ever eaten standing on the sidewalk drunk at 2am .... I love SF.
author: melissa g.

description: Best late night spot EVER!! I never show up earlier than 2am.  You stand out in the cold and order from a trailer window, but its worth it.  I always order cheese, spinach, turkey, avocado and green onion crepe...always...soooo good. so good.
author: Steph S.

description:
crepes at 2am after a hard night of drinking is what i call love. lol!
get the taco one.. i don't know what it goes by exactly.. it's juicy and delicious!! 

it's so freaking good i tend to ignore the flea infested couches (i kid, but they're so gross i wouldn't be surprised).
author: geneive j.

description: If you read some of my previous reviews, you can kinda get the idea that I often will enjoy a cocktail or two or three.. With that being said, this review is based on a visit to the crepe cart after a night of debauchery.  After exiting the club, a lot of us wanted to eat.  If there is no bacon dog cart around, the first thing that comes to mind is CREPE CART!  We zip on down to the cart..low and behold..there's a monster of a line!  My friend says, don't worry.. what do you want?.. SO... I order a savory crepe and the others opted for sweet crepes.  She muscles to the front counter.. barks out the order and in what I believe is less than 5 minutes, we had our crepes.  WTH?  "I know them... "  hahaha whatever works I guess.  WARNING:  watch out for "crepe juice" leaking from the bottom of the crepe!  It will ruin your disco shirt!  As for the Food, It's very well made,  very tasty and hits the right spot at the right time.  Definitely a must try if your clubbin around the area...
author: Alan N.

description: Every bite is orgasmic and addicting like crack! Sauteed chicken or Nutella and strawberries are my favs. I dunno what they put in these crepes but one isn't enough (sprinkle some more crack on it).
author: BrYan W.

description: Really great food...perfect after a night out. I never thought you could have chicken in a crepe but it works. It was a lot like a chicken fajita pita, possibly better though. Definitely recommend if you're around here and hungry after a night out.
author: Mike C.

description: Whoever it was who had the sheer brilliance to put a late-night crepe stop in the SOMA club neighborhood should be sainted.  There's nothing better than a hot nutella crepe on that long drunken stumble home - and even if you find yourself sober, the crepes beat the hell out of Denny's at 3 in the morning.
author: Laura R.

description: After we inhaled the first round of savory crepes, the young french fellow was kind enough to whip up some delicious sweet crepes. wow...banana, coconut, and nutella. heavenly...Sarah gave me the last three bites of hers, oh man. What a good friend. Some french rap playing in the background is always a bonus. I guess this place is open randomly in the late evenings - so try your luck. So worth it.
author: Amy W.

description:
I 've been coming here for quite a while now, sober or not, and i have to say the crepes are not bad for the price, but just watch out for the total price of your crepes since for the first time today i felt ripped off here more than the bars that surround it. I ordered sugar and butter $2.50, chicken with bell pepper $6, and nuttella with banana for $4.50 which comes to a grand total of . . . $16.50.  ?What . . . wait . . .HUH???

I asked why the total price doesn't add up right, he said it's because of taxes. Excuse me ?. . .But since when did tax in SF amount to 27%, specially on consumable goods. No wonder the crepes i ordered wasn't even rung up individually, but instead he entered a magical number of $16.50 in the register. I guess in good gesture he tried to give me back what i thought was missing in change . . . yes of course after you've been caught. I do tip them all the time so i will just rationalize it in my tiny head that it was a new rule they have, on Thursday nights. Will i come back? Yeah, maybe but just to order one crepe at a time AND WITH MY POCKET CALCULATOR.
author: Wes R.

description: horrible service, long waits and my girl friend got food poisoning for 3 days after.  dislike.
author: Barclay S.

description: like other yelpers reviews, i don't remember eating it cos my friends and i were inebriated.
author: Pickle R.

description:
awesome snacks, great crowd, great staff.  i appreciate that there was a different person handling my money than was handling my food.  i don't know how they stock so many different ingredients back there.  there must be more square footage hidden in the back. 

there are a few things i think they could improve upon, which i humbly offer as friendly feedback.

some of the toppings are light (green onions for example) but most are shared freely.  the carmelized onions are not carmelized. sometimes the nutella doesn't get warmed all the way thru, & it's so awesome warm & softened. however, once you go a few times you get the hang of ordering what works for you & you're home free.

they've been mysteriously closed sometimes on tuesdays lately, which they advertise as being open. lastly, i wish they wouldn't wait on people who are cutting the line.  it's not their job to monitor the line like a hawk, but when there's a designated order-taker, &/or when it's obvious, i think they could ignore the buillies & reward the patiently-waiting hungry devotees instead.

they get four stars because it's  the best late-night food scene in the city, whether you're exiting a club in the neighborhood or driving from elsewhere. great people watching, you can stand & munch, no bright lighting.  who doesn't love yummy finger food at that hour.
author: Harmony L.

description: Best late night crepes in the city. Don't be fooled by the trailer they make these in, these crepes HIT the spot whether its 1am, 2am, 3am...savory or sweet, travel the distance no matter where you are in the city for this late night snack.
author: Padma K.

description: drunken crepes are the best after clubbing snack!!  this little trailer is located across the street from the dna lounge making it an ideal stubbling ground for clubbers in the neighborhood.. the guy who owns crepes a go go is really nice!!  we were short a few bucks and he let it slide.. i ordered the turkey, cheese and avocado crepe.  it was so good!!  hot and fresh and the perfect pick-me-up after a long night of endless drinks!!
author: Ali C.

description: Open till 4am with an extensive menu of any crepe imagineable!  Pretty awesome.
author: Karen F.

description: after going out til late, this place seriously hits the spot.  yesterday we got the nutella w/ strawberry and it was so good that we got another crepe w/ nutella and bananas.  a very long line forms around 2 am once the bars close, but the guys here move swiftly, and service is great!!  yum!!
author: Helen T.

description: been here twice. both times ... yep, you guessed it, drunk out of my skull! both times these wonderful crepes were like a godsend ... nursing me back to semi-soberness ... oh yeah, and they were delicious as hell. you might ask yourself, well, when you're drunk you'll eat anything and love it - a prime example of that is ordering mr. pizza man at 3 am and loving it - but seriously, this place is the real deal. i need to try this place when i'm in a sober state. anyways, that's that.
author: James J.

description: perfect late night snack to eat especially when you're outside trying to get some air after partyin' at remedy dna lounge. i always get the dessert crepe with bananas and strawberry with nutella and whipped cream!
author: Mika D.

description: My friend and I go to the DNA club for the New Wave City party and everytime we go.. it's a tradition to eat here!! I LOVE this place. I always get the Spinach, Egg, and Mushrooms crepe. It's SO GOOD! The workers, I believe are French.. Love the Accent and when you eat there.. they have cool music playing. I miss the couches they used to have!!
author: Kalena L.

description: the crepes are AMAZING! especially at 2am. i ordered a savory crepe with eggs and sausage (i think) and my boyfriend ordered a sweet crepe with nutella & banana. anyway, we'd take a few bites of our own crepe and then switch off back and forth so it's really the best of both worlds! it's right by holy cow too and it's only outdoor seating/standing.
author: Janice F.

description: don't be deceived by the fact that it's a roach coach, this place is absolute gold!!!!!!!!!!!
author: Perri B.

description: after watching a show at slim's, this is one of the perfect places to go after....one real funny story is the guy making the crepes went into one of the clubs and hurried outside when he saw some customers lining up.
author: Michael R.

description:
crepe pretty good, experience fairly retarded. it was my first time there and wasn't in the mood to be made to look like a fool, but i was. the guy joked that they were out, which i hear happens to a lot of people. fine, but i don't know how many other new customers appreciate feeling like assholes. 
then the guy misheard my order and punched into the cash register the price of a more expensive crepe.  when I pointed this out to him, he stared at the menu for a while, then gave me some dumb ass excuse about how they charge a dollar extra for bananas...on my honey BANANA crepe.   wtf.
maybe my problem is that i don't drink.
author: Kan L.

description: I visited this place around 2am one night after a little bar hopping.  I enjoyed a delicious desert crepe with Strawberries, whipped cream, Nutella, and almonds.  Amazing.  The crepes easily rival what I had in France, plus many more topping options are available than the traditional.  The guys were fast and very courteous.  I wish there was something like this where I live.
author: Mark D.

description: Horrible. Of course this place has good reviews! It was cus it was surround by a bunch of clubs. Which was smart! But still horrible. Of course when your drunk everything taste A-M-A-Z-I-N-G.. But if your sober it taste horrible.. Know i wouldn't say Horrible! But i know im not going to go there again! I couldn't even finish my crepe! And it was my first time ever eating a crepe! I was not happy. I ended giving it up to my sister. And i don't think the price is reasonable.  I mean i think they are smart for putting there business in front of a bunch of clubs.. Thats smart. But the price is just not reasonable. i don't remember how much it was but i think it was 3,4,5 dollars? I'm not sure. But all I could say is I'm not going there again. If you sober i suggest you don't waste your money on that.  Also it was hard to find it. I mean it was in an alley almost in a cart.. When me and my friends got there we couldn't find it and thought they closed down. But then we found it.. Also gets saugy fast. All i know is i am not going to be going there again.
author: Michelle T.

description: Stumbling into this place made our night.  Delicious crepes.  Sadly the staff was not French as at the other location.
author: B B.

description: perfect late night snack, perfect alternative to my other favorite late night snack (quesadilla of course).  french accents with a favorite late night snack, yes perfect.
author: Today Y.

description: ok another place to go to when it's late and the weekend and yes, once again you're drunk.  man does it hit the spot.  my favorite is the cheese, tomato and avocado.  get it.
author: a g.

description: i LOVE this place...the food is awesome i love the savory crepes....hate that its only open late...but well worth the wait...try to go early before the clubs and bars let out or u will be in for a  long long wait and have a whole bunch of drunkies around.
author: LaLa n.

description: so i "stumbled" across this place while waLKING through the area with one of my girlfriends. okay, so i know the guy who happened to be working there. nevertheless, i have never in my life tried a crepe. he made me a nutella banana. and let me say, i HATE chocolate. but i was in heaven for about 3 mins. (thats how long it took for me to finish) :) thats all i can say. GO CREPES A GO GO!
author: Sephora X.

description: used to come here alot after a late night at the public resto lounge (too bad they closed recently). usually my options are either a $4 crepe with turkey, avo, spinach and cheese, or a bacon wrapped hot dog from the amigo in the cart next to loft 11 (party bus central). passing up a bacon wrapped hotdog aint no joke.
author: boston j.

description: i've eaten here once.. and it's oh so good! i ate the ham and cheese! delicious! i just dont know what time and day it is open.. i think this one's near the old insomnia.. as of what i remember
author: carlo c.
